translated: In Sanskrit:

original: s'u tra aa lam k'a ra bya khyam /
analyzed: s'u tra aa lam k'a ra bya khyam /

original: bod skad du //
analyzed: bod skad du //

original: mdo sde'i rgyan gyi bshad pa /
analyzed: mdo sde'i rgyan gyi bshad pa /

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: don shes don ston rab tu byed pa dag dang tshig rnams dri med pas //
analyzed: don shes don ston rab tu byed pa dag dang tshig rnams dri med pas //
translated: With stainless words and phrases, the one who knows the meaning and teaches the meaning,🔽Out of compassion for suffering beings, in order to liberate them from suffering,

original: sdug bsngal bsgral phyir sdug bsngal 'gro la snying rje'i phyir te de'i bdag nyid //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgral phyir sdug bsngal 'gro la snying rje'i phyir te de'i bdag nyid //

original: theg mchog bstan pa'i rnam pa chos kyi de yis 'gro ba'i sems can la //🔽'byor ba'i don tshul bla med gyur ba lang yi bdag nyid ston par byad //
analyzed: theg mchog bstan pa'i rnam pa chos kyi de yis 'gro ba'i sems can la // 'byor ba'i don tshul bla med gyur ba lang yi bdag nyid ston par byad //
translated: He teaches the supreme vehicle, the meaning of which is unsurpassed.

original: don shes don ston rab tu byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ci zhes bstan pa las brtsams pa yin no //
analyzed: don shes don ston rab tu byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ci zhes bstan pa las brtsams pa yin no //
translated: The phrase the one who knows the meaning and teaches the meaning and so on begins the teaching.

original: su zhig brgyan par byed ce na /
analyzed: su zhig brgyan par byed ce na /
translated: Who is the one who adorns?

original: don shes pa'o / rgyan ci zhig brgyan par byed ce na /
analyzed: don shes pa'o / rgyan ci zhig brgyan par byed ce na /
translated: The one who knows the meaning. With what does he adorn?

original: don ston rab tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: don ston rab tu byed pa'o //
translated: With the teaching of the meaning.

original: ces she na //
analyzed: ces she na //
translated: Why?🔽 Because of compassion for suffering beings, in order to liberate them from suffering.🔽 For the sake of those beings who go by that path,🔽 he teaches the supreme vehicle, the meaning of which is unsurpassed.🔽 The phrase the one who knows the meaning and teaches the meaning and so on begins the teaching.

original: ngag dang tshig rnams dri med pas te /
analyzed: ngag dang tshig rnams dri med pas te /
translated: because of his pure speech and words.

original: ngag dri ma med pas zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: ngag dri ma med pas zhes bya ba ni //
translated: Pure speech means

original: grong khyer pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: grong khyer pa la sogs pas so //
translated: that he is not a townsman, etc.

original: tshig dri ma med pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshig dri ma med pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Pure words means

original: tshig dang yi ge rigs pa dang 'brel ba zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge rigs pa dang 'brel ba zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ba ste /
translated: that his words and syllables are appropriate, as it is said at length.

original: ngag dang tshig dang yi ge dag pa med par ni don bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: ngag dang tshig dang yi ge dag pa med par ni don bstan par mi nus so //
translated: Without pure speech, words, and syllables, it is impossible to teach the meaning.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na //
translated: Why is that?

original: sdug bsngal bsgral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgral ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to liberate from suffering.

original: ro // gang las she na //
analyzed: ro // gang las she na //
translated: From what?

original: sdug bsngal 'gro la snying rje'i phyir te //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gro la snying rje'i phyir te //
translated: From the suffering of the world, out of compassion.

original: de'i bdag gnyid sdug bsngal ba'i 'gro ba la snying rje ba gang yin ba'i snying rje de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag gnyid sdug bsngal ba'i 'gro ba la snying rje ba gang yin ba'i snying rje de'i phyir ro //
translated: The compassion of the bodhisattva is the compassion that is the essence of the world's suffering.

original: de'i bdag ces bya ba ni snying rje'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de'i bdag ces bya ba ni snying rje'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The essence of that means the essence of compassion.

original: ci zhig gi rgyan du byed ce na //
analyzed: ci zhig gi rgyan du byed ce na //
translated: What is it that is adorned?

original: theg mchog bstan pa'i rnam pa chos kyi ste /
analyzed: theg mchog bstan pa'i rnam pa chos kyi ste /
translated: The Dharma, which is the teaching of the supreme vehicle.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs gang la theg pa mchog bstan pa'i rnam pa yod pa'i chos de'i'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs gang la theg pa mchog bstan pa'i rnam pa yod pa'i chos de'i'o //
translated: That Dharma-discourse which has the aspect of the teaching of the supreme vehicle is the Dharma of the Bodhisattvas.

original: gang gi ched du brgyan par byad ce na /
analyzed: gang gi ched du brgyan par byad ce na /
translated: For whose sake is it adorned?

original: des 'gro ba'i sems can la'o //
analyzed: des 'gro ba'i sems can la'o //
translated: For the beings who go by it.

original: la zhes bya ba 'di ni ched yin te /
analyzed: la zhes bya ba 'di ni ched yin te /
translated: The suffix “-ta” has the sense of “for the sake of.”

original: theg pa chen pos 'gro ba'i sems can gyi ched du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: theg pa chen pos 'gro ba'i sems can gyi ched du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “for the sake of the beings who go by the Great Vehicle.”

original: rgyan rnam pa du zhig gis brgyan par byed ce na /
analyzed: rgyan rnam pa du zhig gis brgyan par byed ce na /
translated: By how many kinds of adornments is it adorned?

original: rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: By five kinds.

original: 'byor ba'i don tshul bla med gyur ba rnam pa lnga'i bdag nyid ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'byor ba'i don tshul bla med gyur ba rnam pa lnga'i bdag nyid ston par byed do //
translated: It shows the fivefold nature of the meaning of the method of endowment.

original: 'byor ba zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byor ba zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'o //
translated: “Endowment” means reason.

original: bla med gyur ba zhes bya ba ni theg pa bla na med par gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bla med gyur ba zhes bya ba ni theg pa bla na med par gtogs pa'o //
translated: “The supreme” means belonging to the supreme vehicle.🔽Now, by the second verse, it shows the fivefold nature of the meaning of the method.🔽Like gold that is beaten, like a blossoming lotus,🔽like a full vessel,🔽like a treasure, like a tree,

original: da ni don gyi tshul lnga'i bdag nyid de tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas ston par byed de //
analyzed: da ni don gyi tshul lnga'i bdag nyid de tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas ston par byed de //
translated: like a great king, like the ocean,🔽like a mountain, like a vajra,🔽like a medicine, like a friend,🔽like a wish-fulfilling gem, like the sun,

original: gser las brdungs byas 'dra zhing padma rgyas pa bzhin //
analyzed: gser las brdungs byas 'dra zhing padma rgyas pa bzhin //
translated: like a cloud, like a song,🔽like a council, like a road,🔽like a conveyance, like a reservoir,🔽like a carriage, like a mother,🔽like a nurse, like a servant,🔽like a friend, like a companion,🔽like a river, like a lamp,🔽like a bridge, like a boat,🔽like a fountain, like a sword,🔽like a weapon, like a thunderbolt,🔽like a lion, like an elephant,🔽like a bull, like a bharunda bird,🔽like a goose, like a peacock,🔽like a cuckoo, like a swan,🔽like a parrot, like a mynah bird,🔽like a peacock, like a peacock’s cry,🔽like a drum, like a conch,🔽like a lute, like a flute,🔽like a song, like a dance,🔽like a jewel, like a flower,🔽like a lamp, like a torch,🔽like a moon, like a star,🔽like a sun, like a cloud,🔽like a rain, like a lightning,🔽like a wish-fulfilling gem, like a tree,🔽like a wish-fulfilling cow, like a treasure,🔽like a queen, like a minister,🔽like a general, like an elephant,🔽like a horse, like a chariot,🔽like a foot soldier, like a wheel,

original: bkres @130a * //
analyzed: bkres @130a * //
translated: like a jewel,

original: pas nyen pa g-yos legs kha zas zab 'dra //
analyzed: pas nyen pa g-yos legs kha zas zab 'dra //
translated: and the food of the poor is like a good broth.🔽

original: 'phrin yig legs pa thos 'dra rin chen sgrom phye ltar //
analyzed: 'phrin yig legs pa thos 'dra rin chen sgrom phye ltar //
translated: like a good meal for the hungry, like a treasure chest opened.

original: chos de 'dir bshad pa yang dga' ba'i mchog bskyed do //
analyzed: chos de 'dir bshad pa yang dga' ba'i mchog bskyed do //
translated: This Dharma, taught here, produces the highest joy.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni dpe ldas chos de'i don rnam par lnga'i dbang du byas nas ston te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni dpe ldas chos de'i don rnam par lnga'i dbang du byas nas ston te /
translated: This verse shows the meaning of the Dharma through ten similes, in terms of five kinds of objects:

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang / bye brag tu shes par bya ba dang / bsam par bya ba dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / yongs su grub pa rtogs pa'i don so so rang gis rig par bya ba byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang / bye brag tu shes par bya ba dang / bsam par bya ba dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / yongs su grub pa rtogs pa'i don so so rang gis rig par bya ba byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: the object to be accomplished, the object to be understood, the object to be reflected on, the inconceivable object, and the object to be realized, which is the self-realization of the perfected state, the essence of the factors of awakening.

original: de mdo sde'i rgyan 'dis rnam par 'grol na go rims bzhin du //
analyzed: de mdo sde'i rgyan 'dis rnam par 'grol na go rims bzhin du //
translated: When those are explained by this Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras, they are like

original: gser las brdungs byas pa la sogs pa lta bu yin la /
analyzed: gser las brdungs byas pa la sogs pa lta bu yin la /
translated: gold, a precious gem, a flower, a fruit, a medicine, a vajra, a song, a treasure chest, a tree, and a cloud.

original: mdo sde'i rgyan 'dis rnam par phye na dga' ba'i mchog bskyed do //
analyzed: mdo sde'i rgyan 'dis rnam par phye na dga' ba'i mchog bskyed do //
translated: When they are explained by this Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras, they produce the highest joy.

original: gang gi tshe chos de rang bzhin gyis yon tan dang ldan pa yin na //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos de rang bzhin gyis yon tan dang ldan pa yin na //
translated: When a phenomenon is endowed with intrinsic qualities,🔽how can it be adorned?

original: ji ltar de brgyan par byed ces bya ba'i klan ka 'di yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar de brgyan par byed ces bya ba'i klan ka 'di yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to completely avoid this objection,

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa ste /
translated: the third verse is stated:

original: gzugs rgyan rang bzhin yon tan ldan pa me long nang song na //
analyzed: gzugs rgyan rang bzhin yon tan ldan pa me long nang song na //
translated: When a form endowed with intrinsic qualities as an ornament enters a mirror,

original: mthong ba'i dbang gis mi rnams rab tu dga' ba'i mchog bskyed pa //
analyzed: mthong ba'i dbang gis mi rnams rab tu dga' ba'i mchog bskyed pa //
translated: it generates the supreme joy of people through being seen.

original: de bzhin legs gsungs rtag tu rang bzhin yon tan ldan pa yi //
analyzed: de bzhin legs gsungs rtag tu rang bzhin yon tan ldan pa yi //
translated: In the same way, the well-spoken Dharma, which is always endowed with intrinsic qualities,

original: chos kyang don rnams phye bas mkhas rnams 'di na dga' mchog bskyed //
analyzed: chos kyang don rnams phye bas mkhas rnams 'di na dga' mchog bskyed //
translated: when its meaning is analyzed, generates the supreme joy of the wise in this world.

original: 'dis ci ston zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis ci ston zhe na /
translated: What does this show?🔽For example, when a form endowed with intrinsic qualities as an ornament enters a mirror, it generates the supreme joy of people through being seen.

original: dper na gzugs brgyan dang rang bzhin nyid kyis yon tan dang ldan pa me long gi nang du song na mthong ba'i dbang gis rab tu dga' ba'i mchog bskyed pa de bzhin du //
analyzed: dper na gzugs brgyan dang rang bzhin nyid kyis yon tan dang ldan pa me long gi nang du song na mthong ba'i dbang gis rab tu dga' ba'i mchog bskyed pa de bzhin du //
translated: In the same way,

original: legs par gsungs pa dag gis rtag tu yon tan dang ldan pa'i chos de yang don rnam par phye ba blo dang ldan pa rnams la dga' ba khyad par can bskyed de /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa dag gis rtag tu yon tan dang ldan pa'i chos de yang don rnam par phye ba blo dang ldan pa rnams la dga' ba khyad par can bskyed de /
translated: The Dharma, which is always endowed with good qualities, is well-spoken. It generates a special joy in the wise who understand its meaning.

original: de bas na dga' ba'i khyad par can bskyed pa'i phyir brgyan pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na dga' ba'i khyad par can bskyed pa'i phyir brgyan pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because it generates a special joy, it is like an ornament.

original: de'i 'og tu tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis chos de la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir phan yon rnam pa gsum ston te /🔽ji ltar bsnams na rab dku la //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis chos de la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir phan yon rnam pa gsum ston te / ji ltar bsnams na rab dku la //
translated: Then, in the next three verses, he shows three kinds of benefits in order to generate respect for that Dharma.🔽Like medicine, whose smell is unpleasant

original: myangs na zhim pa'i sman bzhin du //
analyzed: myangs na zhim pa'i sman bzhin du //
translated: but which is delicious when tasted,

original: chos kyang de bzhin gnyis su gnas //
analyzed: chos kyang de bzhin gnyis su gnas //
translated: so the Dharma exists in two ways.

original: don dang yi ge shes par bya //
analyzed: don dang yi ge shes par bya //
translated: One should know its meaning and its words.

original: chos dka' rgya chen zab mo 'di //
analyzed: chos dka' rgya chen zab mo 'di //
translated: This Dharma is difficult, vast, and profound.

original: rgyal po bzhin du mnyes par dka' //
analyzed: rgyal po bzhin du mnyes par dka' //
translated: Like a king, it is hard to please.

original: mnyes par byas na de bzhin du //
analyzed: mnyes par byas na de bzhin du //
translated: But when it is pleased,

original: yon tan mchog gis nor sbyin byed /
analyzed: yon tan mchog gis nor sbyin byed /
translated: it gives the wealth of supreme good qualities.

original: rin chen rigs ldan rin thang med //
analyzed: rin chen rigs ldan rin thang med //
translated: A priceless jewel of the highest lineage

original: lta mi @130b shes pa'i mi mi mgu //
analyzed: lta mi @130b shes pa'i mi mi mgu //
translated: does not please those who do not know how to appreciate it.

original: de bzhin mi mkhas chos 'di la //
analyzed: de bzhin mi mkhas chos 'di la //
translated: Likewise, when the unwise are turned away from this Dharma,

original: zlog na de bzhin mgu bar 'gyur //
analyzed: zlog na de bzhin mgu bar 'gyur //
translated: they become pleased in just the same way.

original: phan yon rnam par gsum la /
analyzed: phan yon rnam par gsum la /
translated: The benefits are threefold:

original: snam gyi dpes ni sgrib pa spong ba'i rgyu nyid de //
analyzed: snam gyi dpes ni sgrib pa spong ba'i rgyu nyid de //
translated: By the example of the cloth, it is the cause for the elimination of obscurations,

original: gnyis su gnas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis su gnas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Dwelling in two ways” means

original: yi ge dang don du rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge dang don du rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: dwelling in the letters and in the meanings.

original: rgyal po'i dpes ni dbang 'byor ba'i rgyu nyid de /
analyzed: rgyal po'i dpes ni dbang 'byor ba'i rgyu nyid de /
translated: By the example of the king, it is the cause for mastery,

original: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can rnams kyis dbang phyug sbyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can rnams kyis dbang phyug sbyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it bestows lordship over the special qualities such as the superknowledges.

original: rin po che rigs dang ldan pa'i ring thang med pa'i dpes ni /
analyzed: rin po che rigs dang ldan pa'i ring thang med pa'i dpes ni /
translated: By the example of the jewel mine, it is the cause for the enjoyment of the wealth of the noble ones,

original: 'phags pa'i nor la spyod pa'i rgyu nyid de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i nor la spyod pa'i rgyu nyid de /
translated: because it is the cause for the enjoyment of the wealth of the noble ones.

original: de ltar shes pa'i mi ni 'phags pa'i skye bo yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes pa'i mi ni 'phags pa'i skye bo yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One who knows it in this way should be known as a noble person.

original: dang po'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: dang po'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The first chapter is completed.

original: // / kha cig theg pa chen po 'di sangs rgyas kyi bka' yang ma yin na /
analyzed: // / kha cig theg pa chen po 'di sangs rgyas kyi bka' yang ma yin na /
translated: Some say: If this Mahayana is not the word of the Buddha,

original: de la phan yon 'di lta ga la yod ces log par zhugs pa de dag la 'di sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la phan yon 'di lta ga la yod ces log par zhugs pa de dag la 'di sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to prove to them that this is the word of the Buddha, the following verse is stated.

original: gtan tshigs rnam par dbye ba las brtsams te tshigs su bcang pa //
analyzed: gtan tshigs rnam par dbye ba las brtsams te tshigs su bcang pa //
translated: The reasonings are stated in the chapter on the divisions of the reasons.

original: sngar lung ma bstan lhan cig byung //
analyzed: sngar lung ma bstan lhan cig byung //
translated: The Buddha did not previously prophesy it, it arose together with the Mahayana,

original: spyod yul ma yin grub pa dang // yod dang med na yod med dang // gnyen po dang ni sgra gzhan phyir //
analyzed: spyod yul ma yin grub pa dang // yod dang med na yod med dang // gnyen po dang ni sgra gzhan phyir //
translated: it is not the domain of the Sravakas, it is established, it is not existent or nonexistent when the other exists or does not, it has antidotes, and it has different words.

original: sngar lung ma bstan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngar lung ma bstan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Buddha did not previously prophesy it.

original: gal te 'di dam pa'i chos kyi bar chad byed par phyis 'ga' zhig gis phyung ba yin na //
analyzed: gal te 'di dam pa'i chos kyi bar chad byed par phyis 'ga' zhig gis phyung ba yin na //
translated: If this Mahayana was later created by someone to obstruct the holy Dharma,

original: ci'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i 'jigs pa bzhin du snga nas lung ma bstan /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i 'jigs pa bzhin du snga nas lung ma bstan /
translated: why did the Buddha not previously prophesy it as if it were a future fear?🔽It arose together with the Mahayana.

original: lhan cig byung zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po nyan thos kyi theg pa dang dus mnyam du byang bar dmigs kyi /
analyzed: lhan cig byung zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po nyan thos kyi theg pa dang dus mnyam du byang bar dmigs kyi /
translated: The Mahayana is observed to have arisen at the same time as the Sravakayana,

original: phyis ni ma yin na ji ltar 'di sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin pa nyid du shes /
analyzed: phyis ni ma yin na ji ltar 'di sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin pa nyid du shes /
translated: not later. How can it be known that this is not the word of the Buddha?

original: spyod yul ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: spyod yul ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “not within the range of experience” means that

original: de ltar zab cing rgya che ba'i chos 'di ni rtog ge pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar zab cing rgya che ba'i chos 'di ni rtog ge pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin te /
translated: this Dharma, which is so profound and vast, is not within the range of experience of those who are logicians.

original: mu stegs can rnams kyi bstan bcos la de ltar bu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams kyi bstan bcos la de ltar bu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because such a Dharma is not found in the treatises of the tīrthikas.

original: brjod du zin kyang de la ma mos pa'i phyir 'di gzhan dag gis bshad do zhes bya bar yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: brjod du zin kyang de la ma mos pa'i phyir 'di gzhan dag gis bshad do zhes bya bar yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Even if it were, it would not be suitable for others to explain it, because they would not have faith in it.

original: grub pa zhes bya ba ni 'on te gzhan zhig gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas bshad do zhe na ni 'di sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin pa nyid du grub ste /
analyzed: grub pa zhes bya ba ni 'on te gzhan zhig gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas bshad do zhe na ni 'di sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin pa nyid du grub ste /
translated: The phrase “it is established” means that if someone else had attained complete buddhahood and then explained it, it would still be the word of the Buddha.

original: gang zhig mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: gang zhig mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: This is because the one who attains complete buddhahood

original: de skad du 'chad pa de nyid sangs rgyas yin no //
analyzed: de skad du 'chad pa de nyid sangs rgyas yin no //
translated: and then explains it is a buddha.

original: yod dang med na yod med dang // zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yod dang med na yod med dang // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “it is not tenable that it exists or does not exist” means that

original: gal te theg pa chen po cung zad cig yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te theg pa chen po cung zad cig yod na ni /
translated: if the Mahāyāna exists in some way,

original: @131a * // de yod dang 'di sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin par grub ste /
analyzed: @131a * // de yod dang 'di sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin par grub ste /
translated: That exists and this is the word of the Buddha,

original: 'di las gzhan pa'i theg pa chen po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las gzhan pa'i theg pa chen po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other Great Vehicle.

original: 'on te med na ni de med dang nyan thos kyi theg pa yang med pas nyan thos kyi theg pa ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin gyi theg pa chen po ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'on te med na ni de med dang nyan thos kyi theg pa yang med pas nyan thos kyi theg pa ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin gyi theg pa chen po ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de yang mi rung ste /
translated: But if it does not exist, then since the Disciple Vehicle also would not exist, it would not be proper to say that the Disciple Vehicle is the word of the Buddha, but the Great Vehicle is not.

original: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa med par sangs rgyas rnams mi 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa med par sangs rgyas rnams mi 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without the Buddha Vehicle, there would be no Buddhas.

original: gnyen po zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po bsgoms na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen por 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyen po zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po bsgoms na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen por 'gyur te /
translated: The antidote is the Great Vehicle, because when it is cultivated, it becomes the antidote to the passions by becoming the basis of all nonimaginative wisdom.

original: de lta bas na sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin no //
translated: Therefore it is the word of the Buddha.

original: sgra gzhan phyir zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin gyi don ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra gzhan phyir zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin gyi don ma yin no //
translated: The other sound is not literal.

original: de lta bas na sgra ji bzhin gyi don gyi rjes su 'brangs nas 'da  sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin par rig par ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na sgra ji bzhin gyi don gyi rjes su 'brangs nas 'da  sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin par rig par ni mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not conclude that this is not the word of the Buddha by following the literal meaning.

original: la la sngar lung ma bstan zhes bshad pa gang yin pa bcom ldan 'das kyis ched du ma dgongs nas ma 'ongs pa 'di lung ma bstan par zad do snyam du sems pa la btang snyoms su gzhag tu mi rung bar tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: la la sngar lung ma bstan zhes bshad pa gang yin pa bcom ldan 'das kyis ched du ma dgongs nas ma 'ongs pa 'di lung ma bstan par zad do snyam du sems pa la btang snyoms su gzhag tu mi rung bar tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Some think that the Buddha did not prophesy the future because he did not intend to, not because he did not know it. To refute that, the verse says:

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon sum spyan //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon sum spyan //
translated: The Buddhas have eyes of knowledge🔽that see the future.

original: bstan pa dag kyang bsrung bar mdzad //
analyzed: bstan pa dag kyang bsrung bar mdzad //
translated: They protect the teachings.

original: dus la'ang ye shes ma bsgribs pa //
analyzed: dus la'ang ye shes ma bsgribs pa //
translated: Their knowledge of time is unobstructed.

original: de phyir btang snyoms mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de phyir btang snyoms mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, indifference is not appropriate.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ci zhig ston zhe na /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ci zhig ston zhe na /
translated: What does this verse show?

original: rgyu gsum gyis ma 'ongs pa na bstan pa la gnod pa chen po la btang snyoms su gzhag tu mi rung bar ston te /
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis ma 'ongs pa na bstan pa la gnod pa chen po la btang snyoms su gzhag tu mi rung bar ston te /
translated: It shows that indifference is not appropriate with regard to the great harm to the teachings in the future for three reasons.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon sum pa'i spyan nyid kyis 'bad pa mi mnga' bar ye shes 'jug pa'i phyir dang / bstan pa bsrung bar bya ba la 'bad pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / dus thams cad la ye shes thogs pa mi mnga' pa nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa mkhyen pa'i mthus so //🔽la la yod dang med na yod med phyir //🔽zhes bshad pa gang yin pa nyan thos kyi theg pa 'di nyid theg pa chen po yin pas 'di kho nas byang chub chen po 'thob bo snyam du sems pas de'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa /🔽theg pa chen po nyid du mi rung bar tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon sum pa'i spyan nyid kyis 'bad pa mi mnga' bar ye shes 'jug pa'i phyir dang / bstan pa bsrung bar bya ba la 'bad pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / dus thams cad la ye shes thogs pa mi mnga' pa nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa mkhyen pa'i mthus so // la la yod dang med na yod med phyir // zhes bshad pa gang yin pa nyan thos kyi theg pa 'di nyid theg pa chen po yin pas 'di kho nas byang chub chen po 'thob bo snyam du sems pas de'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa / theg pa chen po nyid du mi rung bar tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Because the Buddhas, with their eye of direct intuition, engage their intuition effortlessly, and because they are endowed with effort in order to protect the teaching, and because they have the power to know the future by means of their unobstructed intuition at all times.🔽Some think that the Mahayana is not the word of the Buddha because it teaches things not found in the śrāvaka vehicle, such as the three natures, the eight consciousnesses, the five bases of the mental faculty, the ten stages, the six clairvoyances, the thirty-four buddha bodies, the four kinds of gnosis, and so on.

original: ma tshang ba dang 'gal ba dang // thabs min de ltar ma bstan phyir //
analyzed: ma tshang ba dang 'gal ba dang // thabs min de ltar ma bstan phyir //
translated: To respond, Aryavimuktisena and Haribhadra explain that the Mahayana is the word of the Buddha because it is the antidote to the afflictions, because it is the antidote to the view of the transitory collection, because it teaches the three natures, because it teaches the five bases of the mental faculty, because it teaches the ten stages, because it teaches the six clairvoyances, because it teaches the thirty-four buddha bodies, because it teaches the four kinds of gnosis, and because it teaches the four kinds of correct knowledge.

original: nyan thos kyi ni theg pa 'di //🔽theg chen chos zhes bya ba min //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi ni theg pa 'di // theg chen chos zhes bya ba min //
translated: The first of these is the antidote to the afflictions.

original: ma tshang ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma tshang ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The second is the antidote to the view of the transitory collection.

original: gzhan gyi don du bstan pa @131b ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du bstan pa @131b ste /
translated: It is taught for the benefit of others.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa las ni nyan thos rnams bdag nyid skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba tsam gyi thabs shig bstan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don du bstan pa ci yang med la /🔽rang gi don kho na gzhan dag la bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa las ni nyan thos rnams bdag nyid skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba tsam gyi thabs shig bstan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don du bstan pa ci yang med la / rang gi don kho na gzhan dag la bstan pa ni /
translated: In the Sravakayana, there is nothing at all taught for the benefit of others, because the method for attaining mere liberation for oneself, through disenchantment and detachment, is taught.

original: gzhan gyi don du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not suitable that one's own aim be taught to others.

original: 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan rang gi don la sbyor ba na rang gi don kho na la rab tu sbyor ba yin la /
analyzed: 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan rang gi don la sbyor ba na rang gi don kho na la rab tu sbyor ba yin la /
translated: The contradiction is that when others are engaged in their own aim, they are engaged in their own aim alone.

original: bdag nyid mya ngan las 'da' ba'i don du rab tu sbyor bde bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal te /
analyzed: bdag nyid mya ngan las 'da' ba'i don du rab tu sbyor bde bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal te /
translated: But it is contradictory to say that one who is engaged in the aim of attaining nirvana will fully awaken to unsurpassable, perfect enlightenment.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa kho nas ni byang chub kyi phyir ring mo zhig tu 'bad kyang sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa kho nas ni byang chub kyi phyir ring mo zhig tu 'bad kyang sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: For the sake of enlightenment, even though one strives for a long time by means of the Disciple Vehicle alone, it is not fit to become a Buddha.

original: thabs min zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi thabs ma yin no //
analyzed: thabs min zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi thabs ma yin no //
translated: The phrase “not the means” means that the Disciple Vehicle is not the means to Buddhahood.

original: thabs ma yin pa ni ring mo zhig tu btsal kyang 'dod pa'i don 'thob bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa ni ring mo zhig tu btsal kyang 'dod pa'i don 'thob bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not the means, then even though one strives for a long time, one would not attain the desired goal,

original: rva la sogs pa las 'jo ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rva la sogs pa las 'jo ba bzhin no //
translated: just as one would not get milk from a horn.

original: 'on te 'dir byang chub sems dpas ji ltar bslab bar bya ba gzhan du'ang bstan to zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'dir byang chub sems dpas ji ltar bslab bar bya ba gzhan du'ang bstan to zhe na /
translated: But if it is taught elsewhere how the Bodhisattva should train, then the Disciple Vehicle is not fit to be the Great Vehicle.

original: de ltar ma bstan phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa kho na theg pa chen po yin par ni mi 'os te /
analyzed: de ltar ma bstan phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa kho na theg pa chen po yin par ni mi 'os te /
translated: It is not fit to be the Great Vehicle because it is not taught in that way,

original: 'di las de lta bu bstan pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'di las de lta bu bstan pa mi dmigs so //
translated: since such a teaching is not found in it.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang theg pa chen po phan tshun 'gal ba kho na yin pas phan tshun 'gal bar tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang theg pa chen po phan tshun 'gal ba kho na yin pas phan tshun 'gal bar tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Since the Disciple Vehicle and the Great Vehicle are mutually contradictory, a verse on their mutual contradiction:

original: bsam pa dang ni bstan pa dang // sbyor ba dang ni rton pa dang // dus 'gal phyir na dman pa gang //
analyzed: bsam pa dang ni bstan pa dang // sbyor ba dang ni rton pa dang // dus 'gal phyir na dman pa gang //
translated: its teaching, its practice, its reliance, and its time.

original: de ni man pa kho na yin //
analyzed: de ni man pa kho na yin //
translated: It is inferior because of these five kinds of inferiority.

original: ji ltar 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gal zhe na /
translated: How are they contradictory?

original: 'gal ba rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: They are contradictory in five ways:

original: bsam pa dang / bstan pa dang / sbyor ba dang / rton pa dang / dus 'gal bdag gis so //
analyzed: bsam pa dang / bstan pa dang / sbyor ba dang / rton pa dang / dus 'gal bdag gis so //
translated: in intention, in teaching, in practice, in reliance, and in time.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa las ni bdag mya ngan las 'das pa kho na'i phyir bsam pa dang / de nyid kyi phyir bstan pa dang / de nyid kyi phyir sbyor ba dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis bsdus pa'i rton pa yang chung la dus kyang thung ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa las ni bdag mya ngan las 'das pa kho na'i phyir bsam pa dang / de nyid kyi phyir bstan pa dang / de nyid kyi phyir sbyor ba dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis bsdus pa'i rton pa yang chung la dus kyang thung ste /
translated: In the vehicle of the disciples, the intention is for the sake of one’s own nirvāṇa, and the teaching is for that same purpose. The practice is for that same purpose, and the reliance is slight, being included in the collections of merit and sublime wisdom. The time is short,

original: tshe gsum gyis kyang de'i don 'thob bo //
analyzed: tshe gsum gyis kyang de'i don 'thob bo //
translated: for one attains its goal in three lifetimes.

original: theg pa chen po las ni thams cad de las bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po las ni thams cad de las bzlog pa yin te /
translated: In the Great Vehicle, all of these are the opposite of that.

original: de lta bas na phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir theg pa dman pa gang yin pa de ni dman pa kho na yin gyi //
analyzed: de lta bas na phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir theg pa dman pa gang yin pa de ni dman pa kho na yin gyi //
translated: Therefore, because they are mutually contradictory, the inferior vehicle is just that, inferior.

original: de theg pa chen po yin par ni mi 'os so //
analyzed: de theg pa chen po yin par ni mi 'os so //
translated: It is not suitable to be the Great Vehicle.

original: la la sangs rgyas kyi bka'i mtshan nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: la la sangs rgyas kyi bka'i mtshan nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: Some think that the definition of the Buddha’s word is this:

original: gang mdo sde la yang 'jug /
analyzed: gang mdo sde la yang 'jug /
translated: It is that which is found in the sūtras,

original: @132a * // 'dul bal yang snang /
analyzed: @132a * // 'dul bal yang snang /
translated: is evident in the Vinaya,

original: chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba nyid yin na /
translated: and does not contradict reality.

original: theg pa chen po ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid du ston pa'i phyir de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid du ston pa'i phyir de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: But the Great Vehicle is not like that, because it teaches that all phenomena are reality.

original: de lta bas na sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de lta bas na sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore, they think that it is not the word of the Buddha.

original: de'i phir mtshan nyid dang mi 'gal bar tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: de'i phir mtshan nyid dang mi 'gal bar tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: To show that it is not contradictory to the definition, a verse:🔽Because it is found in our sūtras,🔽because it is evident in our Vinaya,

original: rang gi mdo la'ang 'jug pa dang // rang gi 'dul la'ang snang phyir dang // zab pa'i phyir dang rgya che'i phyir //
analyzed: rang gi mdo la'ang 'jug pa dang // rang gi 'dul la'ang snang phyir dang // zab pa'i phyir dang rgya che'i phyir //
translated: because it is profound, and because it is vast,

original: chos nyid dang ni 'gal ba med //
analyzed: chos nyid dang ni 'gal ba med //
translated: it does not contradict reality.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ci ston zhe na /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ci ston zhe na /
translated: What does this verse show?🔽It shows that the Great Vehicle is the word of the Buddha because it is found in our sūtras, because it is evident in our Vinaya, because it is profound, and because it is vast.

original: 'di ni rang gi theg pa chen po'i mdo la'ang 'jug pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rang gi theg pa chen po'i mdo la'ang 'jug pa kho na'o //
translated: It is found in our sūtras.

original: rang gi nyon mongs pa theg pa chen po las byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa 'byung ba gang yin ba 'dul ba la yang snang ste /
analyzed: rang gi nyon mongs pa theg pa chen po las byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa 'byung ba gang yin ba 'dul ba la yang snang ste /
translated: And it is also seen to subdue the afflictions of the bodhisattvas in the Mahayana, which are their discursive thought.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: The afflictions of the bodhisattvas are discursive thought.

original: zab cing rgya che ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir chos nyid dang yang mi 'gal te /
analyzed: zab cing rgya che ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir chos nyid dang yang mi 'gal te /
translated: And it does not contradict reality, because it has the character of profundity and magnanimity.

original: byang chub chen po 'thob par 'gyur ba'i chos nyid ni 'di kho na yin no //
analyzed: byang chub chen po 'thob par 'gyur ba'i chos nyid ni 'di kho na yin no //
translated: This is the reality of the attainment of great enlightenment.

original: de lta bas na mtshan nyid dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na mtshan nyid dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus, it does not contradict the reality.

original: spyod yul ma yin zhes bshad pas de'i phyir rtog ge'i spyod yul nyid du mi rung bas tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: spyod yul ma yin zhes bshad pas de'i phyir rtog ge'i spyod yul nyid du mi rung bas tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Since it was said that it is not the domain of discursive reasoning, it is not suitable to be the domain of discursive reasoning.

original: rtog ge rten cing ma nges la //
analyzed: rtog ge rten cing ma nges la //
translated: It is based on discursive reasoning, uncertain,

original: ma khyab kun rdzob skyo ba can //
analyzed: ma khyab kun rdzob skyo ba can //
translated: not universal, conventional, and discouraging.

original: byis pa la ni brten par 'dod //
analyzed: byis pa la ni brten par 'dod //
translated: It is held to be based on the childish.

original: de phyir de ni de'i yul min //
analyzed: de phyir de ni de'i yul min //
translated: Therefore, it is not the domain of that.

original: rtog ge de kho na nyid ma mthong ba la brten pa ni lung cung zad la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: rtog ge de kho na nyid ma mthong ba la brten pa ni lung cung zad la brten pa yin no //
translated: The reasoning that is based on the non-perception of reality is based on scripture to a slight extent.

original: dus gzhan na gzhan du shes pa'i phyir ma nges pa yang yin no //
analyzed: dus gzhan na gzhan du shes pa'i phyir ma nges pa yang yin no //
translated: It is uncertain because it is understood differently at different times.

original: shes bya thams cad yul ma yin pas ma khyab pa yang yin no //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad yul ma yin pas ma khyab pa yang yin no //
translated: It is not universal because it does not have all objects of knowledge as its domain.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i yul can yin gyi /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i yul can yin gyi /
translated: It has the conventional truth as its domain.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'i yul can yang ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'i yul can yang ma yin no //
translated: It does not have the ultimate truth as its domain.

original: spobs pa yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ba'i phyir skyo ba can yang yin no //
analyzed: spobs pa yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ba'i phyir skyo ba can yang yin no //
translated: It is fatiguing because it exhausts eloquence.

original: theg pa chen po ni mdo sde 'bum phrag du ma bstan pa'i phyir brten pa med pa nas skyo ba can ma yin pa'i bar du yin te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni mdo sde 'bum phrag du ma bstan pa'i phyir brten pa med pa nas skyo ba can ma yin pa'i bar du yin te /
translated: The Mahayana is not fatiguing because it teaches many hundreds of thousands of sūtras.

original: de'i phyir de ni rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the domain of reasoning.

original: thabs ma yin pa'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg pas ni yun ring mo zhig tu yang sangs rgyas nyid 'thob par mi nus so zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg pas ni yun ring mo zhig tu yang sangs rgyas nyid 'thob par mi nus so zhes bshad pa /
translated: It has been explained that one cannot attain buddhahood through the Śrāvaka Vehicle even after a long time because it is not a skillful means.

original: 'o na theg pa chen po ji ltar thabs su dung zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na theg pa chen po ji ltar thabs su dung zhe na /
translated: How is the Mahayana a means?🔽A verse on the suitability of the Mahayana as a means

original: thabs nyid du rung bar tshigs su bcad pa //
analyzed: thabs nyid du rung bar tshigs su bcad pa //
translated: A verse on the suitability of the transcendences as means🔽

original: rgya che'i phyir dang zab pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rgya che'i phyir dang zab pa'i phyir //
translated: It is a means because it is extensive and profound,🔽because it brings beings to full maturity, and because it is nonconceptual.

original: yongs su smin dang rnam mi rtog / de phyir 'di las gnyis bstan te //
analyzed: yongs su smin dang rnam mi rtog / de phyir 'di las gnyis bstan te //
translated: Therefore, these two are taught in this vehicle.

original: @132b de ni bla na med pa'i thabs //
analyzed: @132b de ni bla na med pa'i thabs //
translated: It is the unexcelled means.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ci ston zhe na /🔽mthu rgya chen po bstan pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ci ston zhe na / mthu rgya chen po bstan pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: What does this verse show?

original: mthu la mos pa'i sgo nas 'bad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthu la mos pa'i sgo nas 'bad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It brings beings to full maturity because it teaches the vast power of the buddhas, for beings strive to attain that power by believing in it.

original: zab mo bstan pas rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: zab mo bstan pas rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: It is nonconceptual because it teaches the profound.

original: de'i phyir theg pa chen po'i 'di las de gnyis bstan to /
analyzed: de'i phyir theg pa chen po'i 'di las de gnyis bstan to /
translated: Therefore, these two are taught in this vehicle of the Mahayana.

original: de ni bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi thabs yin te /
analyzed: de ni bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi thabs yin te /
translated: It is the unexcelled means of gnosis,

original: de gnyis kyis go rims bzhin du sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir dang / bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis go rims bzhin du sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir dang / bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, respectively, it brings beings to full maturity and it brings the buddhadharmas to full maturity in oneself.

original: gang dag 'dis skrag pa de'i phyir gnas ma yin pa la skrag pa'i nyes dmigs dang rgyu nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa //
analyzed: gang dag 'dis skrag pa de'i phyir gnas ma yin pa la skrag pa'i nyes dmigs dang rgyu nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa //
translated: A verse on the disadvantages and causes of fear of what is not to be feared.

original: 'gro ba de'i gnas min la skrag pa gdung byed 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba de'i gnas min la skrag pa gdung byed 'gyur //
translated: 1. He who fears what is not to be feared is tormented,

original: bsod nams ma yin phung chen bsags byas yun ring du //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin phung chen bsags byas yun ring du //
translated: and for a long time accumulates a great mass of demerit.

original: rigs med grogs ngan sngon dge ma bsags blo ma sbyangs //
analyzed: rigs med grogs ngan sngon dge ma bsags blo ma sbyangs //
translated: 2. He is not of the spiritual family, has bad friends, has not accumulated the roots of virtue, has not purified his mind,

original: chos 'dis skrag 'gyur 'di ni don chen 'di las ltung //🔽skrag pa'i gnas ma yin pa la skrag pa ni de'i gnas ma yin pa la skrag pa ste /
analyzed: chos 'dis skrag 'gyur 'di ni don chen 'di las ltung // skrag pa'i gnas ma yin pa la skrag pa ni de'i gnas ma yin pa la skrag pa ste /
translated: and fears this teaching; he will fall from this great purpose.

original: ngan song dag tu gdung bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngan song dag tu gdung bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: He who fears what is not to be feared is tormented by the fear of the unfortunate planes of existence.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsod nams ma yin pa'i phung po chen po bsags pa byas ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa'i phung po chen po bsags pa byas ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has accumulated a great mass of demerit.

original: dus ji srid du zhe na /
analyzed: dus ji srid du zhe na /
translated: For how long?

original: yun ring por te /
analyzed: yun ring por te /
translated: For a long time.

original: de ltar na nyes dmigs gang yin pa dang / rgyu gang gis yin pa dang / dus ji srid du yin pa de bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na nyes dmigs gang yin pa dang / rgyu gang gis yin pa dang / dus ji srid du yin pa de bstan to //
translated: Thus, the disadvantages, the causes, and the duration have been taught.

original: yang ci'i phyir skrag ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir skrag ce na /
translated: Why is one afraid?

original: skrag pa'i rgyu rnam pa bzhi ston te /
analyzed: skrag pa'i rgyu rnam pa bzhi ston te /
translated: Four reasons for fear are shown.

original: 'di la rigs med pa'am /
analyzed: 'di la rigs med pa'am /
translated: One has no potential for it.

original: grogs ngan pa'am /
analyzed: grogs ngan pa'am /
translated: One has bad friends.

original: theg pa chen po'i chos nyid la blo gros ma sbyangs pa'am /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos nyid la blo gros ma sbyangs pa'am /
translated: One's mind is not trained in the reality of the universal vehicle.

original: sngon dge ba ma bsags pa'o //🔽don chen 'di las ltung zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngon dge ba ma bsags pa'o // don chen 'di las ltung zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One has not accumulated the roots of virtue in the past.

original: byang chub chen po'i tshogs kyi don las ma thob pa'i nyams pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i tshogs kyi don las ma thob pa'i nyams pa ste /
translated: One falls from this great meaning means that one falls from the attainment of the great enlightenment's meaning of accumulation.

original: 'di ni nyes dmigs gzhan ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni nyes dmigs gzhan ston pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of another disadvantage.

original: skrag pa'i rgyu bshad nas mi skrag pa'i rgyu bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: skrag pa'i rgyu bshad nas mi skrag pa'i rgyu bshad par bya ste /
translated: Having explained the reasons for fear, the reasons for fearlessness should be explained.

original: mi skrag pa'i rgyu nyid du tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: mi skrag pa'i rgyu nyid du tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the reasons for fearlessness:

original: de las gzhan dang gzhan med shin du zab cing rjes song phyir //
analyzed: de las gzhan dang gzhan med shin du zab cing rjes song phyir //
translated: It is not other than that, it is very profound, and it is consistent.

original: sna tshogs ston zhing mang po'i sgo nas rtag tu ston dang ldan //
analyzed: sna tshogs ston zhing mang po'i sgo nas rtag tu ston dang ldan //
translated: It teaches a variety, and it is always taught in many ways.

original: ji skang bshad bzhin don min bcom ldan dgongs pa shin tu zab //
analyzed: ji skang bshad bzhin don min bcom ldan dgongs pa shin tu zab //
translated: It is not literal, and the transcendent lords' intention is very profound.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis tshul bzhin brtags na chos 'dir skrag mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis tshul bzhin brtags na chos 'dir skrag mi 'gyur //
translated: The wise, when they examine it properly, will not be afraid of this teaching.

original: de las gzhan med ces bya ba ni /🔽de las gzhan pa'i theg @133a * //
analyzed: de las gzhan med ces bya ba ni / de las gzhan pa'i theg @133a * //
translated: There is no other means is stated

original: pa chen po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa chen po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other Mahayana.

original: 'on te nyan thos kyi theg pa nyid theg pa chen po yin par gyur na ni /
analyzed: 'on te nyan thos kyi theg pa nyid theg pa chen po yin par gyur na ni /
translated: If the Sravakayana itself were the Mahayana,

original: gzhan nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas med par 'gyur te /
translated: then there would be no other vehicles, the Sravakayana and the Pratyekabuddhayana,

original: thams cad sangs rgyas kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad sangs rgyas kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: and everyone would become a Buddha.

original: shin tu zab ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: shin tu zab ces bya ba ni /
translated: It is very profound is stated

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi lam mo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi lam mo //
translated: because it is the path of the gnosis of omniscience.🔽It is a gradual path is stated

original: rjes song zhes bya ba ni dus mnyam du byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes song zhes bya ba ni dus mnyam du byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a path that is traversed in stages.

original: sna tshogs ston zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sna tshogs ston zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It teaches a variety is stated

original: 'di las tshogs kyi lam sna tshogs ston gyi //
analyzed: 'di las tshogs kyi lam sna tshogs ston gyi //
translated: because it teaches a variety of paths of accumulation,

original: stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: not just emptiness alone.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni dgongs pa can yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni dgongs pa can yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is a teaching that requires interpretation.

original: mang po'i sgo nas rtag tu ston dang ldan zhes bya ba ni 'di dag mdo de dang de dag la rnam grangs mang po dag gis yang dang yang du stong pa nyid ston te /
analyzed: mang po'i sgo nas rtag tu ston dang ldan zhes bya ba ni 'di dag mdo de dang de dag la rnam grangs mang po dag gis yang dang yang du stong pa nyid ston te /
translated: “Always taught by many means” means that emptiness is taught again and again in many scriptures.

original: de lta bas na dgos pa chen po nyid yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na dgos pa chen po nyid yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it is taught only in the Perfection of Wisdom scriptures.

original: de lta ma yin na lan cig dgag pa tsam mdzad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na lan cig dgag pa tsam mdzad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would be necessary to admit that emptiness is taught only once.

original: ji skad bshad bzhin don min zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni sgra ji bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: ji skad bshad bzhin don min zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni sgra ji bzhin ma yin te /
translated: “The meaning is not as the words are spoken” means that the meaning is not literal.

original: de'i phyir yang skrag par rigs pa ma yin no //🔽bcom ldan 'das dgongs pa shin tu zab ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang skrag par rigs pa ma yin no // bcom ldan 'das dgongs pa shin tu zab ces bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to be afraid.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dgongs pa ni shin tu zab ste shes par dka'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dgongs pa ni shin tu zab ste shes par dka'o //
translated: “The thought of the Lord is very profound” means that the thought of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, is very profound and difficult to understand.

original: de lta bas na bdag cag gis de ma shes pa'i phyir skrag par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag cag gis de ma shes pa'i phyir skrag par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to be afraid because we do not understand it.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis de ltar tshul bzhin brtags na skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis de ltar tshul bzhin brtags na skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The wise, when they investigate it properly, do not become afraid.

original: ring du rjes su zhugs pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul nyid yin par tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: ring du rjes su zhugs pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul nyid yin par tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: The domain of wisdom that penetrates far is indicated in the following verse.

original: 'di ni dang por thos la brten nas yid la byed pa 'byung //
analyzed: 'di ni dang por thos la brten nas yid la byed pa 'byung //
translated: First, attention arises in dependence on hearing.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed las yang dag don yul ye shes 'byung //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed las yang dag don yul ye shes 'byung //
translated: From proper attention, the wisdom that has reality for its object arises.

original: de las chos 'thob de yod de las blo gros rab tu skye //
analyzed: de las chos 'thob de yod de las blo gros rab tu skye //
translated: From that, one obtains the Dharma, and from that, the highest intelligence arises.

original: gang tshe de ni so so rang rig med na ji ltar des //
analyzed: gang tshe de ni so so rang rig med na ji ltar des //
translated: If that is not the intuition of individual investigation, how can it be?

original: dang por thos pa la brten nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa 'byung ngo //🔽tshul bzhin yid la bya ba ni /
analyzed: dang por thos pa la brten nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa 'byung ngo // tshul bzhin yid la bya ba ni /
translated: First, attention arises in dependence on hearing.🔽Proper attention

original: tshul bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: means proper attention.

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa las 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lta bde kho na nyid kyi don gyis yul can gyi ye shes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa las 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lta bde kho na nyid kyi don gyis yul can gyi ye shes 'byung ngo //
translated: From proper attention, the wisdom that has reality for its object arises, the supramundane, right view.

original: de las de'i 'bras bu chos 'thob bo //
analyzed: de las de'i 'bras bu chos 'thob bo //
translated: From that, one obtains the Dharma, which is its result.

original: thob pa de yod na de las rnam bar grol ba'i ye shes rab tu skye'o //
analyzed: thob pa de yod na de las rnam bar grol ba'i ye shes rab tu skye'o //
translated: From that, the intuition of liberation arises.

original: de ltar gang gi tshe blo gros de ni so so rang gis rig pa yin na /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi tshe blo gros de ni so so rang gis rig pa yin na /
translated: Thus, when this understanding is one’s own personal realization,

original: de med na 'di ji ltar nges te /
analyzed: de med na 'di ji ltar nges te /
translated: how can one be certain that it does not exist?

original: 'di sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin no zhes bya @133b bar ji ltar nges par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin no zhes bya @133b bar ji ltar nges par 'gyur /
translated: How can one be certain that this is not the word of the Buddha?

original: skrag pa'i gzhi'i gnas ma yin pa nyid du tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: skrag pa'i gzhi'i gnas ma yin pa nyid du tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the fact that it is not a basis for fear

original: bdag gis mi shes sangs rgyas zab mo mkhyen ma yin //
analyzed: bdag gis mi shes sangs rgyas zab mo mkhyen ma yin //
translated: I do not understand it, nor does the Buddha understand the profound.

original: zab mo ci yi phyir na rtog ge'i yul ma yin //
analyzed: zab mo ci yi phyir na rtog ge'i yul ma yin //
translated: Why is the profound not the domain of sophistry?

original: ci'i phyir zab mo'i don rig pa dag mthar 'gyur zhes //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zab mo'i don rig pa dag mthar 'gyur zhes //
translated: Why do those who understand the profound meaning come to an end?

original: bya ba de ni skrag pa'i gnas su rigs ma yin //
analyzed: bya ba de ni skrag pa'i gnas su rigs ma yin //
translated: This is not a proper basis for fear.

original: re zhig gal te bdag gis 'di mi shes pas skrag pa'i gnas yin no zhe na /
analyzed: re zhig gal te bdag gis 'di mi shes pas skrag pa'i gnas yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is a basis for fear because I do not understand it,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //🔽'on te sangs rgyas kyang zab mo thugs su chung pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin no // 'on te sangs rgyas kyang zab mo thugs su chung pa ma yin na /
translated: that is not proper.🔽Or if it is a basis for fear because, if the Buddha does not understand the profound,

original: de ci'i phyir zab mo ston par 'gyur zhes skrag pa'i gnas yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zab mo ston par 'gyur zhes skrag pa'i gnas yin no zhe na /
translated: why does he teach the profound,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: that is not proper.

original: 'on te ci'i phyir zab mo rtog ge'i yul ma yin zhes skrag pa'i gnas yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ci'i phyir zab mo rtog ge'i yul ma yin zhes skrag pa'i gnas yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you ask why it is the domain of profound reasoning, it is a source of fear.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: 'on te ci'i phyir zab mo'i don rig pa dag kho na thar pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te ci'i phyir zab mo'i don rig pa dag kho na thar pa yin gyi /
translated: But if you ask why only those who know the profound meaning are liberated,

original: rtog ge pa rnams ni ma yin zhes skrag pa'i gnas yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rtog ge pa rnams ni ma yin zhes skrag pa'i gnas yin no zhe na /
translated: and not the logicians, it is a source of fear.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: ma mos pa nyid kyis grub par tshigs su ba cad pa /🔽dman par mos shing khams kyang shin tu dman //
analyzed: ma mos pa nyid kyis grub par tshigs su ba cad pa / dman par mos shing khams kyang shin tu dman //
translated: A verse on the establishment of lack of devotion:🔽1. Lack of devotion is established in those who have inferior aspiration,

original: grogs po dman pa dag gis yongs bskor ba /
analyzed: grogs po dman pa dag gis yongs bskor ba /
translated: who are surrounded by inferior friends,🔽and who do not aspire to this Dharma

original: zab cing rgya che legs par bshad pa'i chos //🔽'di la gal te mos med grub pa yin //
analyzed: zab cing rgya che legs par bshad pa'i chos // 'di la gal te mos med grub pa yin //
translated: which is well-taught, profound, and vast.

original: gang zhig dman pa la mos pa ni /
analyzed: gang zhig dman pa la mos pa ni /
translated: One whose aspiration is inferior

original: des na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bsgos pa'i khams dman pa kho na yang dag par 'grub ste /
analyzed: des na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bsgos pa'i khams dman pa kho na yang dag par 'grub ste /
translated: establishes only an inferior element, which is infused in the store-consciousness.

original: grogs po dman pa la mos pa'i khams tsam du mtshungs pa dag kho nas yongs su bskor ba gang yin pa de gal te theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba legs par bshad pa 'di ni mos pa med pa na /
analyzed: grogs po dman pa la mos pa'i khams tsam du mtshungs pa dag kho nas yongs su bskor ba gang yin pa de gal te theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba legs par bshad pa 'di ni mos pa med pa na /
translated: Those who are surrounded only by friends who are devoted to inferior vehicles, who are of the same nature, if they have no devotion to this well-spoken Dharma of the Great Vehicle, which is profound and extensive,

original: de nyid kyis theg pa chen po 'di mchog yin par grub bo //
analyzed: de nyid kyis theg pa chen po 'di mchog yin par grub bo //
translated: then they will not attain the Great Vehicle.

original: mdo sde ma thos pa spangs du mi rung bar tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: mdo sde ma thos pa spangs du mi rung bar tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: It is not right to reject the scriptures that one has not heard. The verse says:

original: thos rjes 'brangs te blo ldan thob nas ni //
analyzed: thos rjes 'brangs te blo ldan thob nas ni //
translated: The wise, having attained through following what they have heard,

original: gang zhig thos la rab tu brnyas byed pa //🔽rnam pa sna tshogs dpag tu med lus la //
analyzed: gang zhig thos la rab tu brnyas byed pa // rnam pa sna tshogs dpag tu med lus la //
translated: should not despise what they have heard.🔽For what reason do the confused definitely do this

original: rmongs pa gang gi phyir na nges par byed //
analyzed: rmongs pa gang gi phyir na nges par byed //
translated: to their various immeasurable bodies?

original: de la ma mos la ni rag na mdo sde ma thos pa rnams khyad par med par spong ba ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ma mos la ni rag na mdo sde ma thos pa rnams khyad par med par spong ba ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If one has no devotion to the Great Vehicle, it is not right to reject without distinction the scriptures that one has not heard.

original: gang zhig thos pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa kho nas blo dang ldan pa thob nas thos pa nyid la brnyas par byed pa'i rmongs pa de thos pa sna tshogs dpag tu med pa lus pa yod bzhin du gtan tshigs gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang zhig thos pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa kho nas blo dang ldan pa thob nas thos pa nyid la brnyas par byed pa'i rmongs pa de thos pa sna tshogs dpag tu med pa lus pa yod bzhin du gtan tshigs gang gi phyir /
translated: Some people, having gained intelligence by following what they have heard, are confused and disparage what they have heard.🔽

original: 'di sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin @134a * //🔽no zhes nges par byed /
analyzed: 'di sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin @134a * // no zhes nges par byed /
translated: The fool who, having gained intelligence by following the scriptures, then despises the scriptures, is a fool who, while still having to learn countless other scriptures, decides that this one is not the word of the Buddha.

original: de la ni thos pa las stobs gzhan med de /
analyzed: de la ni thos pa las stobs gzhan med de /
translated: What other power does he have except learning?

original: de lta bas na ma thos par spong ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma thos par spong ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not right to reject the scriptures without having studied them.

original: gang thos pa de yang tshul bzhin yid la bya'i /
analyzed: gang thos pa de yang tshul bzhin yid la bya'i /
translated: And what one has studied should be contemplated properly,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin par ni ma yin no zhes tshul bzhin ma yin par ni ma yin no zhes tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa'i nyes dmigs kyi tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin par ni ma yin no zhes tshul bzhin ma yin par ni ma yin no zhes tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa'i nyes dmigs kyi tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: not improperly. A verse on the disadvantage of improper contemplation:

original: don sgra ji bzhin yongs rtogs na //
analyzed: don sgra ji bzhin yongs rtogs na //
translated: 1. When one understands the meaning literally,

original: bdag nyid snyems shing blo nyams 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag nyid snyems shing blo nyams 'gyur //
translated: one becomes conceited and loses one’s intelligence.

original: legs par gsungs pa'ang spangs pas na //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'ang spangs pas na //
translated: And by rejecting the well-spoken scriptures,

original: brlag 'gyur chos la khong khro sgrib //
analyzed: brlag 'gyur chos la khong khro sgrib //
translated: Anger at the Dharma is the obscuration to the loss of the Dharma.

original: bdag nyid snyems zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid snyems zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The line conceit about oneself means

original: bdag nyid kyi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin gyi mkhas pa las don mi tshol ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin gyi mkhas pa las don mi tshol ba'o //
translated: that one holds one's own view as supreme and does not seek the goal from a wise person.

original: blo nyams 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: blo nyams 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The line the loss of intelligence means

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa las ma thob par yongs su nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa las ma thob par yongs su nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that one loses the attainment of the knowledge of reality as it is.

original: legs par bshad pa'i chos spong ba ni /
analyzed: legs par bshad pa'i chos spong ba ni /
translated: The line abandoning the Dharma that is well taught means

original: de'i bzhi las bsod nams ma yin pa 'phel ba'i phyir brlag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bzhi las bsod nams ma yin pa 'phel ba'i phyir brlag par 'gyur ro //
translated: that one loses the Dharma, because the four causes increase nonvirtue.

original: chos la khong khro ba'i sgrib pa ni chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las te /
analyzed: chos la khong khro ba'i sgrib pa ni chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las te /
translated: Anger at the Dharma is the action that leads to the loss of the Dharma.

original: 'di la nyes dmigs ni de yin no //
analyzed: 'di la nyes dmigs ni de yin no //
translated: This is the danger in that.

original: sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa'i don mi shes par yang khong khro bar rigs pa ma yin pas khong khro bar mi rung bar tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa'i don mi shes par yang khong khro bar rigs pa ma yin pas khong khro bar mi rung bar tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Since it is not right to be angry without knowing the meaning that is not literal, the inappropriateness of anger is stated in the following verse.

original: yid kyi nyes pa rang bzhin gdug pa ste //
analyzed: yid kyi nyes pa rang bzhin gdug pa ste //
translated: The fault of the mind is naturally vicious.

original: mi rigs pa yi gzugs la'ang mi rigs na //
analyzed: mi rigs pa yi gzugs la'ang mi rigs na //
translated: If it is not right with regard to an improper form,

original: the tshom za ba'i chos la smos ci gos //
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i chos la smos ci gos //
translated: What need to mention the Dharma that is doubtful?

original: de phyir btang snyoms bzhag legs nyes pa med //
analyzed: de phyir btang snyoms bzhag legs nyes pa med //
translated: Therefore, it is better to be indifferent; there is no fault in that.

original: rang bzhin gdug pa zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin gdug pa zhes bya ba ni //
translated: “Natural hostility” means

original: rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ste /
translated: that which is naturally reprehensible.

original: de lta bas na btang snyoms su gzhag pa bla'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na btang snyoms su gzhag pa bla'o //
translated: Therefore, it is better to be indifferent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni nyes pa med kyi khong khro ba ni nyes pa dang bcas pa yin no //🔽theg pa chen po mdo sde'i rgyan las /
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med kyi khong khro ba ni nyes pa dang bcas pa yin no // theg pa chen po mdo sde'i rgyan las /
translated: Because there is no fault in that, but there is a fault in hostility.🔽This completes the chapter on the accomplishment of the Great Vehicle,

original: theg pa chen po sgrub pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: theg pa chen po sgrub pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: the seventh chapter of the Ornament of Mahayana Sutras.

original: // / skyabs su 'gro ba'i khyad par bsdu bar tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: // / skyabs su 'gro ba'i khyad par bsdu bar tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A summary verse on the distinctive refuge of the bodhisattva:

original: kun tu 'gro dang khas len rtogs dang zil gnon par //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro dang khas len rtogs dang zil gnon par //
translated: Universal, verbal, realized, and overpowering,

original: dbye ba'i rang bzhin don rnam bzhi yi khyad par gyis //🔽theg pa mchog phyir dkon mchog skyabs rab song ba gang //
analyzed: dbye ba'i rang bzhin don rnam bzhi yi khyad par gyis // theg pa mchog phyir dkon mchog skyabs rab song ba gang //
translated: with a distinctive nature of four kinds of conversion,🔽the one who goes for refuge in the Three Jewels for the sake of the supreme vehicle

original: de nyid skyabs su song ba rnams kyi mchog ces bya //
analyzed: de nyid skyabs su song ba rnams kyi mchog ces bya //
translated: is declared the best of those who go for refuge.

original: de nyid skyabs su 'gro ba rnams kyi mchog ces bya ba ci'i phyir bya zhe na /🔽rang bzhin gyi don gyi khyad par rnam pa bzhi'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid skyabs su 'gro ba rnams kyi mchog ces bya ba ci'i phyir bya zhe na / rang bzhin gyi don gyi khyad par rnam pa bzhi'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it called the supreme refuge?🔽Because it has four special intrinsic meanings.

original: don rnam pa bzhin ni /
analyzed: don rnam pa bzhin ni /
translated: The four special meanings are

original: kun tu 'gro ba dang @134b khas len pa dang / rtags pa dang / zil gyis gnon par byed pa'i sgo nas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba dang @134b khas len pa dang / rtags pa dang / zil gyis gnon par byed pa'i sgo nas rig par bya ste /
translated: to be understood as: universal, accepted, realized, and surpassing.

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i don dang / khas len pa'i don dang / rtogs pa'i don dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i don te /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i don dang / khas len pa'i don dang / rtogs pa'i don dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of universal, accepted, realized, and surpassing.

original: de dag ni 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: de dag ni 'og nas ston to //
translated: These are taught below.

original: de lta mod kyi mchog la skyabs su 'gro ba bya dka' ba mang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi mchog la skyabs su 'gro ba bya dka' ba mang ba'i phyir /
translated: But some people are not enthusiastic about going for refuge to the supreme, because it is difficult to do.

original: kha cig mi spro bas skyabs su 'gro bar spro bar bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: kha cig mi spro bas skyabs su 'gro bar spro bar bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: To encourage them to go for refuge, a verse:

original: gang phyir dang por nges par bya ba 'di dka' ste //
analyzed: gang phyir dang por nges par bya ba 'di dka' ste //
translated: This is difficult to do at the outset,

original: de ni bskal pa stong phrag du mar bsgrub par dka' //
analyzed: de ni bskal pa stong phrag du mar bsgrub par dka' //
translated: and it is difficult to accomplish in many thousands of eons.

original: gang phyir grub na sems can phan byed don chen te //
analyzed: gang phyir grub na sems can phan byed don chen te //
translated: Because, if accomplished, it is of great value in benefiting sentient beings,

original: de phyir theg chen 'di la skyabs don mchog yin no //
analyzed: de phyir theg chen 'di la skyabs don mchog yin no //
translated: therefore, this Great Vehicle is the supreme value of refuge.

original: 'dis ni skyabs su 'gro bar nges pa de smon lam dang sgrub pa'i khyad par dag gis grags pa'i rgyu nyid du ston par byed de /
analyzed: 'dis ni skyabs su 'gro bar nges pa de smon lam dang sgrub pa'i khyad par dag gis grags pa'i rgyu nyid du ston par byed de /
translated: This shows that one who is certain in going for refuge is the very cause of fame through the distinction of his aspiration and his practice.

original: 'bras bu thob pa'i khyad par gyi don chen po nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa'i khyad par gyi don chen po nyid do //
translated: It is of great value because of the distinction of the result attained.

original: sngar glengs pa kun tu 'gro ba'i don gyi tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: sngar glengs pa kun tu 'gro ba'i don gyi tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the topic of omnipresence, already mentioned.

original: gang zhig sems can thams cad bsgral bar zhugs pa dang // theg pa ye shes kun tu 'grol mkhas par ldan //
analyzed: gang zhig sems can thams cad bsgral bar zhugs pa dang // theg pa ye shes kun tu 'grol mkhas par ldan //
translated: He who is engaged in liberating all sentient beings, who is skilled in the omnipresent intuition of the vehicle,

original: gang zhig mya ngan 'das la 'khor zhi ro gcig pa //
analyzed: gang zhig mya ngan 'das la 'khor zhi ro gcig pa //
translated: who is one taste in the peace of nirvana and the life-cycle,

original: de 'dra'i blo ldan de 'dir kun 'gror shes par bya //
analyzed: de 'dra'i blo ldan de 'dir kun 'gror shes par bya //
translated: such a genius is to be known as omnipresent here.

original: 'dis ni kun du 'gro ba'i don rnam pa bzhi ston te /🔽sems can kun tu 'gro ba'i don ni /
analyzed: 'dis ni kun du 'gro ba'i don rnam pa bzhi ston te / sems can kun tu 'gro ba'i don ni /
translated: This shows the four kinds of omnipresence.🔽Omnipresence of sentient beings is shown by the line

original: sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i phyir zhugs pas so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i phyir zhugs pas so //
translated: “he who is engaged in liberating all sentient beings.”

original: theg pa kun tu 'gro ba'i don ni theg pa gsum la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa kun tu 'gro ba'i don ni theg pa gsum la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of universal vehicle is that it is endowed with skill in the three vehicles.

analyzed: ye shes kun tu 'gro ba'i don ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par mkhas par mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of universal intuition is that it is endowed with skill in the selflessness of persons and things.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa kun tu 'gro ba'i don ni 'khor ba dang zhi ba ro gcig pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa kun tu 'gro ba'i don ni 'khor ba dang zhi ba ro gcig pa'i phyir te /

original: de dag gis nyes pa dang yon tan la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gis nyes pa dang yon tan la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of that, there is no discrimination of faults and virtues.

original: de la 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la bye brag med do //
analyzed: de la 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la bye brag med do //
translated: There is no distinction between cyclic life and liberation.

original: khas len pa'i don du tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: khas len pa'i don du tshigs su bcad pa /

original: gang zhig dga' ba mang pos byang chub mchog don gnyer //
analyzed: gang zhig dga' ba mang pos byang chub mchog don gnyer //

original: 'di ltar skyo ba med par dka' ba spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyo ba med par dka' ba spyod pa'o //

analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa 'di bzhis rgyal po'i sras btsun @135b par skyes so zhes bya bar shes te /
translated: By these four perfections, the prince is known as well born.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

analyzed: gzugs phun sum tshogs pa dang / stobs phun sum tshogs pa dang / bde ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / rang gi bzo shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of form, the perfection of strength, the perfection of happiness, and the perfection of knowledge of one's own art.

original: yang legs par skyes pa de nyid sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi gcod pa'i sgo nas tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gyis ston te /
analyzed: yang legs par skyes pa de nyid sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi gcod pa'i sgo nas tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gyis ston te /
translated: The same well born one is taught by another verse from the point of view of not breaking the lineage of the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyis 'od zer chen pos dbang bskur byin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyis 'od zer chen pos dbang bskur byin //

original: de ni chos la dbang ba kun dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: de ni chos la dbang ba kun dang yang dag ldan //
