translated: He is endowed with all the powers over the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor ston pa'i rnam par shes //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor ston pa'i rnam par shes //
translated: He is the consciousness which manifests the circle of the assembly of the Buddhas.

original: bslab pa bca' bas tshar bcad phan 'dogs byed la brtson //
analyzed: bslab pa bca' bas tshar bcad phan 'dogs byed la brtson //
translated: He is intent on punishing and helping those who violate and observe the precepts.

original: rgyu bzhis rgyal po'i sras su btsun par skyes pa rang gi rigs mi gcod de /
analyzed: rgyu bzhis rgyal po'i sras su btsun par skyes pa rang gi rigs mi gcod de /
translated: For four reasons, the son of a king, born in the royal caste, does not cut off his caste:

original: dbang skur ba thob pa dang / dbang thogs pa med pa dang / rtsod pa brtag pa la mkhas pa dang / tshar gcod pa dang / phan 'dogs par byed pas so //
analyzed: dbang skur ba thob pa dang / dbang thogs pa med pa dang / rtsod pa brtag pa la mkhas pa dang / tshar gcod pa dang / phan 'dogs par byed pas so //
translated: he receives consecration, he has unimpeded power, he is skilled in investigating lawsuits, and he punishes and helps.

original: de dang chos mthun par byang chub sems dpa' yang 'od zer dag gis dbang bskur ba thob pa dang / ye shes thogs pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad la dbang dang ldan pa dang / sangs rgyas rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du ston pa'i rnam pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: de dang chos mthun par byang chub sems dpa' yang 'od zer dag gis dbang bskur ba thob pa dang / ye shes thogs pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad la dbang dang ldan pa dang / sangs rgyas rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du ston pa'i rnam pa shes pa dang /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva, in conformity with that, receives consecration by the rays of light, he has power over all dharmas because of unimpeded knowledge, he knows the form of the teacher in the circle of the Buddha’s retinue,

original: bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bas nyes pa dang ldan pa dang yon tan dang ldan pa rnams tshar bcad pa dang phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bas nyes pa dang ldan pa dang yon tan dang ldan pa rnams tshar bcad pa dang phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid do //
translated: and he punishes and helps those who violate and observe the precepts.

original: yang khas len pa'i khyad par de nyid blon po chen po lta bur tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gyis ston te /
analyzed: yang khas len pa'i khyad par de nyid blon po chen po lta bur tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gyis ston te /
translated: Another verse shows the difference in their acceptance, comparing it to a great minister.🔽Because they enter the perfections,

original: blon po chen po lta bur pha rol phyin la 'jug pa'i phyir //
analyzed: blon po chen po lta bur pha rol phyin la 'jug pa'i phyir //
translated: they are like great ministers.

original: byang chub chen po'i phyogs mthun bdal la rtag tu spyan byed phyir //
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i phyogs mthun bdal la rtag tu spyan byed phyir //
translated: Because they always watch over the spread of the factors of the great enlightenment,🔽they are like great ministers.

original: gsang ba'i gnas ni rnam gsum rtag tu yang dag 'dzin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gsang ba'i gnas ni rnam gsum rtag tu yang dag 'dzin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they always correctly hold the three secrets,🔽they are like great ministers.

original: sems can mang ngon rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par rab byed phyir //🔽'di la rgyu bzhis blon po chen por bzhag ste /
analyzed: sems can mang ngon rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par rab byed phyir // 'di la rgyu bzhis blon po chen por bzhag ste /
translated: Because they always and uninterruptedly work for the welfare of many beings,🔽they are like great ministers.

original: btsun mo'i nang du 'gro ba'i phyir nang na spyod pa nyid dang / mdzod thams cad kyi spyan nyid dang / gsang gtam la yid brtan pa nyid dang / bgo bsha' la dbang po nyid kyis so //
analyzed: btsun mo'i nang du 'gro ba'i phyir nang na spyod pa nyid dang / mdzod thams cad kyi spyan nyid dang / gsang gtam la yid brtan pa nyid dang / bgo bsha' la dbang po nyid kyis so //
translated: They are considered great ministers for four reasons: they are always present in the inner palace; they are the eyes of all the treasuries; they are trusted with the king's secrets; and they are the king's own assistants.

original: de dang chos mthun par byang chub sems dpa' yang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la 'jug pa dang / mdo sde de dang de dag las byang chub chen po'i phyogs dang mthun pa bdal ba rnams la mi brjed pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir rtag tu spyan byed pa dang /🔽rtag tu sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi @136a * //
analyzed: de dang chos mthun par byang chub sems dpa' yang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la 'jug pa dang / mdo sde de dang de dag las byang chub chen po'i phyogs dang mthun pa bdal ba rnams la mi brjed pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir rtag tu spyan byed pa dang / rtag tu sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi @136a * //
translated: He always has the eye of the Dharma, because he is never without the eye of the Dharma, which is the means of knowing the teachings of the Great Vehicle.

original: gsang ba rnam pa gsum 'dzin pa dang / sems can mtha' yas pa'i don byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsang ba rnam pa gsum 'dzin pa dang / sems can mtha' yas pa'i don byed pa'i phyir /
translated: He always has the three secrets of body, speech, and mind, because he is never without the protection of the spiritual guides.

original: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sems can mang po'i don byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sems can mang po'i don byed pa'o //
translated: He always works for the welfare of many beings, because he is never without the means of bringing about the welfare of infinite beings.

original: rtogs pa'i don du tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don du tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the topic of realization

original: bsod nams phung chen srid gsum bla ma srid pa'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal phung po chen por bzhi blo mchog bde ba dang // chos mang phung po mchog rab rtag pa'i sku ste dge ba'i tshogs //
analyzed: bsod nams phung chen srid gsum bla ma srid pa'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal phung po chen por bzhi blo mchog bde ba dang // chos mang phung po mchog rab rtag pa'i sku ste dge ba'i tshogs //
translated: The bodhisattvas great mass of merit, the highest in the three worlds, the bliss of cyclic life, the great mass of suffering, the bliss of the highest mind, the great mass of teachings, the supreme body of reality, the collection of virtue,

original: bag chags bzlog cing srid dang zhi las rnam par grol ba 'thob //
analyzed: bag chags bzlog cing srid dang zhi las rnam par grol ba 'thob //
translated: One attains the reversal of habitual tendencies and liberation from existence and peace.

original: de la chos 'di la mos pa'i dus nyid na bsod na bsod nams kyi phung po chen po 'thob bo //
analyzed: de la chos 'di la mos pa'i dus nyid na bsod na bsod nams kyi phung po chen po 'thob bo //
translated: At the time of devotion to this Dharma, one attains a great mass of merit.

original: sems bskyed pa'i dus na srid pa gsum gyi bla ma nyid do //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i dus na srid pa gsum gyi bla ma nyid do //
translated: At the time of generating the mind, one becomes the highest in the three existences.

original: bsams bzhin du skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i dus na srid pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i dus na srid pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: At the time of taking birth as one wishes, one has the bliss of existence.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na sems can thams cad bdag nyid du khas blangs pas sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po rab tu zhi ba ste /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na sems can thams cad bdag nyid du khas blangs pas sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po rab tu zhi ba ste /
translated: At the time of realization, one pacifies the great mass of suffering by accepting all sentient beings as oneself.

original: 'dis rab tu zhi bar byed pas na rab tu zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis rab tu zhi bar byed pas na rab tu zhi ba'o //
translated: It is pacification because it pacifies with this.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i dus na blo mchog gi bde ba'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i dus na blo mchog gi bde ba'o //
translated: At the time of attaining acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas, one has the bliss of the highest mind.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa 'dus na chos mang po'i phung po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa 'dus na chos mang po'i phung po la sogs pa ste /
translated: At the time of complete enlightenment, one has the mass of many dharmas and so forth.

original: de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku ni mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos mtha' yas pa'i 'byung gnas yin pa'i phyir chos mang phung po'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku ni mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos mtha' yas pa'i 'byung gnas yin pa'i phyir chos mang phung po'o //
translated: The Dharma body of the buddhas is the mass of many dharmas because it is the source of the infinite dharmas of the scriptures, etc.

original: chos thams cad kyi mchog yin ba'i phyir mchog rab bo //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mchog yin ba'i phyir mchog rab bo //
translated: It is the supreme good because it is the best of all dharmas.

original: zad mi shes pa'i phyir rtag pa'o //
analyzed: zad mi shes pa'i phyir rtag pa'o //
translated: It is eternal because it is inexhaustible.

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams bsags pa'i phyir dge ba'i tshogs so //
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams bsags pa'i phyir dge ba'i tshogs so //
translated: It is the accumulation of the good because it is the accumulation of the wholesome dharmas such as the powers and the fearlessnesses.

original: de lta bu'i sku de la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sku de la /
translated: In that body

original: bag chags bzlog pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la mi gnas pa'i phyir srid dang zhi ba dag las rnam par grol ba 'thob ste /
analyzed: bag chags bzlog pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la mi gnas pa'i phyir srid dang zhi ba dag las rnam par grol ba 'thob ste /
translated: one obtains the liberation from existence and from quiescence, because of the reversal of the instinct for conceptualization and because of the non-abiding in either cyclic life or in nirvana.

original: rnam pa de brgyad ni rtogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa de brgyad ni rtogs pa'i don to //
translated: These are the eight realizations.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i don du tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i don du tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the meaning of supremacy

original: blo ldan nyan thos tshogs bcas dge ba rgya chen don che dang // mtha' yas rtag rgyun mi 'chad zad mi shes pas zil gyis gnon //
analyzed: blo ldan nyan thos tshogs bcas dge ba rgya chen don che dang // mtha' yas rtag rgyun mi 'chad zad mi shes pas zil gyis gnon //
translated: The genius, together with the group of disciples, is superior through his virtue, which is vast, great in value, infinite, constant, uninterrupted, and inexhaustible.

original: dge bde yang 'jig rten 'jig rten ma yin yongs smin byed //
analyzed: dge bde yang 'jig rten 'jig rten ma yin yongs smin byed //
translated: Virtue, happiness, the world, the transcendence of the world, and the full maturation of beings.

original: dbang 'byor rnyed pa de ni phung po zhi bas zad mi shes //
analyzed: dbang 'byor rnyed pa de ni phung po zhi bas zad mi shes //
translated: The attainment of mastery is inexhaustible because of the pacification of the aggregates.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rgyu bzhi nyan thos rnams zil gyis gnon te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rgyu bzhi nyan thos rnams zil gyis gnon te /
translated: The bodhisattva surpasses the sravakas by four causes:

original: dge ba'i rtsa brgya che ba nyid dang / don che ba nyid dang / tshad med pa nyid dang / zad mi shes pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa brgya che ba nyid dang / don che ba nyid dang / tshad med pa nyid dang / zad mi shes pa nyid kyis so //
translated: by the greatness of his roots of virtue, by the abundance of his aims, by his immeasurability, and by his inexhaustibility.

original: @136b dge ba rnam pa bzhi bshad pa gang yin pa de yang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten ma yin pa dang / yongs su smin par byed pa dang / dbang 'byor pa rnyed pas te //
analyzed: @136b dge ba rnam pa bzhi bshad pa gang yin pa de yang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten ma yin pa dang / yongs su smin par byed pa dang / dbang 'byor pa rnyed pas te //
translated: The four kinds of virtue that have been explained are in the world, beyond the world, and the full maturation of beings, and the attainment of mastery.

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / yongs su smin par byed pa dang / dbang 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / yongs su smin par byed pa dang / dbang 'byor ba'o //
translated: They are mundane, supramundane, the full maturation of beings, and mastery.

original: yon tan de bzhi ni dge ba'i dbang du byas te bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan de bzhi ni dge ba'i dbang du byas te bstan pa yin no //
translated: These four virtues are taught in terms of the bodhisattvas own virtue.

original: dbang 'byor ba gang yin pa de ni phung po zhi bas zad mi shes par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dbang 'byor ba gang yin pa de ni phung po zhi bas zad mi shes par rig par bya ste /
translated: The attainment of mastery is to be known as inexhaustible because of the pacification of the aggregates.

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par yang mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par yang mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not perish even in the nirvana without residue.

original: skyabs su 'gro ba brjod par tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba brjod par tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the description of going for refuge

original: 'di ni de'i dngos 'dod pas khas len de yang snying brtse las rig bya /
analyzed: 'di ni de'i dngos 'dod pas khas len de yang snying brtse las rig bya /
translated: . One should know that the acceptance of that is due to the desire for its reality, and that it is born of compassion.

original: de las rnam par kun mkhyen phan dang bde byed dka' la skyo ba med //
analyzed: de las rnam par kun mkhyen phan dang bde byed dka' la skyo ba med //
translated: The one who is omniscient for the sake of benefit and happiness, who is tireless in difficulty,

original: des par 'byung la theg pa kun gyis rton pa'i yon tan rtag tu ldan //
analyzed: des par 'byung la theg pa kun gyis rton pa'i yon tan rtag tu ldan //
translated: who is always endowed with the virtues relied upon by all vehicles for the sake of definite emergence,

original: brda dang chos nyid thob pa blo ldan rnams kyi skyabs 'gro 'di mchog yin /
analyzed: brda dang chos nyid thob pa blo ldan rnams kyi skyabs 'gro 'di mchog yin /
translated: the refuge of the wise, who has attained the signless and the ultimate, is the best.

original: 'dis ni skyabs su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / las dang ldan pa dang / dbye ba'i don rnams bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni skyabs su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / las dang ldan pa dang / dbye ba'i don rnams bstan te /
translated: This shows the essence of going for refuge, its cause, its result, its function, its endowment, and its varieties.

original: sangs rgyas nyid 'dod pas khas len pa ni skyabs su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid 'dod pas khas len pa ni skyabs su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: The acceptance of the desire for buddhahood is the essence of going for refuge.

original: de yang snying rje las rig par bya'o zhes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: de yang snying rje las rig par bya'o zhes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: One should know that it is born of compassion. This is its cause.

original: de las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result is called “omniscience.”

original: sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba byed cing dka' ba spyad pa dag la mi skyo ba ni las so //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba byed cing dka' ba spyad pa dag la mi skyo ba ni las so //
translated: The activity is that it is not discouraged by the hardships of benefiting and gladdening sentient beings.

original: des par 'byung bar bya ba la theg pa thams cad kyis rton pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ni ldan pa'o //
analyzed: des par 'byung bar bya ba la theg pa thams cad kyis rton pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ni ldan pa'o //
translated: The endowment is that it is endowed with the virtue of being the refuge of all vehicles in the process of liberation.

original: brdar btags pa dang / chos nyid kyis thob pa rags pa dang phra ba'i khyad par gyis rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ni dbye ba'o //
analyzed: brdar btags pa dang / chos nyid kyis thob pa rags pa dang phra ba'i khyad par gyis rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ni dbye ba'o //
translated: The classification is that it is characterized by the gross and subtle distinctions of the nominal and the actual.

original: skyabs du 'gro ba'i khyad pa'i khyad par gyi tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: skyabs du 'gro ba'i khyad pa'i khyad par gyi tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the distinction of going for refuge

original: skyabs su 'gro ba 'dir song don chen te //
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba 'dir song don chen te //
translated: . This going for refuge has great significance,

original: de ni dpag med yon tan tshig su bcad pa /
analyzed: de ni dpag med yon tan tshig su bcad pa /
translated: For it increases the collection of boundless virtues.

original: skyabs su 'gro ba 'dir song don chen te //
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba 'dir song don chen te //
translated: This going for refuge has great significance,

original: de ni dpag med yon tan tshogs 'phel 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni dpag med yon tan tshogs 'phel 'gyur //
translated: For it increases the collection of boundless virtues.

original: 'gro ba 'di la snying rje'i bsams pas khyab //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di la snying rje'i bsams pas khyab //
translated: It pervades the world with thoughts of compassion.

original: mtshungs med 'phags chen chos kyang rgyal bar byed //
analyzed: mtshungs med 'phags chen chos kyang rgyal bar byed //
translated: And the Dharma of the great noble ones is victorious.

original: 'dir skyabs su 'gro ba'i don che ba nyid ni rang dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa dag gis ston te /
analyzed: 'dir skyabs su 'gro ba'i don che ba nyid ni rang dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa dag gis ston te /
translated: Here, the greatness of going for refuge is shown by accomplishing one's own and others' goals.

original: rang gi don sgrub pa ni yon tan rnam pa mang po dpag tu med pa 'phel bas so //
analyzed: rang gi don sgrub pa ni yon tan rnam pa mang po dpag tu med pa 'phel bas so //
translated: Accomplishing one's own goal is by increasing the many kinds of immeasurable qualities.

original: dpag tu med pa nyid ni rtog ge dang grangs dang dus kyis dpag tu med pa nyid las rig par bya ste /🔽yon tan 'phel ba de ni rtog ges kyang dpag tu @137a * //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa nyid ni rtog ge dang grangs dang dus kyis dpag tu med pa nyid las rig par bya ste / yon tan 'phel ba de ni rtog ges kyang dpag tu @137a * //
translated: Immeasurability should be understood as being immeasurable by reasoning, number, and time.

original: med la grangs kyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: med la grangs kyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: That increase in qualities is immeasurable even by reasoning, let alone by number.

original: gtan du ba yin pa'i phyir dus kyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan du ba yin pa'i phyir dus kyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not by time, because it is eternal.

original: gzhan gyi don sgrub pa yang bsam pa'i sgo nas ni snying rjes khyab pas so //🔽sbyor ba'i sgo nas theg pa chen po'i chos rgyas par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don sgrub pa yang bsam pa'i sgo nas ni snying rjes khyab pas so // sbyor ba'i sgo nas theg pa chen po'i chos rgyas par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Accomplishing others' goals is by pervading with compassion from the point of view of intention,🔽and by expanding the Dharma of the Great Vehicle from the point of view of application.

original: theg pa chen po ni 'phags pa chen po rnams kyi chos yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni 'phags pa chen po rnams kyi chos yin no //
translated: For the Great Vehicle is the Dharma of the great noble ones.

original: skyabs su 'gro ba'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The section on going for refuge is concluded.

original: // / rigs rab tu dbye ba bsdu bar tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: // / rigs rab tu dbye ba bsdu bar tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A summary of the analysis of the potential:

original: yod dang mchog dang mtshan nyid //
analyzed: yod dang mchog dang mtshan nyid //
translated: existence, supremacy,🔽characteristics, signs, analysis of the potential,

original: rtags dang rigs rab dbye ba dang // nyes dmigs dang ni phan yon dang // dpe rnams gnyis te rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: rtags dang rigs rab dbye ba dang // nyes dmigs dang ni phan yon dang // dpe rnams gnyis te rnam pa bzhi //
translated: disadvantage, benefit, and two examples—🔽these are the four topics.

original: 'dis ni rigs yod pa nyid dang / mchog nyid dang / mtshan nyid dang / rtags dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / phan yon dang / dpe zhes bya ba khyab ra de dag bsdus te /
analyzed: 'dis ni rigs yod pa nyid dang / mchog nyid dang / mtshan nyid dang / rtags dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / phan yon dang / dpe zhes bya ba khyab ra de dag bsdus te /
translated: This verse shows that the topics of the analysis of the potential are existence, supremacy, characteristics, signs, analysis, disadvantage, benefit, and two kinds of example.

original: khyad par de dag kyang so sor rnam pa bzhi bzhi'o //
analyzed: khyad par de dag kyang so sor rnam pa bzhi bzhi'o //
translated: And each of these topics is analyzed in four ways.

original: yod pa nyid du rnam par dbye bar tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: yod pa nyid du rnam par dbye bar tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: The analysis of existence:🔽Because of the variety of potentials, aspirations,

original: khams rnams dang ni mos pa dang // sgrub pa tha dad dbye ba dang // 'bras bu tha dang dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: khams rnams dang ni mos pa dang // sgrub pa tha dad dbye ba dang // 'bras bu tha dang dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: and practices, and because of the attainment of different results,

original: rigs yod nyid du nges par brjod //
analyzed: rigs yod nyid du nges par brjod //
translated: the existence of the potential is certain.

original: sems can rnams ni khams sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni khams sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the variety of the elements of sentient beings,

original: khams kyi dbye ba dpag tu med de /🔽ji skad du /
analyzed: khams kyi dbye ba dpag tu med de / ji skad du /
translated: The divisions of the elements are infinite.

original: ba ru ra'i mdo las bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ba ru ra'i mdo las bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said in the Vararuci-sutra:

original: de lta bas na khams kyi dbye ba da lta bu yang yid ches par bya dgos pas theg pa gsum gyi rigs tha dad pa yod do //
analyzed: de lta bas na khams kyi dbye ba da lta bu yang yid ches par bya dgos pas theg pa gsum gyi rigs tha dad pa yod do //
translated: Thus, one must believe that there are such divisions of the elements. Therefore, there are different lineages of the three vehicles.

original: sems can rnams kyi mos pa tha dad pa yang dmigs te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi mos pa tha dad pa yang dmigs te /
translated: One observes that the inclinations of sentient beings are different.

original: thog ma kho nar la theg pa 'ga' zhig kho na la mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thog ma kho nar la theg pa 'ga' zhig kho na la mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: From the very beginning, some are inclined toward one vehicle or another.

original: de ni rigs kyi dbye ba med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni rigs kyi dbye ba med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This would not be so if there were no different lineages.

original: rkyen gyi dbang gis mos pa bskyed du zin kyang sgrub pa tha dad pa dmigs te /
analyzed: rkyen gyi dbang gis mos pa bskyed du zin kyang sgrub pa tha dad pa dmigs te /
translated: One observes that, even though they have generated inclinations through the power of conditions, there are different practices.

original: kha cig ni des par sgrub la /
analyzed: kha cig ni des par sgrub la /
translated: Some practice well,

original: kha cig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ni ma yin no //
translated: and some do not.

original: de yang rigs kyi dbye ba med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang rigs kyi dbye ba med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This would not be so if there were no different lineages.

original: 'bras bu tha dad pa byang chub dman pa dang / 'bring dang / khyad par can rnams kyang dmigs te /
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pa byang chub dman pa dang / 'bring dang / khyad par can rnams kyang dmigs te /
translated: One observes that there are different results, namely, the lesser, middling, and great enlightenments.

original: de yang 'bras bu ni sa bon gyi ngo bo dang mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu ni sa bon gyi ngo bo dang mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: And this is because the result accords with the nature of the seed.

original: rigs kyi dbye ba med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi dbye ba med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The divisions of the family would not exist.

original: mchog nyid du rnam par dbye bar tshigs su bcad pa /🔽de dge khyad par 'phags pa dang thams cad dang ni don chen dang / mi zad pa yi rgyu mtshan phyir //
analyzed: mchog nyid du rnam par dbye bar tshigs su bcad pa / de dge khyad par 'phags pa dang thams cad dang ni don chen dang / mi zad pa yi rgyu mtshan phyir //
translated: A verse on the analysis of the supremacy of the family:🔽The family is considered supreme because it is the cause of the excellences of virtue, totality,

original: rigs mchog @137b nyid ces brjod pa yin //
analyzed: rigs mchog @137b nyid ces brjod pa yin //
translated: great purpose, and inexhaustibility.

original: 'dir rigs ni rgyu mtshan rnam pa bzhis mchog nyid du ston te /
analyzed: 'dir rigs ni rgyu mtshan rnam pa bzhis mchog nyid du ston te /
translated: Here the family is shown to be supreme for four reasons.

original: rigs de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams khyad par du 'phags pa dang / thams cad /
analyzed: rigs de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams khyad par du 'phags pa dang / thams cad /
translated: It is the cause of the excellences of virtue, totality,

original: don chen po dang / mi zad pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: don chen po dang / mi zad pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: great purpose, and inexhaustibility.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ni de ltar sbyangs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ni de ltar sbyangs pa ma yin no //
translated: The roots of virtue of the disciples are not so purified.

original: thams cad yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor are they total,

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have the powers, the fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: don chen po yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don chen po yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor do they have great purpose,

original: gzhan gyi don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not benefit others.

original: mi zad pa mang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi zad pa mang ma yin te /
translated: Nor are they inexhaustible,🔽because they are cut off in the nirvana without remainder.

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'da' bar mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'da' bar mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it ends in the nirvana that is without remainder of the aggregates.

original: mtshan nyid rnam par dbye bar tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam par dbye bar tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the analysis of the characteristics of the potential:🔽The potential is considered in terms of its nature, its development,

original: rang bzhin dang ni rgyas pa dang // de ni rten dang brten pa dang / yod med gnyis dang yon tan ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ni rgyas pa dang // de ni rten dang brten pa dang / yod med gnyis dang yon tan ni //
translated: its support, its dependence, its existence and nonexistence,

original: sgrol ba'i don du shes par bya //
analyzed: sgrol ba'i don du shes par bya //
translated: and its liberation as a quality.

original: 'dis rigs rnam pa bzhi ston te /
analyzed: 'dis rigs rnam pa bzhi ston te /
translated: This shows the four kinds of potential.

original: rang bzhin du gnas pa dang / yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / rten gyi ngo bo nyid dang // brten pa'i ngo bo nyid de de dag nyid dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas pa dang / yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / rten gyi ngo bo nyid dang // brten pa'i ngo bo nyid de de dag nyid dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The first is the naturally existing potential; the second is the developed potential; the third is the potential as the support; and the fourth is the supported potential.

original: de ni rgyu'i dngos por yod do //
analyzed: de ni rgyu'i dngos por yod do //
translated: The first exists as a cause;

original: 'bras bu'i dngos por med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dngos por med do //
translated: the second does not exist as a result.

original: rigs ni yon tan sgrol ba'i don du yang rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rigs ni yon tan sgrol ba'i don du yang rig par bya ste /
translated: The potential should be understood as the liberation of qualities.

original: 'di las yon tan sgrol zhing 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las yon tan sgrol zhing 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because qualities are liberated and emerge from it.

original: rtags rnam par dbye bar tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: rtags rnam par dbye bar tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the analysis of the signs of the potential:

original: sbyor ba'i sngon du snying rje dang / mos pa dang ni bzod pa dang // dge ba yang dag spyod pa ni //🔽rigs kyi rtags su shes par bya //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sngon du snying rje dang / mos pa dang ni bzod pa dang // dge ba yang dag spyod pa ni // rigs kyi rtags su shes par bya //
translated: the practice of virtue are the signs of the potential.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyi rtags ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyi rtags ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four signs of the potential of the bodhisattva:

original: sbyor ba'i sngon rol nyid nas sems can rnams la snying rje ba dang / theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa dang / dka' ba spyod pa dag la ji mi snyam pa'i don gyis bzod pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin gyi dge ba yang dag par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sngon rol nyid nas sems can rnams la snying rje ba dang / theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa dang / dka' ba spyod pa dag la ji mi snyam pa'i don gyis bzod pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin gyi dge ba yang dag par spyod pa'o //
translated: compassion for living beings, devotion to the Mahāyāna Dharma, patience in the face of the hardships involved in the practice of virtue, and the practice of virtue, which consists of the transcendences.

original: rab tu dbye ba rnam par dbye bar tshigs su bcad pa /🔽rigs ni des dang ma des pa //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba rnam par dbye bar tshigs su bcad pa / rigs ni des dang ma des pa //
translated: A verse on the analysis of the potential🔽The potential is considered to be good or bad,

original: rkyen rnams kyis ni mi 'phrogs dang // 'phrog pa nyid de mdor na rigs //
analyzed: rkyen rnams kyis ni mi 'phrogs dang // 'phrog pa nyid de mdor na rigs //
translated: unshakable or shakable, and in brief,🔽it is fourfold.

original: dbye ba 'di ni rnam pa bzhi / rigs ni mdor na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dbye ba 'di ni rnam pa bzhi / rigs ni mdor na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: In brief, the potential is fourfold:

original: des pa dang ma nges pa dang de dag nyid go rims bzhin du rkyen rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa dang / 'phrog pa'o //
analyzed: des pa dang ma nges pa dang de dag nyid go rims bzhin du rkyen rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa dang / 'phrog pa'o //
translated: The steadfast and the unsteadfast are, respectively, not carried away by conditions and are carried away by conditions.

original: nyes dmigs rnam par dbye bar tshigs su bcad pa //
analyzed: nyes dmigs rnam par dbye bar tshigs su bcad pa //
translated: A verse on the analysis of the disadvantages of the bodhisattva’s potential:🔽Addicted, with bad friends,

original: nyon mongs goms dang grogs ngan dang // phongs dang gzhan gyi @138a * //🔽dbang nyid de //
analyzed: nyon mongs goms dang grogs ngan dang // phongs dang gzhan gyi @138a * // dbang nyid de //
translated: poor, and under the control of others,

original: mdor na rigs kyi nyes dmigs ni //
analyzed: mdor na rigs kyi nyes dmigs ni //
translated: in brief, the disadvantages of the potential

original: rnam pa bzhi ru shes par bya //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyi nyes dmigs ni //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi ru shes par bya // byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyi nyes dmigs ni //
translated: should be understood as fourfold.🔽The disadvantages of the bodhisattva’s potential are those through which, even though one has the potential, one does not enter into the virtues.

original: gang gis na rigs la gnas kyang yon tan dag la mig 'jug pa ni mdor na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gang gis na rigs la gnas kyang yon tan dag la mig 'jug pa ni mdor na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: In brief, they are fourfold:

original: nyon mongs pa mang ba dang / mi dge ba'i grogs po dang / yo byad kyis phongs pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang du gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mang ba dang / mi dge ba'i grogs po dang / yo byad kyis phongs pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang du gyur ba'o //
translated: addicted, with bad friends, poor, and under the control of others.

original: phan yon rnam par dbye bar tshegs su bcad pa /
analyzed: phan yon rnam par dbye bar tshegs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the analysis of the benefits of the bodhisattva’s potential:

original: ring mo zhig nang na song du //
analyzed: ring mo zhig nang na song du //
translated: After a long time,

original: 'gro zhing myur du thar pa dang // de na'ang sdug bsngal chung du myong //
analyzed: 'gro zhing myur du thar pa dang // de na'ang sdug bsngal chung du myong //
translated: One goes to the lower realms only after a long time, and one is quickly freed from there, and even when born there, one experiences little suffering.

original: skyo bcas sems can smin bar byed //
analyzed: skyo bcas sems can smin bar byed //
translated: With a sorrowful mind, one brings beings to maturity.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la phan yon rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la phan yon rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The benefits of the bodhisattva potential are fourfold.

original: ring mo zhig na ngan song du 'gro ba dang // de dag nas myur du thar pa dang / de dag tu skyes na yang sdug bsngal chung du myong ba dang // sems skyo zhing der skyes pa'i sems can rnams snying rjes yong su smin par byed pa'o /
analyzed: ring mo zhig na ngan song du 'gro ba dang // de dag nas myur du thar pa dang / de dag tu skyes na yang sdug bsngal chung du myong ba dang // sems skyo zhing der skyes pa'i sems can rnams snying rjes yong su smin par byed pa'o /
translated: One goes to the lower realms only after a long time, and one is quickly freed from there, and even when born there, one experiences little suffering, and with a sorrowful mind, one brings beings born there to maturity through compassion.

original: gser gyi rigs chen po dang 'dra bar tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: gser gyi rigs chen po dang 'dra bar tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the analogy of the great mine of gold🔽Know that the bodhisattvas' potential

original: gser gyi rigs bzhin shes par bya //
analyzed: gser gyi rigs bzhin shes par bya //
translated: is like a great mine of gold,

original: dge ba dpag tu med pa'i gnas //
analyzed: dge ba dpag tu med pa'i gnas //
translated: An inexhaustible mine of the buddhas' qualities,🔽of knowledge and of stainlessness.🔽It is the mine of all the buddhas' qualities,

original: ye shes dang ni dri med ldan //🔽mthu rnams kyi yang gnas yin no //
analyzed: ye shes dang ni dri med ldan // mthu rnams kyi yang gnas yin no //
translated: of knowledge, and of stainlessness.

original: gser gyi rigs chen po ni gser rnam ba bzhi'i gnas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: gser gyi rigs chen po ni gser rnam ba bzhi'i gnas su 'gyur te /
translated: A great mine of gold is the source of four kinds of gold: gold in its impure state, gold that must be heated, gold that is slightly purified, and the best quality gold.

original: mang po dang / 'od gsal ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / las su rung ba'o //
analyzed: mang po dang / 'od gsal ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / las su rung ba'o //
translated: numerous,🔽radiant,🔽stainless,🔽and serviceable.

original: de dang chos mthun par byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba dpag tu med pa'i gnas dang / ye shes kyi gnas dang / nyon mongs pa'i dri ma med pa'i gnas dang / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i mthu'i gnas yin ta /
analyzed: de dang chos mthun par byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba dpag tu med pa'i gnas dang / ye shes kyi gnas dang / nyon mongs pa'i dri ma med pa'i gnas dang / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i mthu'i gnas yin ta /
translated: It is a source of immeasurable roots of virtue, a source of knowledge, a source of the absence of the defilement of afflictions, and a source of the power of the superknowledges.

original: de lta bas na gser gyi rigs chen po lta bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gser gyi rigs chen po lta bur rig par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva potential should be understood as like a great mine of gold in five ways.

original: rin po che'i rigs chen po dang 'dra bar tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: rin po che'i rigs chen po dang 'dra bar tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the comparison of the bodhisattva potential to a great mine of jewels:

original: rin chen mchog rigs bzhin shes bya //
analyzed: rin chen mchog rigs bzhin shes bya //
translated: It should be known as like the best jewel mine,

original: byang chub chen po'i rgyu mtshan phyir //
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i rgyu mtshan phyir //
translated: because it is the cause of great enlightenment,

original: ye shes che dang ting nge 'dzin 'phags //
analyzed: ye shes che dang ting nge 'dzin 'phags //
translated: of great knowledge, of exalted meditative concentration,

original: sems can mang po'i don gnas phyir //
analyzed: sems can mang po'i don gnas phyir //
translated: and of the benefit of many beings.

original: rin po che'i rigs chen po ni rin po che bzhi'i gnas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: rin po che'i rigs chen po ni rin po che bzhi'i gnas su 'gyur te /
translated: A great mine of jewels is a source of four kinds of jewels.

original: rigs dan ldan pa dang / kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshad phun sum tshogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: rigs dan ldan pa dang / kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshad phun sum tshogs pa'i'o //
translated: the family is endowed with the best lineage, the best color, the best shape, and the best size.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva family should be understood in the same way.

original: @138b byang chub den po'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir dang / ye shes chen po'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir dang / 'phags pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: @138b byang chub den po'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir dang / ye shes chen po'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir dang / 'phags pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is the sign of the cause of enlightenment, the sign of great intuition, and the sign of the noble concentrations.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems yang dag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems yang dag par gnas pa'o //
translated: Concentration is the correct abiding of the mind.

original: sems can mang po yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems can mang po yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is the sign of the cause of the full maturation of many beings,

original: sems can mtha' yas pa yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can mtha' yas pa yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it brings to full maturation limitless beings.

original: rigs med pa la gnas pa rnam par dbye bar tshigs su bcad pa /🔽la la gcig tu nyes par spyod nges yod //
analyzed: rigs med pa la gnas pa rnam par dbye bar tshigs su bcad pa / la la gcig tu nyes par spyod nges yod //
translated: A verse on the analysis of those who are not in the family:🔽Some are definitely of bad character;

original: la la dkar po'i chos rnams kun tu bcom //
analyzed: la la dkar po'i chos rnams kun tu bcom //
translated: some have destroyed the seeds of virtue.

original: la la thar ba'i cha mthun dge ba med //
analyzed: la la thar ba'i cha mthun dge ba med //
translated: Some lack virtue that is conducive to liberation.

original: dkar po dman pa yod pa rgyu dang bral /
analyzed: dkar po dman pa yod pa rgyu dang bral /
translated: Some have inferior virtue, some are devoid of causes,🔽and some are devoid of the root.

original: don 'di la ni rigs med pa la gnas pa yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can yin par bzhed do //
analyzed: don 'di la ni rigs med pa la gnas pa yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can yin par bzhed do //
translated: In this context, one who is devoid of the spiritual gene is considered to be a person who is incapable of attaining final nirvāṇa.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, there are two types of persons who are incapable of attaining final nirvāṇa:

original: de'i dus dang gtan yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: de'i dus dang gtan yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can no //
translated: those who are incapable of attaining final nirvāṇa at that time and those who are incapable of attaining final nirvāṇa at any time.

original: de'i dus su yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can yang rnam pa bzhi ste //
analyzed: de'i dus su yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can yang rnam pa bzhi ste //
translated: Those who are incapable of attaining final nirvāṇa at that time are of four types:

original: gcig tu nyes par spyod pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa dang / thar pa'i cha dang / mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba med pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dman pa yod pa tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //🔽gtan yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can ni rgyu dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: gcig tu nyes par spyod pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa dang / thar pa'i cha dang / mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba med pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dman pa yod pa tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o // gtan yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can ni rgyu dang bral ba ste /
translated: those who are exclusively given to error, those whose roots of virtue have been severed, those who lack the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation, and those who have inferior roots of virtue and have not completed the requisite preparatory tasks.🔽Those who are incapable of attaining final nirvāṇa at any time are devoid of the causes for attaining nirvāṇa.

original: gang la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rigs nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rigs nyid med pa'o //
translated: They are those who lack the spiritual gene for attaining nirvāṇa.

original: rang bzhin dang rgyas pa'i rigs rnam par dbye ba nyid du tshigs su bcad pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang rgyas pa'i rigs rnam par dbye ba nyid du tshigs su bcad pa //
translated: One verse on the analysis of the naturally abiding and developed potentials

original: zab cing rgya cher bshad pa gzhan la phan phyir bstan pa'i chos chen la //
analyzed: zab cing rgya cher bshad pa gzhan la phan phyir bstan pa'i chos chen la //
translated: . The great teaching is explained as profound and magnificent.

original: mi shes bzhin du mos pa shin tu rgya chen 'byung zhing sgrub la bzod //
analyzed: mi shes bzhin du mos pa shin tu rgya chen 'byung zhing sgrub la bzod //
translated: Faith arises in it on a vast scale, even without understanding, and one is patient in practice.

original: de dag tha mar rnam pa gnyis mchog phun sum tshogs 'gyur gang yin de //
analyzed: de dag tha mar rnam pa gnyis mchog phun sum tshogs 'gyur gang yin de //
translated: In the end, one attains the supreme excellence of the two aims.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rang bzhin yon tan ldan de rgyas pa'i rigs las shes //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rang bzhin yon tan ldan de rgyas pa'i rigs las shes //
translated: This is the bodhisattvas’ naturally good potential and the developed potential.

original: zab cing rgya che bar bshad pa gzhan la phan par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa theg pa chen po'i chos rgya chen po la zab cing rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: zab cing rgya che bar bshad pa gzhan la phan par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa theg pa chen po'i chos rgya chen po la zab cing rgya che ba'o //
translated: The great teaching of the universal vehicle is explained as profound and magnificent, because it is taught as being profound and magnificent in its explanation of the profound and the magnificent.

original: don mi shes bzhin du mas brgya chen po 'byung zhing sgrub pa la yang mi skyo la /
analyzed: don mi shes bzhin du mas brgya chen po 'byung zhing sgrub pa la yang mi skyo la /
translated: Faith in it arises on a vast scale, even without understanding its meaning, and one is not discouraged in the practice of it.

original: tha mar phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis kyi mchog byang chub chen po phun sum tshogs pa 'thob par 'gyur ba yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs rang bzhin gyis yon tan dang ldan pa dang rgyas pa'i che ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tha mar phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis kyi mchog byang chub chen po phun sum tshogs pa 'thob par 'gyur ba yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs rang bzhin gyis yon tan dang ldan pa dang rgyas pa'i che ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Finally, one attains the perfection of the supreme of the two perfections, the perfection of great enlightenment. This is the greatness of the bodhisattva potential, which is endowed with the qualities of nature and development.

original: rnam pa gnyis @139a * //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis @139a * // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Two kinds of perfection

original: gnyis po 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dag go //
analyzed: gnyis po 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dag go //
translated: are the mundane and the supramundane.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: Supreme means superior.

original: 'bras bu'i sgo nas rigs khyad par du bya bar tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sgo nas rigs khyad par du bya bar tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the superiority of the potential from the point of view of result:

original: yon tan shin tu rgya che byang chub shing bskyed phyir //
analyzed: yon tan shin tu rgya che byang chub shing bskyed phyir //
translated: Because it produces the tree of enlightenment with its vast good qualities,

original: bde dang sdug bsngal chen po zhi 'thob bya'i phyir //
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal chen po zhi 'thob bya'i phyir //
translated: because it attains the pacification of great happiness and suffering,

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan bde byed pa 'bras bu'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan bde byed pa 'bras bu'i phyir //
translated: and because it acts for the benefit and happiness of self and other,

original: rigs mchog de ni rtsa ba bzang po lta bu yin //
analyzed: rigs mchog de ni rtsa ba bzang po lta bu yin //
translated: that supreme potential is like a good seed.

original: 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs byang chub kyi shing rang dang gzhan la phan pa dang / bde ba byed pa'i 'bras bu can gyi rtsa ba bzang po nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs byang chub kyi shing rang dang gzhan la phan pa dang / bde ba byed pa'i 'bras bu can gyi rtsa ba bzang po nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the Bodhisattva-lineage is the good root of the tree of enlightenment, which bears the fruit of benefit and happiness for self and others.

original: rigs kyi skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: rigs kyi skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on the Bodhisattva-lineage is completed.

original: // / sems bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid du tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: // / sems bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid du tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the characteristics of the generation of the Thought of enlightenment:

original: spro ba che dang rtsom pa che //
analyzed: spro ba che dang rtsom pa che //
translated: 1. Great in enthusiasm, great in undertaking,

original: don che ba dang 'byung ba che //
analyzed: don che ba dang 'byung ba che //
translated: great in aim, great in performance,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sems dpa' ste //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sems dpa' ste //
translated: the Thought of the Bodhisattva is the Thought

original: don gnyis ldan pa'i sems 'byung ba //🔽spro ba chen po ni go cha'i brtson 'gyus kyis te /
analyzed: don gnyis ldan pa'i sems 'byung ba // spro ba chen po ni go cha'i brtson 'gyus kyis te /
translated: which is the source of the twofold aim.

original: zab mo dang yun ring bor dka' ba spyad pa sgrub pa la spro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab mo dang yun ring bor dka' ba spyad pa sgrub pa la spro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Great in enthusiasm, because of the armor-like enthusiasm for the difficult practices of the profound and the long-term.

original: rtsom pa chen po ni go cha ji lta ba bzhin sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyis so //
analyzed: rtsom pa chen po ni go cha ji lta ba bzhin sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyis so //
translated: Great in undertaking, because of the enthusiasm for the practice of the armor.

original: don chen po ni bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i ched kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don chen po ni bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i ched kyi phyir ro //
translated: Great in aim, because of the aim of benefit for self and other.

original: 'byung ba chen po ni byang chub chen po yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po ni byang chub chen po yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great elements are the great enlightenment, because it is their perfect accomplishment.

original: 'dis ni yon tan rnam pa gsum yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni yon tan rnam pa gsum yongs su bstan te /
translated: This shows the three kinds of excellences.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i yon tan ni tshig gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i yon tan ni tshig gnyis kyis so //
translated: The excellence of the person is shown by two verses.

original: don byed pa'i yon tan dang 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin ba'i yon tan ni tshig gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: don byed pa'i yon tan dang 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin ba'i yon tan ni tshig gnyis kyis so //
translated: The excellence of function and the excellence of result are shown by two verses.

original: don gnyis dang ldan pa ni byang chub chen po dang sems can gyi don bya ba la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gnyis dang ldan pa ni byang chub chen po dang sems can gyi don bya ba la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has two aims, because it aims at great enlightenment and the benefit of beings.

original: yon tan gsum dang don gnyis la dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i sems pa ni sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan gsum dang don gnyis la dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i sems pa ni sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The intention that has the three excellences and the two aims is called the generation of the spirit of enlightenment.

original: sems bskyed pa rab tu dbye bar bar tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa rab tu dbye bar bar tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the analysis of the generation of the spirit🔽.

original: sems bskyed de ni sa rnams la //🔽mos dang lhag bsam dag pa dang // rnam par smin pa gzhan du 'dod //
analyzed: sems bskyed de ni sa rnams la // mos dang lhag bsam dag pa dang // rnam par smin pa gzhan du 'dod //
translated: That generation of the spirit is considered on the stages🔽to be aspirational, engaged, pure,

original: de bzhin sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
translated: and likewise, with a different maturation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The generation of the spirit of enlightenment of the bodhisattvas is of four kinds.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni mos pa las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni mos pa las 'byung ba'o //
translated: On the stage of action in faith, it is the generation of the spirit through faith.

original: sa bdun la ni lhag pa'i bsam ba rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: sa bdun la ni lhag pa'i bsam ba rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: On the seven stages, it is the generation of the spirit through pure superior intention.

original: sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la ni rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la ni rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: On the eighth stage, etc., it is the generation of the spirit through maturation.

original: sangs rgyas kyis la ni sgrib pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis la ni sgrib pa med pa'o //
translated: And on the Buddha stage, it is the generation of the spirit without obscurations.

original: sems bskyed pa rnam par gtan la dbab par tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa rnam par gtan la dbab par tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste /
translated: Four verses on the determination of the generation of the spirit.

original: de yi rtsa ba snying rjer @139b 'dod //
analyzed: de yi rtsa ba snying rjer @139b 'dod //
translated: Compassion is considered its root.

original: rtag tu sems can phan par sems //
analyzed: rtag tu sems can phan par sems //
translated: The thought of always benefiting beings.

original: chos la mos dang de bzhin de'i //
analyzed: chos la mos dang de bzhin de'i //
translated: Interest in the Dharma and likewise

original: ye shes tshol bar dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes tshol bar dmigs pa'o //
translated: the intuition of its meaning is its aim.

original: gong du 'dun pa 'gro ba ste //
analyzed: gong du 'dun pa 'gro ba ste //
translated: Aspiration is its impetus.

original: sdom pa rgya chen de yi rten //
analyzed: sdom pa rgya chen de yi rten //
translated: Its support is the vast vow.

original: lam 'gog pa ni mthun phyogs //
analyzed: lam 'gog pa ni mthun phyogs //
translated: Its obstruction is the contrary tendency,

original: slong zhing dang du len pa'o //🔽bsod nams ye shes rang bzhin gyi //
analyzed: slong zhing dang du len pa'o // bsod nams ye shes rang bzhin gyi //
translated: which is to be overcome by its antidote.🔽Its benefit is the increase of virtue,

original: dge ba'i 'phel ba de'i phan yon //
analyzed: dge ba'i 'phel ba de'i phan yon //
translated: which is of the natures of merit and intuition.

original: pha rol phyin la rtag sbyor ba //
analyzed: pha rol phyin la rtag sbyor ba //
translated: Its application is to the transcendences.

original: de ni nges par 'byung bar brjod //
analyzed: de ni nges par 'byung bar brjod //
translated: It is called “the going forth. ”

original: 'di yi mthar thug sa yin te //
analyzed: 'di yi mthar thug sa yin te //
translated: It is the ultimate stage.

original: so so rang gi der sbyor bas //
analyzed: so so rang gi der sbyor bas //
translated: It is the connection with one’s own stage.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa //
translated: The generation of the thought of the bodhisattva

original: rnam pa nges par shes par bya //
analyzed: rnam pa nges par shes par bya //
translated: should be understood as having a certain number of aspects.

original: de la rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni 'di yin te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa rnam pa bzhi po 'di'i rtsa ba ni gang /
analyzed: de la rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni 'di yin te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa rnam pa bzhi po 'di'i rtsa ba ni gang /
translated: The determination is as follows: What is the root of these four kinds of generation of the thought of the bodhisattva?

original: bsam pa ni gang /
analyzed: bsam pa ni gang /
translated: What is the intention?

original: mos pa ni gang /
analyzed: mos pa ni gang /
translated: What is the aspiration?

original: dmigs pa ni gang /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni gang /
translated: What is the object?

original: 'gro ba ni gang /🔽rten ni gang /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni gang / rten ni gang /
translated: What is the going forth?🔽What is the support?

original: nyes dmigs ni gang /
analyzed: nyes dmigs ni gang /
translated: What is the danger?

original: phan yon ni gang /
analyzed: phan yon ni gang /
translated: What is the benefit?

original: des par 'byung ba ni gang /
analyzed: des par 'byung ba ni gang /
translated: What is the going forth?

original: mthar thug pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: mthar thug pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the ultimate stage?

original: smras pa / snying rje chen po ni rtsa pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / snying rje chen po ni rtsa pa'o //
translated: It is said: Great compassion is the root.

original: rtag tu sems can la phan par sems pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu sems can la phan par sems pa'o //
translated: The constant intention to help sentient beings.

original: theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa'o //🔽de'i ye shes la tshol bar dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa'o // de'i ye shes la tshol bar dmigs pa ste /
translated: Aspiration for the teaching of the universal vehicle.🔽The object is the search for that knowledge,

original: de'i ye shes la tshol ba'i rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ye shes la tshol ba'i rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object is the search for that knowledge.

original: gong nas gong du 'dun pa ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gong nas gong du 'dun pa ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: The higher and higher aspiration is the going.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa ni rten no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa ni rten no //
translated: The Bodhisattva vow of morality is the support.

original: lam gcod pa na nyes dmigs te lam gcod pa de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: lam gcod pa na nyes dmigs te lam gcod pa de yang gang zhe na /
translated: The obstruction of the path is the disadvantage. What is that obstruction of the path?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs theg pa gzhan gyi sems slong zhing dang du len pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs theg pa gzhan gyi sems slong zhing dang du len pa'o //
translated: It is the arousal and acceptance of the mind of the other vehicle, which is the counteragent.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba ni phan yon ni //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba ni phan yon ni //
translated: The increase of the roots of virtue consisting of merit and knowledge is the benefit.

original: rtag tu pha rol tu phyin pa la goms pa ni nge par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu pha rol tu phyin pa la goms pa ni nge par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The constant practice of the transcendences is the emergence.

original: sa ni mthar thug pa yin te /
analyzed: sa ni mthar thug pa yin te /
translated: The stage is the culmination.

original: so so rang gi sa la sbyor bas gang zhig sa gang la zhugs pa'i sa de ni de'i mthar thug pa yin no //
analyzed: so so rang gi sa la sbyor bas gang zhig sa gang la zhugs pa'i sa de ni de'i mthar thug pa yin no //
translated: The stage to which one is connected by application is the culmination of that one who has entered that stage.

original: yang dag par blang pa brda las byung ba'i sems bskyed par tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: yang dag par blang pa brda las byung ba'i sems bskyed par tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: One verse on the generation of the resolve by accepting the vow

original: grogs stobs rgyu stobs rtsa ba'i stobs //
analyzed: grogs stobs rgyu stobs rtsa ba'i stobs //
translated: The strength of the friend, the strength of the cause, the strength of the root,

original: thos stobs dge ba goms pa las //
analyzed: thos stobs dge ba goms pa las //
translated: The strength of hearing, and the strength of virtuous application,

original: mi brtan pa dang brtan 'byung ba //
analyzed: mi brtan pa dang brtan 'byung ba //
translated: From these five strengths the generation of the resolve is weak or strong.

original: gzhan gyis bstan pa'i sems bskyed bshad //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan pa'i sems bskyed bshad //
translated: The generation of the Thought by way of another's teaching is explained.

original: gzhan gyis bstan zhing gzhan gyi rnam par rig byed las sems bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par blangs pa brda las byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan zhing gzhan gyi rnam par rig byed las sems bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par blangs pa brda las byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That generation of the Thought which is by way of another's teaching, by way of another's intimation, is called the one which is taken up by way of a sign.

original: de yang grogs kyi stobs las te /
analyzed: de yang grogs kyi stobs las te /
translated: That also is from the power of a friend.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi ngor @140a * //🔽skye ba yang yod do //🔽rgyu'i stobs las te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi ngor @140a * // skye ba yang yod do // rgyu'i stobs las te /
translated: It is born from the face of a spiritual guide.🔽It is born from the power of a cause.

original: rigs kyi mthus skye ba yang yod do //
analyzed: rigs kyi mthus skye ba yang yod do //
translated: It is born from the power of the family.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs las te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs las te /
translated: It is born from the power of the roots of virtue.

original: de'i rigs rgyas pa'i sgo nas kye ba yang yod do //
analyzed: de'i rigs rgyas pa'i sgo nas kye ba yang yod do //
translated: It is born from the expansion of that family.

original: thos pa'i stobs las kye ba yang yod de //
analyzed: thos pa'i stobs las kye ba yang yod de //
translated: It is born from the power of hearing.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs de dang de bshad pa na mang du byang chub tu sems skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs de dang de bshad pa na mang du byang chub tu sems skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is born when that and that Dharma discourse is explained, because many generate the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: dge ba goms pa las te /
analyzed: dge ba goms pa las te /
translated: It is born from the practice of virtue.

original: tshe 'di nyid la rtag tu nyan pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba la sogs pa las kye ba yang yod do //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la rtag tu nyan pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba la sogs pa las kye ba yang yod do //
translated: It is born from always listening to, holding, and keeping in this very life.

original: de yang grogs kyi stobs las ni mi brtan par 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang grogs kyi stobs las ni mi brtan par 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that the former arises from the power of friends, while the latter arises from the power of causes.

original: rgyu la sogs pa'i stobs las ni brtan pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu la sogs pa'i stobs las ni brtan pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The latter is firm.

original: don dam pa'i sems bskyed par tshigs su bcad pa bdun te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i sems bskyed par tshigs su bcad pa bdun te /
translated: Seven verses on the ultimate generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: rdzogs pa'i rgyas rab bsnyen byas //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rgyas rab bsnyen byas //
translated: The bodhisattvas, having served the perfect buddhas,

original: bsod nams ye shes tshogs rab bsags /
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes tshogs rab bsags /
translated: having gathered the stores of merit and wisdom,

original: chos la mi rtog ye shes ni //
analyzed: chos la mi rtog ye shes ni //
translated: and having generated the nonconceptual intuition of things,🔽attain the ultimate thought.

original: skyes phyir de ni dam par 'dod //
analyzed: skyes phyir de ni dam par 'dod //
translated: The ultimate thought is considered the best,

original: chos dan sems can rnams dang ni //
analyzed: chos dan sems can rnams dang ni //
translated: because it is the equality of thought toward the teaching, sentient beings,

original: de yi bya ba sangs rgyas nyid //🔽mchog la sems mnyam rnyed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de yi bya ba sangs rgyas nyid // mchog la sems mnyam rnyed pa'i phyir //
translated: and the activities of the buddhas.🔽The joy of the bodhisattvas is preeminent,

original: de yi rab dga' khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: de yi rab dga' khyad par 'phags //
translated: because they have attained the equality of thought toward the highest enlightenment.

original: skye ba rgya che de la spro //
analyzed: skye ba rgya che de la spro //
translated: The bodhisattvas are born in the great lineages,🔽are enthusiastic for the great activities,🔽have the great thought,

original: bsam pa yang ni dag pa dang / lhag ma dag la mkhas pa dang / nges par 'byung bar shes par bya //
analyzed: bsam pa yang ni dag pa dang / lhag ma dag la mkhas pa dang / nges par 'byung bar shes par bya //
translated: and are skilled in the great procedure.🔽The seed of the ultimate thought is the faith in the teaching,

original: chos la mos pa sa bon dang // pha rol phyin mchog ma las skyes //
analyzed: chos la mos pa sa bon dang // pha rol phyin mchog ma las skyes //
translated: it is born from the supreme mother, the transcendences,

original: bsam gtan las byung bde ba'i mngal //
analyzed: bsam gtan las byung bde ba'i mngal //
translated: and it grows in the womb of the meditation of the bodhisattva.

original: snying rje bskyed pa'i ma ma'o //
analyzed: snying rje bskyed pa'i ma ma'o //
translated: She is the grandmother who generates compassion.🔽It should be understood as vast

original: smon lam chen po bcu bsgrub phyir //
analyzed: smon lam chen po bcu bsgrub phyir //
translated: because it accomplishes the ten great vows.

original: rgya che bar ni shes par bya //
analyzed: rgya che bar ni shes par bya //
translated: It should be understood as enthusiastic

original: dka' ba yun ring mi skye'i phyir //
analyzed: dka' ba yun ring mi skye'i phyir //
translated: because it does not weary of long and difficult tasks.

original: spro bar khong du chud par bya //
analyzed: spro bar khong du chud par bya //
translated: It should be understood as pure in will

original: byang chub nye bar rtogs pa dang // de yi thabs shes rnyed pa'i phyir //🔽bsam pa dag pas shes par bya //
analyzed: byang chub nye bar rtogs pa dang // de yi thabs shes rnyed pa'i phyir // bsam pa dag pas shes par bya //
translated: because it realizes the nearness of enlightenment and finds the knowledge of its means.

original: sa gzhan tshul la mkhas pa nyid //
analyzed: sa gzhan tshul la mkhas pa nyid //
translated: Skill in the other stages is to be understood

original: ji ltar rnam gzhag yid byed pas //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam gzhag yid byed pas //
translated: as the way to proceed,🔽because it is the knowledge of the reality of the stages

original: de rtog nyid du shes phyir dang // de nyid la yang mi rtog phyir //
analyzed: de rtog nyid du shes phyir dang // de nyid la yang mi rtog phyir //
translated: and because it is the nonconceptualization of that reality.

original: nges par 'byung bar shes par bya //🔽tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni /
analyzed: nges par 'byung bar shes par bya // tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni /
translated: It should be understood as the way to proceed🔽because it is the knowledge of the reality of the stages🔽and because it is the nonconceptualization of that reality.

original: lung dang bsgrub pa dang rtogs pa'i khyad par dag gis sems bskyed pa don dam pa nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: lung dang bsgrub pa dang rtogs pa'i khyad par dag gis sems bskyed pa don dam pa nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: The first verse shows the generation of the thought of enlightenment as ultimate reality by means of the distinctions of scripture, attainment, and realization.

original: don dam pa'i sems bskyed pa de yangs rab tu dga' ba yin pas de'i rab tu dga' ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i rgyu ston te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i sems bskyed pa de yangs rab tu dga' ba yin pas de'i rab tu dga' ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i rgyu ston te /
translated: The ultimate generation of the thought of enlightenment is the stage of Extreme Joy, and so it shows the cause of the superiority of that joy.

original: de la chos rnams la sems mnyam pa nyid ni chos la bdag med par rtogs pa'i @140b phyir ro //
analyzed: de la chos rnams la sems mnyam pa nyid ni chos la bdag med par rtogs pa'i @140b phyir ro //
translated: The equality of mind toward phenomena is because of realizing the selflessness of phenomena.

original: sems can rnams la sems mnyam pa nyid ni bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams la sems mnyam pa nyid ni bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The equality of mind toward sentient beings is because of realizing the equality of self and others.

original: sems can gyi bya ba dag la sems mnyam pa nyid ni bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal dang 'dra bar de dag gi sdug bsngal zad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi bya ba dag la sems mnyam pa nyid ni bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal dang 'dra bar de dag gi sdug bsngal zad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The equality of mind toward the activities of sentient beings is because of desiring to eliminate their suffering as if it were one's own.

original: sangs rgyas nyid la sems mnyam pa nyid ni de'i chos kyi dbyings dang bdag dbyer med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la sems mnyam pa nyid ni de'i chos kyi dbyings dang bdag dbyer med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The equality of mind toward buddhahood is because of realizing the inseparability of the realm of reality and oneself.

original: don dam pa pa'i sems bskyed pa de nyid la don dam pa rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: don dam pa pa'i sems bskyed pa de nyid la don dam pa rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
translated: That ultimate generation of the enlightenment mind should be known as having six ultimate aspects:

original: skye ba dang / rgya che ba dang / spro ba dang / bsam pa dag pa dang / khag ma la mkhas pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang / rgya che ba dang / spro ba dang / bsam pa dag pa dang / khag ma la mkhas pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: arising, vastness, enthusiasm, pure attitude, skill in means, and deliverance.

original: de la skye ba ni sa bon dang ma dang mngal dang ma ma'i bye brag las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la skye ba ni sa bon dang ma dang mngal dang ma ma'i bye brag las rig par bya'o //
translated: Birth is to be understood in terms of the seed, the mother, the womb, and the nurse.

original: rgya chen po ni smon lam chen po bcu mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya chen po ni smon lam chen po bcu mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Vast refers to the accomplishment of the ten great vows.

original: spro ba ni dka' ba yun ring bos mi skyo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spro ba ni dka' ba yun ring bos mi skyo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Joyful refers to the absence of weariness from long and difficult practice.

original: bsam pa dag pa ni /
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa ni /
translated: Pure intention refers to

original: byang chub dang nye bar shes pa'i phyir dang / de'i thabs shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub dang nye bar shes pa'i phyir dang / de'i thabs shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the knowledge that enlightenment is near and the knowledge of the means to attain it.

original: lhag ma la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: lhag ma la mkhas pa ni /
translated: Skill in the remainder refers to

original: sa gzhan dag la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: sa gzhan dag la mkhas pa'o //
translated: skill in the other stages.

original: nges par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Departure refers to

original: sa ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa bzhin yid la byed pas so //
analyzed: sa ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa bzhin yid la byed pas so //
translated: the mental attention to the stages as they are established.

original: ji ltar yid la byed pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar yid la byed pas she na /
translated: How does one attend to them?

original: 'di ni rtog pa tsam mo zhes sa rnam par gzhag pa de rtog pa nyid du shes pa'i phyir dang / rtog pa nyid du shes pa de nyid la yang rnams par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni rtog pa tsam mo zhes sa rnam par gzhag pa de rtog pa nyid du shes pa'i phyir dang / rtog pa nyid du shes pa de nyid la yang rnams par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is mere imagination, and one knows that the establishment of the stages is just imagination, and one has no imagination even about that knowledge that it is imagination.

original: dpe'i che ba nyid du tshigs su bcad pa drug ste /
analyzed: dpe'i che ba nyid du tshigs su bcad pa drug ste /
translated: Six verses on the greatness of the example

original: bskyed pa sa dang mtshungs pa ste //
analyzed: bskyed pa sa dang mtshungs pa ste //
translated: The first is like the earth.

original: gzhan ni bzang bo'i gser dang 'dra //
analyzed: gzhan ni bzang bo'i gser dang 'dra //
translated: The second is like fine gold.

original: zla ba yar gyi tshes ba bzhin //
analyzed: zla ba yar gyi tshes ba bzhin //
translated: The third is like the waxing moon.

original: gzhan ni me dang 'drar shes bya //🔽gzhan ni gter chen bzhin shes bya //
analyzed: gzhan ni me dang 'drar shes bya // gzhan ni gter chen bzhin shes bya //
translated: The fourth is like a blazing fire.🔽The fifth is like a great treasure.

original: gzhan ni rin chen 'byung gnas bzhin //
analyzed: gzhan ni rin chen 'byung gnas bzhin //
translated: The sixth is like a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: rgya mtshor 'dra bar shes bya gzhan /🔽rdor je dang 'dra ri rab 'dra //
analyzed: rgya mtshor 'dra bar shes bya gzhan / rdor je dang 'dra ri rab 'dra //
translated: The seventh is like the ocean.🔽The eighth is like a diamond or Mount Meru.

original: sman gyi rgyal bo 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: sman gyi rgyal bo 'dra ba ste /
translated: The ninth is like the king of mountains.

original: gzhan ni mdza' chen 'drar shes bya //
analyzed: gzhan ni mdza' chen 'drar shes bya //
translated: The tenth is like a great friend.🔽The eleventh is like a wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: yid bzhin nor bu 'dra ba dang // gzhan ni nyi ma 'drar shes bya //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu 'dra ba dang // gzhan ni nyi ma 'drar shes bya //
translated: The twelfth is like the sun.

original: gzhan ni dri za'i dbyangs snyan bzhin //
analyzed: gzhan ni dri za'i dbyangs snyan bzhin //
translated: The thirteenth is like the sweet voice of the gandharvas.

original: gzhan ni rgyal po 'drar shes bya //
analyzed: gzhan ni rgyal po 'drar shes bya //
translated: The fourteenth is like a king.

original: de bzhin gzhan ni mdzod lta bu //🔽lam po che dang 'drar shes bya /
analyzed: de bzhin gzhan ni mdzod lta bu // lam po che dang 'drar shes bya /
translated: The fifteenth is like a treasury.🔽The sixteenth is like a great road.

original: theg pa 'dra bar shes bya ste //🔽sems bskyed bkod ma 'dra ba yin //
analyzed: theg pa 'dra bar shes bya ste // sems bskyed bkod ma 'dra ba yin //
translated: The seventeenth is like a vehicle.🔽The eighteenth is like a garland.

original: kun dga'i sgra dang 'dra ba ste //
analyzed: kun dga'i sgra dang 'dra ba ste //
translated: The nineteenth is like the sound of joy.

original: klung chen rgyun dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: klung chen rgyun dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The twentieth is like the current of a great river.

original: rgyal sras rnams kyis sems bskyed pa //
analyzed: rgyal sras rnams kyis sems bskyed pa //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ generation of bodhichitta🔽

original: sprin @141a * //
analyzed: sprin @141a * //
translated: The generation of the Thought of the Sons of the Victorious One

original: dang 'dra bar bstan pa ste //
analyzed: dang 'dra bar bstan pa ste //
translated: is taught to be like a cloud.🔽Therefore, one should generate the Thought

original: de phyir de ltar yon tan phyug / sems ni dga' bas yang dag bskyed //
analyzed: de phyir de ltar yon tan phyug / sems ni dga' bas yang dag bskyed //
translated: with a mind rich in virtues and full of joy.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa dang po ni sa dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa dang po ni sa dang mtshungs te /
translated: The first generation of the Thought of the Bodhisattvas is like the earth,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang de'i tshogs 'phel ba'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang de'i tshogs 'phel ba'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis for the increase of all the qualities of a Buddha and of their collection.

original: bsam pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa ni gser bzang po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bsam pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa ni gser bzang po dang 'dra ste /
translated: The generation of the Thought endowed with the intention is like good gold,

original: phan ba dang bde ba'i bsam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba mi sten ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan ba dang bde ba'i bsam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba mi sten ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not take on the color of other things, the intention to benefit and to gladden.

original: sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni zla ba yar gyi ngo'i tshes pa bzhin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni zla ba yar gyi ngo'i tshes pa bzhin te /
translated: The generation of the Thought endowed with application is like the waxing moon,

original: dge ba'i chos 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
