translated: because the virtuous qualities increase.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa ni me dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa ni me dang 'dra ste /
translated: The generation of the Thought endowed with the superior intention is like fire,🔽because it burns up the two obscurations.

original: shing gi bye brag ngag gis me bzhin du gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing gi bye brag ngag gis me bzhin du gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because, like a fire fed by clarified butter, he goes from one excellence to the next.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa ni khyad par rtogs pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa ni khyad par rtogs pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: Superior intention is the intention to realize the distinctive qualities.

original: sbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni gter chen po bzhin te /
analyzed: sbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni gter chen po bzhin te /
translated: The perfection of generosity is like a great treasure,

original: zang zing gi longs spyod kyis sems can dpag tu med pa tshim par byed pa dang mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zang zing gi longs spyod kyis sems can dpag tu med pa tshim par byed pa dang mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it satisfies countless beings with material enjoyments and is inexhaustible.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni rin po che'i 'byung gnas lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni rin po che'i 'byung gnas lta bu ste /
translated: The perfection of morality is like a mine of jewels,

original: de las yon tan rin po che thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las yon tan rin po che thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the jewels of good qualities come from it.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni rgya mtsho dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni rgya mtsho dang 'dra ste /
translated: The perfection of patience is like the ocean,

original: nyam nga ba 'byung ba thams cad kyis mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyam nga ba 'byung ba thams cad kyis mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not disturbed by any calamity.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan ba ni rdo rje lta bu ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan ba ni rdo rje lta bu ste /
translated: The perfection of effort is like a vajra,🔽because it penetrates all things.

original: mi shigs pa nyid kyis sra ba'i phyir ro //🔽bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni ri'i rgyal po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: mi shigs pa nyid kyis sra ba'i phyir ro // bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni ri'i rgyal po dang 'dra ste /
translated: It is like a diamond because it is hard, being indestructible.

original: rnam par g-yeng bas mi g-yo ba'i phyir ro //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni sman gyi rgyal po lta bu ste /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng bas mi g-yo ba'i phyir ro // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni sman gyi rgyal po lta bu ste /
translated: The perfection of meditation is like the king of mountains because it is unshaken by distraction.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽tshad med pa dang ldan pa ni mdza' bo chen po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro // tshad med pa dang ldan pa ni mdza' bo chen po dang 'dra ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is like the king of medicines because it cures the diseases of the addictions and of the knowable.

original: gnas skabs thams cad du sems can thams cad yal bar mi 'dor ba'i phyir ro //🔽mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du sems can thams cad yal bar mi 'dor ba'i phyir ro // mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ste /
translated: The immeasurables are like a great friend because they never abandon any living being in any situation.

original: ji ltar mos pa bzhin de'i 'bras bu 'byor pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mos pa bzhin de'i 'bras bu 'byor pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The superknowledges are like a wish-fulfilling gem because they provide the enjoyment of their fruits according to one’s wishes.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po dang ldan pa bzhi ni nyi ma dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po dang ldan pa bzhi ni nyi ma dang 'dra ste /
translated: The four persuasions are like the sun because they mature the harvest of beings’ virtues.

original: gdul ba'i lo tog yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul ba'i lo tog yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it ripens the harvest of those to be trained.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa dang ldan pa ni dri za'i @141b dbyangs snyan pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa dang ldan pa ni dri za'i @141b dbyangs snyan pa lta bu ste /
translated: Endowed with the analytical knowledges, he is like a gandharva with a melodious voice,

original: gdul bya 'dul bar byed ba'i chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul bya 'dul bar byed ba'i chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he teaches the Dharma in order to train those to be trained.

original: rton pa dang ldan pa ni rgyal po lta bu ste /
analyzed: rton pa dang ldan pa ni rgyal po lta bu ste /
translated: Endowed with reliance, he is like a king,

original: chud mi za ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chud mi za ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is the cause of non-loss.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa ni mdzod lta bu ste /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa ni mdzod lta bu ste /
translated: Endowed with the collections of merit and knowledge, he is like a treasury,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mang po'i mdzod kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mang po'i mdzod kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is the repository of the many collections of merit and knowledge.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa dang ldan pa ni lam po che lta bu ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa dang ldan pa ni lam po che lta bu ste /
translated: Endowed with the factors of enlightenment, he is like a highway,

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all noble persons have gone and will go there.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa ni /
translated: Endowed with calm abiding and insight,

original: theg pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: theg pa lta bu ste /
translated: he is like a vehicle,

original: bde blag tu khyer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde blag tu khyer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it easily carries one to the state of nirvana.

original: gzungs dang spobs pa dang ldan pa ni bkod ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: gzungs dang spobs pa dang ldan pa ni bkod ma lta bu ste /
translated: Endowed with retention and eloquence is like a fountain,

original: chu 'dzin zhing mi zad par 'byin pa dang chos mthun par thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos kyi tshig dang don 'dzin zhing mi zad pa 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu 'dzin zhing mi zad par 'byin pa dang chos mthun par thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos kyi tshig dang don 'dzin zhing mi zad pa 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it retains the words and meanings of the Dharma, both those heard and those not heard, and because it produces them inexhaustibly, in common with the way a fountain retains and produces water inexhaustibly.

original: chos bshad pa dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: chos bshad pa dang ldan pa ni /
translated: Endowed with the explanation of the Dharma

original: kun dga' ba'i sgra dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: kun dga' ba'i sgra dang 'dra ste /
translated: is like a delightful sound,

original: thar pa 'dod pa'i gdul bya rnams la snyan pa thos par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa'i gdul bya rnams la snyan pa thos par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes those disciples who desire liberation to hear what is delightful.

original: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang ldan pa ni rlung gi rgyun dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang ldan pa ni rlung gi rgyun dang 'dra ste /
translated: Endowed with the path of single progress is like a wind current,

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa na rang gi dang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa na rang gi dang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the natural outflow of the acceptance of the nonarising of the dharmas.

original: bgrod pa gcig pa nyid ni /
analyzed: bgrod pa gcig pa nyid ni /
translated: Single progress

original: sa der gtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bya ba byed pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa der gtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bya ba byed pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is because the bodhisattvas who belong to that stage do not differ in their performance of their duties.

original: thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa ni sprin lta bu ste /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa ni sprin lta bu ste /
translated: Endowed with skill in liberative art is like a cloud,🔽because it causes the harvest of sentient beings to mature.

original: ji ltar snod kyi 'jig rten gyi 'byor pa thams cad sprin las 'byung ba ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar snod kyi 'jig rten gyi 'byor pa thams cad sprin las 'byung ba ltar /
translated: Just as all the riches of the world come from clouds,

original: dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa la sogs pa ston pa'i sgo nas sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba rnams de la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa la sogs pa ston pa'i sgo nas sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba rnams de la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: so all the work of benefiting beings depends on the bodhisattvas, through their teaching, such as by demonstrating their dwelling in the Tusita heaven.

original: dpe nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa de ni /🔽'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: dpe nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa de ni / 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: This generation of the Thought, endowed with twenty-two similes,

original: mi zad pa nyid 'byung ba dang sbyar bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: mi zad pa nyid 'byung ba dang sbyar bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: is to be understood as applied to the arising of inexhaustibility,🔽in the noble Aksayamatinirdesa-sutra.

original: sems ma bskyed pa smad par tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: sems ma bskyed pa smad par tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the condemnation of those who have not generated the Thought🔽Those who have not generated the thought of highest value,🔽the thought of the benefit of others, the thought of the means,

original: cher 'os sems bskyed spangs pa'i skye bo dag / gzhan don sems dang de yi thabs rnyed dang // dgongs chen don dang de nyid mchog mthong bas //
analyzed: cher 'os sems bskyed spangs pa'i skye bo dag / gzhan don sems dang de yi thabs rnyed dang // dgongs chen don dang de nyid mchog mthong bas //
translated: the thought of the great purpose, the thought of the supreme truth,

original: bde ba de spangs zhi bar 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: bde ba de spangs zhi bar 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: forsake that happiness and go to peace.

original: sems bskyed pa de spangs pa'i sems can rnams kyis bde ba rnam pa bzhi mi 'thob ste //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de spangs pa'i sems can rnams kyis bde ba rnam pa bzhi mi 'thob ste //
translated: Those who have not generated the Thought do not obtain four kinds of happiness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzhan gyi don sems pas bde ba gang yin pa dang / @142a * //🔽gzhan gyi don gyi thabs rnyed pas bde ba gang yin pa dang / dgongs pa chen po'i don mthong pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzhan gyi don sems pas bde ba gang yin pa dang / @142a * // gzhan gyi don gyi thabs rnyed pas bde ba gang yin pa dang / dgongs pa chen po'i don mthong pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas have four kinds of happiness: the happiness of reflecting on the aims of others;🔽the happiness of finding the means to fulfill those aims;

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo zab mo dgongs pa can gyi don rtogs pas bde ba gang yin pa dang / de kho na nyid mchog gi don chos la bdag med pa mthong bas bde ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo zab mo dgongs pa can gyi don rtogs pas bde ba gang yin pa dang / de kho na nyid mchog gi don chos la bdag med pa mthong bas bde ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: the happiness of realizing the profound scriptures of the Great Vehicle, which have an underlying thought, and the happiness of seeing the truth of the supreme reality, the selflessness of phenomena.

original: ngan 'gro dang yongs su skyo bas 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngan 'gro dang yongs su skyo bas 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are fearless about the miserable realms and about being discouraged.🔽One verse praising the generation of the thought

original: sems bskyed pa bsngags par tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa bsngags par tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse of praise to the generation of the Thought.

original: blo ldan sems mchog skyes ma thag tu yang //
analyzed: blo ldan sems mchog skyes ma thag tu yang //
translated: Immediately upon the brave one’s generation of the supreme thought,

original: mtha' yas nyes pa byed las sems rab bsdoms //
analyzed: mtha' yas nyes pa byed las sems rab bsdoms //
translated: his mind is bound to the performance of infinite good.🔽Always virtuous, delighting in the happiness and suffering of the two,

original: gnyis 'phel byed pas rtag tu dge ba dang // brtse ldan bde dang sdug bsngal dag gis dga' //
analyzed: gnyis 'phel byed pas rtag tu dge ba dang // brtse ldan bde dang sdug bsngal dag gis dga' //
translated: the compassionate one is happy.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sems kyi mchog de skyes ma thag tu sems can mtha' yas pa'i rten can gyi nyes pa byed pa las sems rab tu bsdams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sems kyi mchog de skyes ma thag tu sems can mtha' yas pa'i rten can gyi nyes pa byed pa las sems rab tu bsdams par 'gyur te /
translated: As soon as the Bodhisattva has generated that supreme thought, his mind is completely restrained from wrongdoing based on the infinite sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir 'di ngan 'gros 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ngan 'gros 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, he has no fear of miserable realms.

original: de ni dge ba'i las dang snying brtse ba gnyis 'phel bar byed pas rtag tu dge ba dang ldan ba dang / snying brtse ba dang ldan par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni dge ba'i las dang snying brtse ba gnyis 'phel bar byed pas rtag tu dge ba dang ldan ba dang / snying brtse ba dang ldan par yang 'gyur te /
translated: He always has virtue and compassion, because he increases both virtue and compassion.

original: des na de dge ba dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na de dge ba dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because he has virtue,

original: bde bas kyang dga' la snying brtse ba dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don byed pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi sdug bsngal gyis kyang dga'o //
analyzed: bde bas kyang dga' la snying brtse ba dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don byed pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi sdug bsngal gyis kyang dga'o //
translated: he is happy. And because he has compassion, he is happy with the suffering that is the reason for helping others.

original: de'i phyir 'di bya ba mang pos yongs su skyo bas kyang 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di bya ba mang pos yongs su skyo bas kyang 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, he has no fear of being exhausted by his many activities.

original: mi byed pa'i sdom ba thob par tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: mi byed pa'i sdom ba thob par tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the attainment of the vow of non-performance:

original: gang tshe gzhan gyi don phyir lus dang ni //
analyzed: gang tshe gzhan gyi don phyir lus dang ni //
translated: When, for the sake of others, he is not distressed by the suffering of samsara,

original: srog la mi lta rab ngal khas len pa //🔽de lta bu de gzhan gyi gnod pa yis //
analyzed: srog la mi lta rab ngal khas len pa // de lta bu de gzhan gyi gnod pa yis //
translated: He does not care for his life, and is ready for great hardship.🔽How could such a one engage in evil actions🔽For the sake of himself, when others are harmed?

original: ji ltar ngan par byed pa'i las la 'jug / de'i bsdus pa'i don ni /
analyzed: ji ltar ngan par byed pa'i las la 'jug / de'i bsdus pa'i don ni /
translated: The condensed meaning of this chapter is this:

original: gang zhig gzhan gyi don gyi phyir lus dang srog la yang mi lta ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan gyi don gyi phyir lus dang srog la yang mi lta ba'i phyir /
translated: How could one who, for the sake of others, does not care even for his own life and body,

original: gzhan nyid ches sdug gi bdag nyid ni ma yin pa de ji ltar gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pas bdag gi don du nyes par byed pa'i las la 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan nyid ches sdug gi bdag nyid ni ma yin pa de ji ltar gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pas bdag gi don du nyes par byed pa'i las la 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: who loves others more than himself, engage in evil actions for the sake of himself, when others are harmed?

original: sems mi ldog par tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te //
analyzed: sems mi ldog par tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te //
translated: Two verses on the irreversibility of the bodhisattva

original: de yis chos kun sgyu ma lta bu dang // skye ba skyed mos tshal 'gro ltar rtogs nas //
analyzed: de yis chos kun sgyu ma lta bu dang // skye ba skyed mos tshal 'gro ltar rtogs nas //
translated: . He understands all things to be like a magical illusion, and birth to be like a walk in the garden.

original: 'byor pa'i dus na rgud pa'i dus na'ang 'di //
analyzed: 'byor pa'i dus na rgud pa'i dus na'ang 'di //
translated: In times of prosperity and in times of adversity,

original: nyon mongs sdug bsngal dag gis 'jigs pa med //
analyzed: nyon mongs sdug bsngal dag gis 'jigs pa med //
translated: he is not afraid of the afflictions or of suffering.

original: rang gi yon tan sems can phan 'dogs dga'/
analyzed: rang gi yon tan sems can phan 'dogs dga'/
translated: He delights in his own virtues and in benefiting others.

original: bsams bzhin skye ba rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul //
analyzed: bsams bzhin skye ba rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul //
translated: He is born as he wishes, and he manifests his magical powers.

original: @142b rgyan dang ston mo sa mchog rtse dga' ba //
analyzed: @142b rgyan dang ston mo sa mchog rtse dga' ba //
translated: The ornaments, the feast, the garden, the pleasure,

original: snying rje'i bdag nyid min pa rnams la med //
analyzed: snying rje'i bdag nyid min pa rnams la med //
translated: do not exist for those who are not compassionate.

original: byang chub sems dpa' des chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the bodhisattva sees all phenomena as being like illusions,

original: 'byar pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa rnams kyis mi 'jigs la /
analyzed: 'byar pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa rnams kyis mi 'jigs la /
translated: he is not afraid of the afflictions when he is in union with them.

original: skye ba skyed mos tshal du 'gro ba lta bur mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba skyed mos tshal du 'gro ba lta bur mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because he sees birth as being like a trip to a pleasure garden,

original: rgud pa'i dus na sdug bsngal gyis mi 'jigs na /
analyzed: rgud pa'i dus na sdug bsngal gyis mi 'jigs na /
translated: he is not afraid of suffering when he is in a time of troubles.

original: de'i byang chub kyi sems 'jigs pa gang gis ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i byang chub kyi sems 'jigs pa gang gis ldog par 'gyur /
translated: So what fear could turn the bodhisattva away from his intention to achieve enlightenment?

original: gzhan yang rang gi yon tan gyis rgyan dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs pas dga' ba'i ston mo dang / bsams bzhin du skye ba'i skyed mos tshal gyis dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis rnam par 'phrul pa'i rtsed mos dga' ba'i byang chub sems dpa' dag kho na la yod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang gi yon tan gyis rgyan dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs pas dga' ba'i ston mo dang / bsams bzhin du skye ba'i skyed mos tshal gyis dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis rnam par 'phrul pa'i rtsed mos dga' ba'i byang chub sems dpa' dag kho na la yod kyi /
translated: The ornaments of his own good qualities, the feast of delight in helping others, the pleasure garden of intentional birth, and the play of magical emanations exist only for the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ma yin pa rnams la ni med na de dag gis sems ji ltar zlog par 'gyur /🔽sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs bdag ga par tshigs su bcad pa /🔽gzhan don brtson ldan snying rje'i bdag nyid 'di //🔽gang tshe mnar med pa la'ang dga' 'dzin pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ma yin pa rnams la ni med na de dag gis sems ji ltar zlog par 'gyur / sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs bdag ga par tshigs su bcad pa / gzhan don brtson ldan snying rje'i bdag nyid 'di // gang tshe mnar med pa la'ang dga' 'dzin pa /
translated: But they do not exist for those who are not bodhisattvas. How then can they turn their minds away from enlightenment?🔽🔽A verse on the fear of suffering🔽This one, whose nature is compassion, who strives for the sake of others,🔽even when in the Avici hell, takes joy.🔽

original: de 'dra ba dag srid na gzhan rten can //🔽sdug bsngal 'byung ba rnams kyis ga la 'jigs //🔽gzhan yang gzhan gyi don la brtson pa gang zhig snying rje'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir /🔽mnar med pa la yang dga' bar 'dzin pa de ji ltar srid pa na gzhan gyi don gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi sdug bsngal 'byung ba dag gis 'jigs par 'gyur te /🔽gang gi phyir na 'di sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa'am sems ldog par 'gyur /🔽sems can yal bar 'dor bdag ga par tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: de 'dra ba dag srid na gzhan rten can //🔽sdug bsngal 'byung ba rnams kyis ga la 'jigs //🔽gzhan yang gzhan gyi don la brtson pa gang zhig snying rje'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir /🔽mnar med pa la yang dga' bar 'dzin pa de ji ltar srid pa na gzhan gyi don gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi sdug bsngal 'byung ba dag gis 'jigs par 'gyur te /🔽gang gi phyir na 'di sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa'am sems ldog par 'gyur /🔽sems can yal bar 'dor bdag ga par tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: But they do not exist for those who are not bodhisattvas. How then could they turn their minds away from enlightenment?

original: slob dpon brtse chen rtag tu bsten pa'i bdag / pha rol sdug bsngal dag gis sems gdung ba //
analyzed: slob dpon brtse chen rtag tu bsten pa'i bdag / pha rol sdug bsngal dag gis sems gdung ba //
translated: The master, whose nature is always compassionate, is pained by the suffering of others.

original: gzhan gyi bya ba nye bar gnas pa la //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bya ba nye bar gnas pa la //
translated: When the work for others is at hand,

original: gzhan gyis pa skul ba shin tu ngo yang tsha //
analyzed: gzhan gyis pa skul ba shin tu ngo yang tsha //
translated: he is greatly ashamed if he is urged by others.

original: slob dpon snying rje rtag tu bsten pa'i bdag nyid can pha rol gyi sdug bsngal dag gis sems gdung ba gang yin pa de la gal te gzhan gyi don bya ba byung ba la dge ba'i bshes gnyen gzhan dag gis bskul bar bya dgos pa ni te bor
analyzed: slob dpon snying rje rtag tu bsten pa'i bdag nyid can pha rol gyi sdug bsngal dag gis sems gdung ba gang yin pa de la gal te gzhan gyi don bya ba byung ba la dge ba'i bshes gnyen gzhan dag gis bskul bar bya dgos pa ni te bor
translated: The master, whose nature is always compassionate, is pained by the suffering of others. When the work for others is at hand, he is greatly ashamed if he is urged by other spiritual friends.

original: ngo tsha ba'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha ba'o //
translated: This is shame.

original: le lo smad par tshigs su gcad pa /
analyzed: le lo smad par tshigs su gcad pa /
translated: A verse of condemnation of laziness:

original: mgo la sems can khur chen khyer ba yi //
analyzed: mgo la sems can khur chen khyer ba yi //
translated: The best of beings, who carries the great burden of beings on his head,

original: sems can mchog ni dal gyis 'gro mi mdzes //
analyzed: sems can mchog ni dal gyis 'gro mi mdzes //
translated: does not move slowly, for that would be unbecoming.

original: bdag gzhan sna tshogs 'ching bas rab bcings pa //
analyzed: bdag gzhan sna tshogs 'ching bas rab bcings pa //
translated: Since he is bound by the various bonds of self and others,

original: @143a * // brtson pa brgya 'gyur du ni bya ba'i rigs //
analyzed: @143a * // brtson pa brgya 'gyur du ni bya ba'i rigs //
translated: he should be a hundred times more diligent.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mgo la sems can gyi khur chen po thogs nas pha rol gnon pa dal ba ni mi mdzes kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mgo la sems can gyi khur chen po thogs nas pha rol gnon pa dal ba ni mi mdzes kyi /
translated: The Bodhisattva, having taken up the great burden of beings on his head, should not be slow in shouldering it.

original: des nyan thos kyi brtson 'grus pas brtson 'grus brgya 'gyur du bya bar rigs te /
analyzed: des nyan thos kyi brtson 'grus pas brtson 'grus brgya 'gyur du bya bar rigs te /
translated: It is proper that he should be a hundred times more energetic than the disciples.

original: 'di ltar de ni bdag dang gzhan gyi 'ching ba rnam pa sna tshogs nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i ngo bo dag gis shin tu bcings pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni bdag dang gzhan gyi 'ching ba rnam pa sna tshogs nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i ngo bo dag gis shin tu bcings pa yin no //
translated: For he is bound by many kinds of bonds, the addictions of himself and others, and by the bonds of action and birth.

original: sems bskyed pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on the generation of the Thought is completed.

original: // / sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa /🔽gnas rtsom 'bras bu 'byung ba che bdag nyid //
analyzed: // / sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa / gnas rtsom 'bras bu 'byung ba che bdag nyid //
translated: A verse on the characteristics of practice:

original: rgyal sras rnams kyi sgrub pa yin par 'dod //🔽rtag tu len pa che dang bzod pa che //
analyzed: rgyal sras rnams kyi sgrub pa yin par 'dod // rtag tu len pa che dang bzod pa che //
translated: 1. The practice of the victors’ sons is considered great in basis, undertaking, and result.

original: don chen yang dag sgrub ba'i bya ba byed //
analyzed: don chen yang dag sgrub ba'i bya ba byed //
translated: 2. They always have great commitment and great patience, and they perform the action of accomplishing the great meaning.

original: de la gnas chen po ni sems pa skyed pa la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnas chen po ni sems pa skyed pa la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, the great basis is the generation of the Thought.

original: rtsom pa chen po ni rang dang gzhan gyi don rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsom pa chen po ni rang dang gzhan gyi don rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great undertaking, because it is undertaken for the sake of self and others.

original: 'bras bu 'byung ba chen po ni 'bras bu byang chub chen po 'thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byung ba chen po ni 'bras bu byang chub chen po 'thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great result, because it results in the attainment of great enlightenment.

original: de nyid kyi phyir go rims bzhin du len pa che ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir go rims bzhin du len pa che ba ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is respectively, great acceptance,

original: sems can thams cad nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it accepts all sentient beings.

original: bzod pa che ba ste /
analyzed: bzod pa che ba ste /
translated: Great patience,

original: sdug bsngal thams cad dang du len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad dang du len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it endures all suffering.

original: don chen yang dag sgrub pa'i bya ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: don chen yang dag sgrub pa'i bya ba byed pa ste /
translated: Great performance of the function of accomplishing the great meaning,

original: sems can mang po'i don yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can mang po'i don yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it accomplishes the great meaning of many sentient beings.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don khyad par med par tshigs su bcad pa /🔽gzhan dang bdag tu mnyam pa'i sems nyid dam //🔽bdag pas gzhan ches sdug pa rnyed nas ni //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don khyad par med par tshigs su bcad pa / gzhan dang bdag tu mnyam pa'i sems nyid dam // bdag pas gzhan ches sdug pa rnyed nas ni //
translated: A verse on the equality of self and other🔽. Having attained the very same attitude toward all beings,🔽cherishing others as oneself,

original: de ltar bdag pas gzhan don mchog tu shes //
analyzed: de ltar bdag pas gzhan don mchog tu shes //
translated: one understands that the aim of others is more important than ones own.

original: rang gi don gang gzhan gyi don gang yin //
analyzed: rang gi don gang gzhan gyi don gang yin //
translated: What is ones own aim? What is the aim of others?

original: gzhan dang bdag mnyam pa'i sems nyid brda las byung ba'i sems bskyed pa rnyed pa'i cho mos pa'i sgo nas sam /🔽don dam pa'i sems bskyed pa rnyed pa'i tshe /🔽shes pa'i sgo nas rnyed nas sam /
analyzed: gzhan dang bdag mnyam pa'i sems nyid brda las byung ba'i sems bskyed pa rnyed pa'i cho mos pa'i sgo nas sam / don dam pa'i sems bskyed pa rnyed pa'i tshe / shes pa'i sgo nas rnyed nas sam /
translated: The attitude of sameness with regard to oneself and others is the bodhicitta that arises from signs.🔽This is acquired through interest,🔽when one acquires the ultimate bodhicitta,🔽it is acquired through knowledge.🔽

original: yang na bdag pas gzhan ches shin tu sdug bsngal ba rnyed nas rgyu de nyid kyis bdag pas gzhan gyi don la khyad par 'phags par 'du shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i la rang gi don ni gang zhig yin la gzhan gyi don gang zhig yin te /
analyzed: yang na bdag pas gzhan ches shin tu sdug bsngal ba rnyed nas rgyu de nyid kyis bdag pas gzhan gyi don la khyad par 'phags par 'du shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i la rang gi don ni gang zhig yin la gzhan gyi don gang zhig yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained the mind born of the sign, through the door of devotion, or who has attained the ultimate mind, through the door of knowledge, or who has attained the mind that is superior to his own in the thought that others are much more to be pitied than himself, for that very reason, what is his own aim and what is another's aim?

original: de la gnyis ka khyad par med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la gnyis ka khyad par med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that there is no difference between the two.

original: gzhan gyi don khyad par du bya bar tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don khyad par du bya bar tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the preeminence of the aim of others:

original: ji ltar snying @143b rje'i bdag nyid gzhan gyi don gyi phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar snying @143b rje'i bdag nyid gzhan gyi don gyi phyir //
translated: The compassionate one, for the sake of others,

original: bdag la sdug bsngal mi bzad gdung par rab byed pa //
analyzed: bdag la sdug bsngal mi bzad gdung par rab byed pa //
translated: brings upon himself unbearable suffering.

original: de ltar 'jig rten gdung ba'i las kyis gzhan dgra la //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten gdung ba'i las kyis gzhan dgra la //
translated: How can the worldly, who are occupied with their own aims,

original: shin tu brtse ba med par rab tu 'jug ma yin //
analyzed: shin tu brtse ba med par rab tu 'jug ma yin //
translated: He does not engage in it with excessive lack of concern.

original: ji ltar 'di'i gzhan gyi don bdag nyid kyi don las khyad par du 'phags pa de sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di'i gzhan gyi don bdag nyid kyi don las khyad par du 'phags pa de sgrub par byed de /
translated: He accomplishes the aims of others in a way that is superior to the way he accomplishes his own aim.

original: gzhan gyi don du bdag nyid la shin tu gdung bar byed ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du bdag nyid la shin tu gdung bar byed ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is devoted to the aims of others.

original: gzhan gyi don sgrub par rnam par dbye bar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don sgrub par rnam par dbye bar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on the accomplishment of the aims of others.

original: tha dad 'bring dang mchog chos nyid gnas la //
analyzed: tha dad 'bring dang mchog chos nyid gnas la //
translated: The best, middling, and least persons abide in reality;🔽they are taught, pleased, and engaged;

original: legs par ston dang mgu byed 'jug pa dang // don la rnam nges dge la yongs smin byed //
analyzed: legs par ston dang mgu byed 'jug pa dang // don la rnam nges dge la yongs smin byed //
translated: they are ascertained in the meaning, matured in virtue,

original: de bzhin gdams ngag gnas dang blo rnams grol //
analyzed: de bzhin gdams ngag gnas dang blo rnams grol //
translated: and similarly instructed, settled, and liberated in mind.

original: yon tan khyad par can 'grub de bzhin du //
analyzed: yon tan khyad par can 'grub de bzhin du //
translated: They accomplish the special qualities, and similarly🔽they are born in the family, receive the prophecy, and are consecrated;

original: rigs su skye dang lung bstan dbang bskur dang // de bzhin gshegs mkhyen bla med go 'phang ste //
analyzed: rigs su skye dang lung bstan dbang bskur dang // de bzhin gshegs mkhyen bla med go 'phang ste //
translated: they attain the omniscience of a Tathagata, the unsurpassed stage.

original: bcu gsum bdag nyid 'di ni gzhan gyi don //
analyzed: bcu gsum bdag nyid 'di ni gzhan gyi don //
translated: These thirteen are the aims of others.

original: sems can gyi ris rnam pa gsum po rigs dman pa dang 'bring dang khyad par can la gnas pa la byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan gyi don rnam pa bcu gsum ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi ris rnam pa gsum po rigs dman pa dang 'bring dang khyad par can la gnas pa la byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan gyi don rnam pa bcu gsum ste /
translated: The thirteen kinds of benefit that bodhisattvas bring to beings are as follows.🔽They teach them well with the powers of preternatural knowledge and the power of preternatural hearing.🔽They bring them to the realization of the result.🔽They bring about the complete accomplishment of the result.🔽They bring about the purification of obscurations.

original: rjes su bstan pa dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dag gis legs par ston pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis mgu bar byed pa dang / bstan pa khas len du gzhug pa'i phyir 'jug pa dang / zhugs pa rnams kyi the tshom gtsod pa'i phyir don la rnam par nges par byed dang /
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dag gis legs par ston pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis mgu bar byed pa dang / bstan pa khas len du gzhug pa'i phyir 'jug pa dang / zhugs pa rnams kyi the tshom gtsod pa'i phyir don la rnam par nges par byed dang /
translated: They bring about the purification of the two veils.🔽They bring about the purification of the three spheres.🔽They bring about the purification of the six transcendent perfections.🔽They bring about the purification of the levels.

original: dge ba'i rtsab yongs su smin par byed pa dang / 'doms pa dang / sems gnas par byed pa dang / shes rab rnam par grol bar byed pa dang / mngon bar shes pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can rnams yang dag par 'grub par byed pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsab yongs su smin par byed pa dang / 'doms pa dang / sems gnas par byed pa dang / shes rab rnam par grol bar byed pa dang / mngon bar shes pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can rnams yang dag par 'grub par byed pa dang /
translated: They bring about the purification of the powers, the fearlessnesses and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye ba dang / sa brgyad pa la lung bstan pa dang / sa bcu pa la dbang bskur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye ba dang / sa brgyad pa la lung bstan pa dang / sa bcu pa la dbang bskur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
translated: born in the family of the Tathagata, receiving the prediction on the eighth stage, receiving consecration on the tenth stage, and possessing the intuition of the Tathagata.

original: rnam pa bcu gsum po 'di dag ni ci rigs par rigs la gnas pa gsum byang chub sems dpa'i don yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gsum po 'di dag ni ci rigs par rigs la gnas pa gsum byang chub sems dpa'i don yin no //
translated: These thirteen aspects are the meaning of the bodhisattva stages, as appropriate, in the three states of abiding in the family.

original: gzhan gyi don sgrub pa phun sum tshogs par tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don sgrub pa phun sum tshogs par tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the excellence of the bodhisattvas' accomplishment of the aims of others:

original: skye bo dang mthun phyin ci ma log 'chad //
analyzed: skye bo dang mthun phyin ci ma log 'chad //
translated: They teach in accord with beings, unerringly,

original: mi 'gying ba dang bdag gi med la mkhas //
analyzed: mi 'gying ba dang bdag gi med la mkhas //
translated: without conceit, without self-interest, and with skill.

original: bzod dul shin tu ring song mi bzad pa //🔽rgyal sras @144a * //
analyzed: bzod dul shin tu ring song mi bzad pa // rgyal sras @144a * //
translated: Patient, disciplined, far-reaching, and inexhaustible,

original: rnams kyi sgrub pa mchog yin no //
analyzed: rnams kyi sgrub pa mchog yin no //
translated: the accomplishment of the victors' spiritual heir is supreme.

original: 'dis ni gzhan gyi don sgrub pa 'di phun sum tshogs pa yin pa de ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan gyi don sgrub pa 'di phun sum tshogs pa yin pa de ston to //
translated: This shows the excellence of the bodhisattvas' accomplishment of the aims of others.

original: 'di ji ltar phun sum tshogs pa yin zhen /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar phun sum tshogs pa yin zhen /
translated: How is it excellent?

original: gal te rigs la gnas pa'i skye bo dang mthun zhing /
analyzed: gal te rigs la gnas pa'i skye bo dang mthun zhing /
translated: It is excellent in terms of six categories:

original: phyin ci ma log par 'chad par 'gyur ba dang / 'gying ba med par mgu bar 'gyur ba dang / mi mthun pa mi byed pas bdag gi ba med par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par 'chad par 'gyur ba dang / 'gying ba med par mgu bar 'gyur ba dang / mi mthun pa mi byed pas bdag gi ba med par 'jug pa ste /
translated: 10. He teaches without error, and he delights without pride, and he engages without possessiveness, not being opposed.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis mi rlom zhing sems can zhugs pa rnams la bdag gi bar 'dzin pa med pa dang / don rnam par nge bya ba la mkhas pa'i sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis mi rlom zhing sems can zhugs pa rnams la bdag gi bar 'dzin pa med pa dang / don rnam par nge bya ba la mkhas pa'i sgrub pa yin te /
translated: 11. He is not puffed up with his psychic powers, and he has no possessiveness toward beings who are his converts.

original: dge ba yongs su smin par bya ba la bzod pa'i sgrub pa yin /
analyzed: dge ba yongs su smin par bya ba la bzod pa'i sgrub pa yin /
translated: 12. He is patient in the ripening of his virtues.

original: dul bas 'doms pa la sogs pa'i sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: dul bas 'doms pa la sogs pa'i sgrub pa yin te /
translated: 13. He is gentle in his advice, etc.

original: ma dul bas ni gzhan dag la gdams pa la sogs bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: ma dul bas ni gzhan dag la gdams pa la sogs bstan par mi nus so //
translated: For one who is not gentle cannot teach others.

original: rigs su skyes pa la sogs pa shin tu ring du song ba'i sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs su skyes pa la sogs pa shin tu ring du song ba'i sgrub pa yin no //
translated: 14. He is well-born, etc., and he has gone far.

original: ring du ma song ba'i sgrub pas ni /
analyzed: ring du ma song ba'i sgrub pas ni /
translated: 15. He is not a beginner.

original: gzhan dag rigs su skyes pa la sogs par bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gzhan dag rigs su skyes pa la sogs par bya bar mi nus so //
translated: For one who is a beginner cannot make others well-born, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sgrub pa 'di dag thams cad kyang khas blangs pa'i sems can mi zad pa'i phyir mi zad pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sgrub pa 'di dag thams cad kyang khas blangs pa'i sems can mi zad pa'i phyir mi zad pa yin te /
translated: And all these practices of the bodhisattva are inexhaustible because the beings for whose sake he makes his vow are inexhaustible.

original: de'i phyir yang phun sum tshogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang phun sum tshogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are also perfect.

original: sgrub pa khyad par du bya bar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sgrub pa khyad par du bya bar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on the superiority of the practice

original: 'dod ldan skye bo 'jigs pa che la 'jug //
analyzed: 'dod ldan skye bo 'jigs pa che la 'jug //
translated: The man of desire enters the great terror,

original: srid dga' phyin ci log bde g-yo ba la //
analyzed: srid dga' phyin ci log bde g-yo ba la //
translated: The lover of existence, the unstable bliss of error,

original: zhi dga' rang gi len par rab zhi la //
analyzed: zhi dga' rang gi len par rab zhi la //
translated: The lover of peace, the pacification of his own suffering,🔽The compassionate one, the pacification of all suffering, always.

original: snying rje'i bdag nyid len kun zhi la rtag / skye bo rmongs pa rang gi bde don brtson //
analyzed: snying rje'i bdag nyid len kun zhi la rtag / skye bo rmongs pa rang gi bde don brtson //
translated: The deluded man strives for his own happiness,

original: rtag tu de ma thob par sdug bsngal 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu de ma thob par sdug bsngal 'gyur //
translated: And always, not attaining it, he suffers.

original: brtan pa rtag tu gzhan don brtson pa ni //
analyzed: brtan pa rtag tu gzhan don brtson pa ni //
translated: The steadfast one always strives for the benefit of others,

original: gnyi ga'i don byas mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i don byas mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur //
translated: And having accomplished the aims of both, he attains nirvana.

original: de la 'dod pa rnams 'jigs pa chen po nyid yin pa ni lus dang sems kyi sdug bsngal mang po dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa rnams 'jigs pa chen po nyid yin pa ni lus dang sems kyi sdug bsngal mang po dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The desire realm is a great danger because it is the cause of many sufferings of body and mind and of rebirth in the unfortunate realms.

original: phyin ci log gi bde ba g-yo ba ni gzugs dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa'i dga' ba rnams mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis don dam par sdug bsngal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi bde ba g-yo ba ni gzugs dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa'i dga' ba rnams mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis don dam par sdug bsngal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The happiness of the inverted is unstable because the delights of the realms of desire, form, and formlessness are impermanent and ultimately painful because of the suffering of conditioned states.

original: len pa dag ni nyon mongs pa rnams su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: len pa dag ni nyon mongs pa rnams su rig par bya ste /
translated: The appropriators should be understood as the afflictions.

original: sdug bsngal len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they appropriate suffering.

original: skye bo rmongs pa rtag tu rang bde ba'i don du zhugs pa ni bde ba mi @144b 'thob kyi /
analyzed: skye bo rmongs pa rtag tu rang bde ba'i don du zhugs pa ni bde ba mi @144b 'thob kyi /
translated: The deluded person who always strives for his own happiness does not obtain happiness,

original: sdug bsngal kho na 'thob bo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kho na 'thob bo //
translated: but only suffering.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi don du zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi don du zhugs pa ni /
translated: The bodhisattva who strives for the benefit of others

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don bsgrubs nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba 'thob ste /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don bsgrubs nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba 'thob ste /
translated: obtains the happiness of nirvana after accomplishing the benefit of self and other.

original: 'di ni sgrub pa'i khyad par gzhan yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sgrub pa'i khyad par gzhan yin no //
translated: This is another special point of his practice.🔽A verse on the dedication of the experiential domain

original: spyod yul yongs su bsngo bar tshigs su bcad pa /🔽rgyal sras spyod tshe ji lta ji lta bur //
analyzed: spyod yul yongs su bsngo bar tshigs su bcad pa / rgyal sras spyod tshe ji lta ji lta bur //
translated: .🔽Whatever the various experiential domains of the senses

original: dbang po'i spyod yul sna tshogs 'jug 'gyur ba //🔽de lta de ltar rigs shing mthun tshig gis //
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul sna tshogs 'jug 'gyur ba // de lta de ltar rigs shing mthun tshig gis //
translated: in which the victors’ spiritual heir engages,

original: sems can phan phyir de mngon 'du byed do //
analyzed: sems can phan phyir de mngon 'du byed do //
translated: he manifests them for the benefit of sentient beings🔽with words that are appropriate and fitting.

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyod lam byed pa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa na rnam pa gang dang gang gis mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i spyod yul sna tshogs la 'jug pa'i rnam pa de dang der 'brel zhing 'dra ba'i tshig gis sems can rnams la phan par bya
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyod lam byed pa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa na rnam pa gang dang gang gis mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i spyod yul sna tshogs la 'jug pa'i rnam pa de dang der 'brel zhing 'dra ba'i tshig gis sems can rnams la phan par bya
translated: Whatever the various experiential domains of the senses in which the bodhisattva engages in the course of his conduct, he manifests them for the benefit of sentient beings with words that are appropriate and fitting.

original: ba'i phyir de thams cad ji ltar spyod yul yongs su dag pa'i mdo las rgyas par bstan pa bzhin mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: ba'i phyir de thams cad ji ltar spyod yul yongs su dag pa'i mdo las rgyas par bstan pa bzhin mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: He does so in all ways, as extensively taught in the Scripture on the Completely Pure Experiential Domain.

original: sems can rnams la mi bzod pa dgag par tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: sems can rnams la mi bzod pa dgag par tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the prevention of impatience toward sentient beings

original: rtag tu nyes pas rang dbang med par byas sems kyis //
analyzed: rtag tu nyes pas rang dbang med par byas sems kyis //
translated: The mind is always overpowered by faults.

original: skye bo na ni blo ldan nyes par mi 'dzin te //
analyzed: skye bo na ni blo ldan nyes par mi 'dzin te //
translated: The wise do not consider them at fault,🔽because they are powerless,🔽because they are overwhelmed by the afflictions,

original: mi 'dod bzhin du log par sgrub par 'gyur ro zhes //🔽skye bo dag la snying rje rnam par 'phel phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dod bzhin du log par sgrub par 'gyur ro zhes // skye bo dag la snying rje rnam par 'phel phyir ro //
translated: and because their wrongdoing is involuntary.🔽The wise do not consider those whose minds are always overpowered by the afflictions to be at fault,

original: rtag tu nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rang dbang med par byas pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i skye bo la byang chub sems dpa' nyes par mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: rtag tu nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rang dbang med par byas pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i skye bo la byang chub sems dpa' nyes par mi 'dzin to //
translated: because they are powerless.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di dag ni mi 'dod bzhin du log par sgrub pa dag tu 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rig gnas snying rje 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mi 'dod bzhin du log par sgrub pa dag tu 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rig gnas snying rje 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they know that they are acting wrongly against their will, and their compassion increases.

original: sgrub pa'i che ba nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i che ba nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the greatness of the practice

original: sgrub pa 'di ni srid dang 'gro ba kun //
analyzed: sgrub pa 'di ni srid dang 'gro ba kun //
translated: This practice proceeds by conquering all existence and rebirths,

original: zil gyis mnan 'gro zhi ba mchog dang ldan //
analyzed: zil gyis mnan 'gro zhi ba mchog dang ldan //
translated: and it is endowed with the highest peace.

original: yon tan sna tshogs tshogs kyis rnam par 'phel //
analyzed: yon tan sna tshogs tshogs kyis rnam par 'phel //
translated: It increases through the accumulation of various good qualities.

original: byams pa'i bsam pas rtag tu 'gro ba sdud //
analyzed: byams pa'i bsam pas rtag tu 'gro ba sdud //
translated: With a mind of love, he always gathers beings.

original: che ba nyid ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: che ba nyid ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Greatness is fourfold:

original: zil gyis gnod pa'i che ba nyid ni /
analyzed: zil gyis gnod pa'i che ba nyid ni /
translated: Greatness of supremacy is

original: srid pa gsum dang 'gro ba lnga po thams cad zil gyis mnan nas 'gro ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: srid pa gsum dang 'gro ba lnga po thams cad zil gyis mnan nas 'gro ba'i phyir te /
translated: because he goes, having surpassed all of the three worlds and the five classes of beings.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: in the Perfection of Wisdom

original: rab 'byor gal te gzugs dngos por 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te gzugs dngos por 'gyur gyi /
translated: if form were a thing and not a non-thing,

original: dngos po med pa ma yin na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas nges par 'byung bar mi @145a * //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ma yin na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas nges par 'byung bar mi @145a * //
translated: this perfection of wisdom would not surpass and go beyond the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And so on extensively.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i che ba nyid ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i che ba nyid ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Greatness of nirvana is because he possesses a nirvana that does not abide in the extremes.

original: yon tan gyi che ba nyid dang / sems can yongs su mi gtong ba'i che ba nyid ni yon tan gyis 'phel ba pa dang ; 'gro ba sdud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan gyi che ba nyid dang / sems can yongs su mi gtong ba'i che ba nyid ni yon tan gyis 'phel ba pa dang ; 'gro ba sdud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The greatness of its virtues and the greatness of its non-abandonment of beings is due to the increase of virtues and the gathering of beings.

original: sgrub pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on practice is completed.

original: // / don dam pa'i mtshan nyid du tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: // / don dam pa'i mtshan nyid du tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the characteristics of the ultimate:

original: yod min med min de bzhin min gzhan min //🔽skye dang 'jig med 'bri bar mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: yod min med min de bzhin min gzhan min // skye dang 'jig med 'bri bar mi 'gyur te //
translated: It is neither existent nor non-existent, neither the same nor different,

original: 'phel ba med cing rnam par dag pa'ang med /
analyzed: 'phel ba med cing rnam par dag pa'ang med /
translated: neither produced nor destroyed, neither increased nor diminished,

original: rnam par dag 'gyur de ni don dam mtshan //
analyzed: rnam par dag 'gyur de ni don dam mtshan //
translated: and it is not purified. Its purification is the characteristic of the ultimate.

original: gnyis med pa'i don ni don dam pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis med pa'i don ni don dam pa ste /
translated: The meaning of non-duality is the ultimate.

original: gnyis med pa'i don de yang rnam pa ldas yang dag par ston to //🔽kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyis ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis med pa'i don de yang rnam pa ldas yang dag par ston to // kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyis ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And that meaning of non-duality is revealed in five aspects.🔽It is not existent by the characteristic of the imagined and the relative.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni med pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not non-existent by the characteristic of the perfect.

original: kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dag dang yongs su grub par gcig pa nyid med pas de bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dag dang yongs su grub par gcig pa nyid med pas de bzhin ma yin no //
translated: It is not so, because the imagined and the relative are not identical with the perfect.

original: de dag kho na dang gzhan pa nyid med pas gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kho na dang gzhan pa nyid med pas gzhan ma yin no //
translated: It is not otherwise, because they are not different.

original: chos kyi dbyings 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir skye ba yang med /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir skye ba yang med /
translated: There is no arising, because the realm of the Dharma is unconditioned.

original: 'jig pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'jig pa yang med do //
translated: There is no passing away,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag 'gag pa dang skye ba dang de bzhin gnas pa'i phyir 'bri bar yang mi 'gyur /🔽'phel bar yang mi 'gyur ro //🔽rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag 'gag pa dang skye ba dang de bzhin gnas pa'i phyir 'bri bar yang mi 'gyur / 'phel bar yang mi 'gyur ro // rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because defilement and purification are neither diminished nor increased, since they arise and cease in the same way.

original: rnam par dag par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: rnam par dag par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: There is no purification, because the realm of the Dharma is not defiled by nature.

original: glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa dang bral bas rnam par ma dag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa dang bral bas rnam par ma dag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not impure, because it is free from adventitious defilement.

original: de ltar na gnyis med pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga po de ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gnyis med pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga po de ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the five characteristics of non-duality should be understood as the characteristics of the ultimate.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i phyin ci log dgag par tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i phyin ci log dgag par tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse refuting the error of the view of self

original: bdag tu lta ba bdag nyid bdag mtshan min //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba bdag nyid bdag mtshan min //
translated: . The view of self is not the self, nor is it the characteristics of the self.

original: ngan par gnas min mtshan nyid mi 'dra phyir //
analyzed: ngan par gnas min mtshan nyid mi 'dra phyir //
translated: It is not a bad state, because the characteristics are not similar.

original: gnyis las gzhan med de ni nor pa skyes //
analyzed: gnyis las gzhan med de ni nor pa skyes //
translated: It is not different from the two, and it is produced by error.

original: de phyir thar pa nor tsam zad pa yin //
analyzed: de phyir thar pa nor tsam zad pa yin //
translated: Therefore, liberation is the exhaustion of mere error.

original: re zhig bdag tu lta ba nyid ni bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig bdag tu lta ba nyid ni bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: First, the view of self is not the characteristic of the self.

original: ngan par gnas pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: ngan par gnas pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it a bad state,

original: 'di ltar de ni bdag gi mtshan nyid du kun brtags pa'i bdag dang mtshan nyid ni 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni bdag gi mtshan nyid du kun brtags pa'i bdag dang mtshan nyid ni 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is similar to the self imagined as the characteristic of the self.

original: de @145b yang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: de @145b yang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ste /
translated: Moreover, the self is the five appropriated aggregates,

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len gyis rab tu bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len gyis rab tu bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is produced by the bad states of the afflictions.

original: 'di gnyis las gzhan pa'i bdag gi mtshan nyid kyang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis las gzhan pa'i bdag gi mtshan nyid kyang mi dmigs te /
translated: The characteristic of the self is not perceived as different from these two.

original: de lta bas na bdag ni med kyi bdag tu lta ba gang yin pa de ni nor pa skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag ni med kyi bdag tu lta ba gang yin pa de ni nor pa skyes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the self does not exist, and the view of self is produced by error.

original: bdag med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: thar pa yang nor pa tsam du zad pa yin par rig par bya'i grol ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: thar pa yang nor pa tsam du zad pa yin par rig par bya'i grol ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: liberation is also just a mistake. One should understand that there is no one who is liberated.

original: phyin ci log smad par tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: phyin ci log smad par tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on the condemnation of error.

original: ji ltar 'khrul pa tsam brten skye bo yis //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khrul pa tsam brten skye bo yis //
translated: 1. How can people, who are based on mere error,

original: sdug bsngal rang bzhin rgyun chags rtogs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rang bzhin rgyun chags rtogs mi 'gyur //
translated: realize the continuous nature of suffering?

original: rigs min rig nyid sdug bsngal sdug bsngal med ;
analyzed: rigs min rig nyid sdug bsngal sdug bsngal med ;
translated: 2. The unreal is known as suffering, the real as non-suffering;

original: / chos kyi rang bzhin de yi rang bzhin min //🔽brten nas dngos rab skye rab skye bar mngon 'jug pa'i //
analyzed: / chos kyi rang bzhin de yi rang bzhin min // brten nas dngos rab skye rab skye bar mngon 'jug pa'i //
translated: the nature of things is not that nature.

original: skye bo ji ltar gzhan gyis byas la brten //🔽gang phyir yod pa mi mthong med mthong ba //
analyzed: skye bo ji ltar gzhan gyis byas la brten // gang phyir yod pa mi mthong med mthong ba //
translated: 3. How can people, who are based on the arising of things from conditions,🔽be based on the creation of suffering by another?

original: 'di 'dra'i mun nag rnam pa de gang zhig / ji ltar na 'jig rten 'di dag tu lta ba nor pa tsam la brten nas 'du byed rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyis ngo bo nyid rtag tu rjes su 'brel pa mi mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di 'dra'i mun nag rnam pa de gang zhig / ji ltar na 'jig rten 'di dag tu lta ba nor pa tsam la brten nas 'du byed rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyis ngo bo nyid rtag tu rjes su 'brel pa mi mthong ste /
translated: 4. How can there be such darkness that one does not see what is and sees what is not?

original: sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin de ni ye shes kyis rig par bya mi dgos te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin de ni ye shes kyis rig par bya mi dgos te /
translated: The nature of suffering does not need to be known by a transcendent wisdom.

original: sdug bsngal nyams su myong bas rig pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyams su myong bas rig pa yin no //
translated: It is known by the experience of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal ma spangs pas sdug bsngal bar gyur pa yin la sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bar gyur pa med do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma spangs pas sdug bsngal bar gyur pa yin la sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bar gyur pa med do //
translated: Since suffering is not abandoned, it is the state of suffering. But since there is no self that possesses suffering, there is no state of suffering.

original: gang zag la bdag med pas chos tsam du zad pa'i phyir chos kyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pas chos tsam du zad pa'i phyir chos kyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Since there is no self in the person, there is only the mere thing.

original: chos la bdag med pas chos kyi rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pas chos kyi rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no self in the thing, there is no nature of the thing.

original: yang gang gi tsho 'jig rten gyis de dang de la brten nas dngos po de dang de dag 'byung ngo zhes bya bar dngos po rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mngon sum du mthong ba na de ji ltar mthong ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyis
analyzed: yang gang gi tsho 'jig rten gyis de dang de la brten nas dngos po de dang de dag 'byung ngo zhes bya bar dngos po rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mngon sum du mthong ba na de ji ltar mthong ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyis
translated: Moreover, when the world directly sees the dependent origination of things, that is, that this and that thing arises in dependence on this and that, how could it be that what is seen and so on by the world is not seen and so on by the world?

original: byas kyi / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i lta ba 'di la brten /
analyzed: byas kyi / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i lta ba 'di la brten /
translated: But this is not the case.

original: 'jig rten gyi mun nag gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod pa ni mi mthong gi / med pa bdag du rtogs pa 'di 'dra ba de gang zhig yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mun nag gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod pa ni mi mthong gi / med pa bdag du rtogs pa 'di 'dra ba de gang zhig yin te /
translated: What is this darkness of the world, in which one does not see what is dependent origination, but sees what is not dependent origination, and imagines that to be the self?

original: yod pa ni mun pas mi mthong bar nus kyi /
analyzed: yod pa ni mun pas mi mthong bar nus kyi /
translated: Darkness can prevent the seeing of what is,

original: med pa ma thong bar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ma thong bar ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the seeing of what is not.

original: bdag med par zhi ba rung bar tshigs su bcad pa /🔽'di la don dam tshul gyis zhi ba dang @146a * //
analyzed: bdag med par zhi ba rung bar tshigs su bcad pa / 'di la don dam tshul gyis zhi ba dang @146a * //
translated: A verse on the appropriateness of peace through selflessness🔽In this, there is no difference at all between peace

original: skye ba de gnyis khyad par ci yang med //
analyzed: skye ba de gnyis khyad par ci yang med //
translated: and birth, in terms of ultimate reality.🔽But it is said that those who do good actions attain peace

original: 'on kyang dge ba'i las rnams byed pa dag / skye ba zad pas zhi ba 'thob par bshad //
analyzed: 'on kyang dge ba'i las rnams byed pa dag / skye ba zad pas zhi ba 'thob par bshad //
translated: through the exhaustion of birth.

original: don dam pa'i tshul bdag med par mnyam pa nyid kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la tha dad du bya ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i tshul bdag med par mnyam pa nyid kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la tha dad du bya ba ci yang med do //
translated: In terms of ultimate reality, there is no difference at all between cyclic existence and liberation, since they are the same in selflessness.

original: 'on kyang gang dag thar pa'i lam sgom pa dge ba'i las byed pa dag gi skye ba zad pas thar pa 'thob par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang dag thar pa'i lam sgom pa dge ba'i las byed pa dag gi skye ba zad pas thar pa 'thob par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: But those who practice virtue, who cultivate the path of liberation, will attain liberation by exhausting their births.

original: phyin ci log smad pa byas nas de'i gnyen po don dam pa'i ye shes la 'jug par tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste /🔽byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams ye shes kyi ;
analyzed: phyin ci log smad pa byas nas de'i gnyen po don dam pa'i ye shes la 'jug par tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste / byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams ye shes kyi ;
translated: Having criticized error, four verses on the entry into ultimate intuition, which is its antidote.🔽The bodhisattva, having well accumulated the infinite stores

original: / mtha' yas pha rol tshogs rnams legs bsags nas //🔽chos la sems pa shin tu rnam nges phyir //
analyzed: / mtha' yas pha rol tshogs rnams legs bsags nas // chos la sems pa shin tu rnam nges phyir //
translated: of merit and intuition,🔽realizes the meaning by the cause of verbal expression,

original: don gyi rnam pa brjod pa'i rgyu can rtogs //
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa brjod pa'i rgyu can rtogs //
translated: because of the thorough certainty of reflection on the teaching.

original: de yis brjod pa tsam du don rig nas //
analyzed: de yis brjod pa tsam du don rig nas //
translated: Having understood that the meaning is merely verbal expression,

original: der snang sems tsam la ni yang dag gnas //
analyzed: der snang sems tsam la ni yang dag gnas //
translated: he is well established in mind-only, which appears as that.🔽Then he realizes directly the reality realm,

original: de nas chos dbyings gnyis kyi mtshan nyid dang // bral ba mngon sum nyid du rtogs par 'gyur //🔽sems las gzhan med par ni blos rig nas //
analyzed: de nas chos dbyings gnyis kyi mtshan nyid dang // bral ba mngon sum nyid du rtogs par 'gyur // sems las gzhan med par ni blos rig nas //
translated: free of the characteristics of duality.🔽Having understood by his mind that there is nothing other than mind,

original: de nas sems kyang med pa nyid du rtogs //
analyzed: de nas sems kyang med pa nyid du rtogs //
translated: then he understands that mind also is non-existent.

original: blo dang ldan pas gnyis po med rig nas //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas gnyis po med rig nas //
translated: The wise, having understood the nonexistence of the duality,

original: de mi ldan pa'i chos kyi dbyings lag nas //
analyzed: de mi ldan pa'i chos kyi dbyings lag nas //
translated: in the dharmadhatu devoid of that,

original: blo dang ldan pa'i mi rtog ye shes stobs //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa'i mi rtog ye shes stobs //
translated: the wise, by the power of nonconceptual intuition,

original: rtag tu kun nas mnyam par song ba yis //
analyzed: rtag tu kun nas mnyam par song ba yis //
translated: which is always and everywhere the same,🔽removes the thickets of faults that are based on it,

original: de la brten pa'i nyes tshogs tshang tshing dag / dug sman chen pos dug bzhin sel bar byed //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i nyes tshogs tshang tshing dag / dug sman chen pos dug bzhin sel bar byed //
translated: like a powerful antidote removes a poison.

original: gcig gis ni tshogs chen po bas gas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la brten nas ngas ma pa'i phyir chos bsam pa nyid du rnam par nges pa nyid dang / yid kyi brjod pa yin pa'i phyir chos de dag don du snang bar rtogs lnga'i phyir de la 'jug pa rab tu ston te /
analyzed: gcig gis ni tshogs chen po bas gas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la brten nas ngas ma pa'i phyir chos bsam pa nyid du rnam par nges pa nyid dang / yid kyi brjod pa yin pa'i phyir chos de dag don du snang bar rtogs lnga'i phyir de la 'jug pa rab tu ston te /
translated: One shows the entry into that by the great accumulation of the collections, by the certainty of the thought of dharma based on concentration, and by the understanding that those dharmas appear as objects because they are mental expressions.

original: dus rab tu dbye ba grangs med pas 'di'i pha rol yongs su rdzogs pas nas mtha' yas pha rol yin no //
analyzed: dus rab tu dbye ba grangs med pas 'di'i pha rol yongs su rdzogs pas nas mtha' yas pha rol yin no //
translated: The end of the endless is the endless end, because the endlessness of time is completed beyond it.

original: gnyis pas ni don rnams yid kyis brjod pa tsam du rig nas der snang ba'i sems tsam la gnas pa ston te /
analyzed: gnyis pas ni don rnams yid kyis brjod pa tsam du rig nas der snang ba'i sems tsam la gnas pa ston te /
translated: The second shows that, having understood that objects are merely the mind's verbalization, one abides in mind only, which appears as those objects.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva's stage of the factors conducive to penetration.

original: de phan chad ni chos kyi dbyings gnyis kyi mtshan nyid gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba mngon @146b sum nyid du rtogs te /
analyzed: de phan chad ni chos kyi dbyings gnyis kyi mtshan nyid gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba mngon @146b sum nyid du rtogs te /
translated: From that point on, one realizes the reality realm directly, free of the characteristics of the duality of object and subject.

original: 'di ni mthong ba'i lam gyi skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mthong ba'i lam gyi skabs yin no //
translated: This is the stage of the path of seeing.

original: gsum pas ni ji ltar 'dis chos kyi dbyings mngon sum nyid du rtogs pa ston to //
analyzed: gsum pas ni ji ltar 'dis chos kyi dbyings mngon sum nyid du rtogs pa ston to //
translated: The third shows how one realizes the reality realm directly.

original: ji ltar 'dis mngon sum du rtogs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dis mngon sum du rtogs she na /
translated: How does one realize it directly?

original: sems las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa gzung ba med do zhes bya bar blos rtogs nas gzung ba med na 'dzin pa yang med pa'i phyir sems tsam po de yang med pa nyid du khong du chud do //
analyzed: sems las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa gzung ba med do zhes bya bar blos rtogs nas gzung ba med na 'dzin pa yang med pa'i phyir sems tsam po de yang med pa nyid du khong du chud do //
translated: Having understood with the mind that there is no apprehended object other than the mind, one comprehends that that mind only does not exist, because if there is no apprehended object, there is no apprehending subject.

original: de gnyis med pa nyid du rig nas de dang mi ldan pa'i chos kyi dbyings gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dag dang bral ba la gnas te /
analyzed: de gnyis med pa nyid du rig nas de dang mi ldan pa'i chos kyi dbyings gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dag dang bral ba la gnas te /
translated: Having understood that those two do not exist, one abides in the reality realm, which is not endowed with them, and is free from the characteristics of subject and object.

original: de ltar na chos kyi dbyings mngon sum nyid du rtogs pa yin no ;
analyzed: de ltar na chos kyi dbyings mngon sum nyid du rtogs pa yin no ;
translated: Thus one realizes the reality realm in actuality.

original: / bzhi pas ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs na gnas yongs su gyur pas don dam pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa ston te /
analyzed: / bzhi pas ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs na gnas yongs su gyur pas don dam pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa ston te /
translated: The fourth shows the entry into the ultimate pristine wisdom through the transformation of one's being at the time of the path of cultivation.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis dus kun du mnyam pa nyid du song bas de la brten pa'i nyes pa'i tshogs ring du rjes su zhugs pa /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis dus kun du mnyam pa nyid du song bas de la brten pa'i nyes pa'i tshogs ring du rjes su zhugs pa /
translated: The collection of faults that are based on that, which have long been engaged in,

original: gnas ngan len gyi mtshan nyid dag dug sman chen pos dug bzhin du sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi mtshan nyid dag dug sman chen pos dug bzhin du sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the characteristics of negative reflex actions, are eliminated like poison by the great antidote.

original: de gang la mnyam nyid du song zhe na /
analyzed: de gang la mnyam nyid du song zhe na /
translated: In what does it become sameness?

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la'o //
translated: In the dependent nature.

original: don dam pa'i ye shes kyi che ba nyid kyi tshigs su bcang pa /
analyzed: don dam pa'i ye shes kyi che ba nyid kyi tshigs su bcang pa /
translated: A verse on the greatness of the ultimate pristine wisdom.

original: thub las gsungs pa'i dam chos legs bzhag pa //
analyzed: thub las gsungs pa'i dam chos legs bzhag pa //
translated: The excellent teaching of the holy Dharma spoken by the Sage

original: rtsa ba'i chos kyi dbyings la blo grol bzhag / dran rgyu rtog pa rtsam rig brtan pa dag //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i chos kyi dbyings la blo grol bzhag / dran rgyu rtog pa rtsam rig brtan pa dag //
translated: is well established in the mind of the bodhisattva who has entered ultimate wisdom.

original: myur du yon tan rgya mtsho'i pha rol 'gro //
analyzed: myur du yon tan rgya mtsho'i pha rol 'gro //
translated: The wise one who has attained the stage of joy quickly crosses the ocean of good qualities.🔽The bodhisattva who has entered ultimate wisdom well establishes the excellent teaching of the holy Dharma spoken by the Buddha.🔽The mind that is the root of the Dharma is the mind that focuses on the summarized Dharma, and the mind is placed in the expanse of reality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' don dam pa'i ye shes la zhugs pa des sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i dam pa'i chos legs par bzhag pa'i rtsa ba'i sems bsdus pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i chos kyi dbyings la blo gros bzhag nas dran pa gang dang gang skye ba'i dran ba
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' don dam pa'i ye shes la zhugs pa des sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i dam pa'i chos legs par bzhag pa'i rtsa ba'i sems bsdus pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i chos kyi dbyings la blo gros bzhag nas dran pa gang dang gang skye ba'i dran ba
translated: Whatever mindfulness arises,

original: 'jug pa de dag thams cad rtog pa rtsam du khong du chud de /
analyzed: 'jug pa de dag thams cad rtog pa rtsam du khong du chud de /
translated: all those engaged in mindfulness are understood to be mere conceptual thoughts.

original: de ltar na myur du yon tan rgya mtsho'i pha rol sangs rgyas nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur bas 'di ni don dam pa'i ye shes kyi che ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na myur du yon tan rgya mtsho'i pha rol sangs rgyas nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur bas 'di ni don dam pa'i ye shes kyi che ba nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, one quickly crosses to the other shore of the ocean of good qualities, to buddhahood itself. This is the greatness of ultimate wisdom.

original: de kho na nyid kyi skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on suchness is complete.

original: // / mthu'i mtshan nyid rnam par dbye bas tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: // / mthu'i mtshan nyid rnam par dbye bas tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the analysis of the characteristics of power

original: skye dang ngag sems dge dang mi dge bskyed //
analyzed: skye dang ngag sems dge dang mi dge bskyed //
translated: . He has the power to know the creation of speech and mind, virtue and evil,

original: de yi gnas dang 'byung ba mngon sum gang //
analyzed: de yi gnas dang 'byung ba mngon sum gang //
translated: their support and emergence, and direct intuition,

original: shes pa kun 'gro rab tu dbye bcas la //
analyzed: shes pa kun 'gro rab tu dbye bcas la //
translated: omnipresent and differentiated,

original: thogs med bstan pa thob pa'i thu yin no //🔽gzhan @147a * //
analyzed: thogs med bstan pa thob pa'i thu yin no // gzhan @147a * //
translated: unimpeded, and the attainment of teaching.

original: dag gi skye ba shes pa ni //
analyzed: dag gi skye ba shes pa ni //
translated: The power to know the deaths and rebirths of others

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mngon par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mngon par shes pa yin no //
translated: is the superknowledge of deaths and rebirths.

original: de dang de dag tu skyes pa rnams ci smra ba'i tshig shes pa ni /
analyzed: de dang de dag tu skyes pa rnams ci smra ba'i tshig shes pa ni /
translated: The power to know the speech of those born here and there

original: lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa yin no //
translated: is the superknowledge of divine hearing.🔽The power to know the minds of others

original: sems shes pa ni sems kyi rnam grangs mngon par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: sems shes pa ni sems kyi rnam grangs mngon par shes pa yin no //
translated: is the superknowledge of the knowledge of the minds of others.

original: sngon dge ba dang mi dge ba bskyed pa shes pa ni //
analyzed: sngon dge ba dang mi dge ba bskyed pa shes pa ni //
translated: The power to know the creation of former virtues and evils

original: sngon gyi gnas mngon par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas mngon par shes pa yin no //
translated: is the superknowledge of the knowledge of former states.

original: gang na gdul bya dag 'khor pa de'i gnas su 'gro ba shes pa ni /
