analyzed: gang na gdul bya dag 'khor pa de'i gnas su 'gro ba shes pa ni /
translated: The power to know the going to any place for the sake of disciples

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: is the superknowledge of the knowledge of the categories of the way.

original: ji ltar sems can rnams skye ba las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'byung ba shes pa ni ;
analyzed: ji ltar sems can rnams skye ba las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'byung ba shes pa ni ;
translated: The knowledge of the elements that are the source of the birth of beings is

original: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa yin te /
translated: the superknowledge of the extinction of the outflows.

original: de ltar na 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du don drug po de dag rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa la shes pa mngon sum du gyur pa thogs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu mngon bar shes pas bsdus🔽pa yin no ;
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du don drug po de dag rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa la shes pa mngon sum du gyur pa thogs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu mngon bar shes pas bsdus pa yin no ;
translated: Thus, the unobstructed direct knowledge of these six topics, together with their subdivisions, in all the world systems, is the power of the bodhisattvas, included in their superknowledges.

original: / mthu'i mtshan nyid rnam par dbye ba la /
analyzed: / mthu'i mtshan nyid rnam par dbye ba la /
translated: The classification of the characteristics of power

original: rang bzhin gyi don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of nature has been explained.

original: rgyu'i don las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: rgyu'i don las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: The meaning of cause will be treated in the verse

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa shin tu dag thob nas //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa shin tu dag thob nas //
translated: Having attained the fourth concentration, perfectly pure,🔽From the retention of nonconceptual intuition

original: mi rtog ye shes yongs su gzung ba dang // ji ltar rnam gnas yid la byed pa las //
analyzed: mi rtog ye shes yongs su gzung ba dang // ji ltar rnam gnas yid la byed pa las //
translated: And from the mental attention to the way of abiding,

original: mthu 'grub pa yi dam pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: mthu 'grub pa yi dam pa thob par 'gyur //
translated: One attains the supreme accomplishment of power.

original: rten gang dang / ye shes gang dang / yid la byed pa gang dag gis mthu de yang dag par 'grub pa de ston to //
analyzed: rten gang dang / ye shes gang dang / yid la byed pa gang dag gis mthu de yang dag par 'grub pa de ston to //
translated: It shows what the basis is, what the intuition is, and what the mental activity is by which that power is accomplished.

original: 'bras bu'i don las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /🔽gang gis 'phags dang lha dang tshangs pa yi //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i don las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa / gang gis 'phags dang lha dang tshangs pa yi //
translated: A verse on the topic of the result of power:

original: gnas pa dpe med rgya ches rtag tu gnas //
analyzed: gnas pa dpe med rgya ches rtag tu gnas //
translated: 1. By it the Saint always dwells in the incomparable, vast, divine, and holy states,

original: phyogs su de song sangs rgyas sems can dag / yang dag mchod byed rnam par dag pa bskyed //
analyzed: phyogs su de song sangs rgyas sems can dag / yang dag mchod byed rnam par dag pa bskyed //
translated: and, going to the directions, he makes perfect offerings to the Buddhas and generates pure deeds for the beings.

original: mthu de'i 'bras bu rnam pa gsum ston te /🔽bdag nyid kyis 'phags pa la sogs pa'i bde bar gnas pa mtshungs pa med pa mchog dang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag du song ste /
analyzed: mthu de'i 'bras bu rnam pa gsum ston te / bdag nyid kyis 'phags pa la sogs pa'i bde bar gnas pa mtshungs pa med pa mchog dang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag du song ste /
translated: It shows the threefold result of that power:🔽the Saint’s incomparable, supreme, and divine bliss, by his own nature;

original: sangs rgyas rnams la mchod pa dang / sems can rnams rnam par sbyong ba'o //🔽las rnam pa drug gi don las brtsams nas tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la mchod pa dang / sems can rnams rnam par sbyong ba'o //🔽las rnam pa drug gi don las brtsams nas tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste /
translated: and, going to other world spheres, making offerings to the Buddhas and purifying the deeds of beings.

original: mthong ba'i lam dang ston pa'i las las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa //🔽'chags dang @147b 'jig bcas sems can bcas pa yi //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang ston pa'i las las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa // 'chags dang @147b 'jig bcas sems can bcas pa yi //
translated: One verse on the path of insight and the action of teaching

original: 'jig rten khams kun sgyu ma lta bur mthong //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams kun sgyu ma lta bur mthong //
translated: . He sees all world-realms as like illusions, with their creations and dissolutions and their living beings.

original: dbang ldan ji ltar 'dod bzhin de dag dang // rnam bcas sna tshogs dag kyang yang dag ston //
analyzed: dbang ldan ji ltar 'dod bzhin de dag dang // rnam bcas sna tshogs dag kyang yang dag ston //
translated: The powerful one manifests them as he wishes, and also their various movements.

original: bdag nyid kyis kyang 'jig rten gyi khams 'chags pa dang 'jig pa dang bcas shing sems can dang bcas pa thams cad sgyur ma lta bu nyid du mthong la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis kyang 'jig rten gyi khams 'chags pa dang 'jig pa dang bcas shing sems can dang bcas pa thams cad sgyur ma lta bu nyid du mthong la /
translated: He himself sees all world-realms with their creations and dissolutions and their living beings as like illusions.

original: dbang bcu thob pa'i phyir dbang dang ldan pa gzhan dag la yang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin de dag dang / gzhan yang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs ston pa'i phyir te /🔽de dag kyang ji skad du /
analyzed: dbang bcu thob pa'i phyir dbang dang ldan pa gzhan dag la yang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin de dag dang / gzhan yang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs ston pa'i phyir te / de dag kyang ji skad du /
translated: And because he has attained the ten masteries, he manifests them as he wishes for others, and also their various movements, such as trembling.

original: sa bcu pa'i sa brgyad pa las bstan pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i sa brgyad pa las bstan pa lta bu yin no //
translated: These masteries are taught in the Eighth Chapter of the Ten Stages.

original: 'od zer gyi las las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa //
analyzed: 'od zer gyi las las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa //
translated: One verse on the action of light

original: 'od zer btang bas shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i //
analyzed: 'od zer btang bas shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i //
translated: By emitting light rays, he causes those in the miserable states,

original: ngan song ba dag mtho ris 'gro bar byed //
analyzed: ngan song ba dag mtho ris 'gro bar byed //
translated: who are suffering greatly, to go to the higher states.🔽He causes the lofty, beautiful palaces of the demons to tremble and quake,

original: bdud gnas gzhal med khang mtho mdzes pa dag / bdud bcas kun du bskyod cing skrag par byed //
analyzed: bdud gnas gzhal med khang mtho mdzes pa dag / bdud bcas kun du bskyod cing skrag par byed //
translated: terrifying the demons.

original: 'od zer gyi las rnam par gnyis ston te /
analyzed: 'od zer gyi las rnam par gnyis ston te /
translated: The activity of the light rays is shown to be twofold:

original: ngan song du skyes pa rnams dang pa bskyed nas mtho ris su skye bar byed pa dang / bdud kyi gnas bdud dang bcas pa rnams bskyod pas mi dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ngan song du skyes pa rnams dang pa bskyed nas mtho ris su skye bar byed pa dang / bdud kyi gnas bdud dang bcas pa rnams bskyod pas mi dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: having generated the thought of the miserable realms, he causes them to be born in the higher states; and he causes the abodes of the demons, together with the demons, to tremble and quake, thus terrifying them.

original: rnam par rol pa'i las dang sprul pa'i las las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /🔽de ni mchog tshogs nang du ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: rnam par rol pa'i las dang sprul pa'i las las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa / de ni mchog tshogs nang du ting nge 'dzin //
translated: A verse on the topic of the activity of play and the activity of emanation:🔽In the midst of the supreme assembly, he displays

original: dpag med rnam par rol pa kun ston zhing //
analyzed: dpag med rnam par rol pa kun ston zhing //
translated: incalculable manifestations through his samadhi.

original: las dang skye dang mchog gi sprul pa yis //

analyzed: sprul pa rnam pa gsum ni bzo'i las kyi gnas sprul pa dang / 'dul ba'i dbang gis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin skye ba sprul pa dang / dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa la sogs pa mchog sprul pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of emanations are emanations of craftsmanship, emanations of birth, which are taken on in whatever way is necessary to train disciples, and supreme emanations, such as the Buddha's dwelling in the Tusita heaven.

original: zhing yongs su dag pa'i las las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /

analyzed: sangs rgyas mtshan mi grags bar sangs rgyas mtshan // yang dag @148a * //

analyzed: yongs su sbyong ba rnam pa gnyis kyis te /

analyzed: rang bzhin brtan pa so sor brtags sgom pa //
translated: 1. The nature of tolerance is firmness, meditative practice,

original: grang sogs shin tu sdug bsngal rtag mi mjed //
analyzed: grang sogs shin tu sdug bsngal rtag mi mjed //
translated: unshakable patience with cold and so forth,

original: khyad par 'gro dang dge la mngon par dga' //
analyzed: khyad par 'gro dang dge la mngon par dga' //
translated: progress, and delight in virtue.

original: bzod pa yongs su smin pa'i mtshan 'dod //
analyzed: bzod pa yongs su smin pa'i mtshan 'dod //
translated: These are considered the signs of full maturity of tolerance.

original: brtan pa dang mi mjed pa dang bzod pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs te /
analyzed: brtan pa dang mi mjed pa dang bzod pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs te /
translated: Steadfastness, patience, and endurance are synonyms.

original: yongs su smin pa la rigs dang so sor brtags te sgom pa ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa la rigs dang so sor brtags te sgom pa ni rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of full maturation is the spiritual gene and the practice of careful consideration.

original: grang ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzad pa rnams ji mi mjed pa ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: grang ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzad pa rnams ji mi mjed pa ni rang bzhin no //
translated: The essence is the ability to endure the unbearable sufferings of cold and so on.

original: bzod pa khyad par du 'gro dbang /
analyzed: bzod pa khyad par du 'gro dbang /
translated: Patience is the power to progress.

original: dge ba la mngon par 'dod pa ni las so //
analyzed: dge ba la mngon par 'dod pa ni las so //
translated: The action is the delight in virtue.

original: yid gzhungs pa yongs su smin pa las brtsam te tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: yid gzhungs pa yongs su smin pa las brtsam te tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: The verse on the full maturation of mental facility:

original: rnam smin dag cing thos sogs dran mi brjed //
analyzed: rnam smin dag cing thos sogs dran mi brjed //
translated: The mental faculty is fully matured when it is pure, when one is not forgetful of what one has heard,

original: de bzhin legs bshad nyes par smras pa dag / rab shes blo chen skye bar rung ba nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin legs bshad nyes par smras pa dag / rab shes blo chen skye bar rung ba nyid //
translated: when one understands well what is said well and badly, and when one is fit for the arising of great understanding.

original: shin tu yid gzhungs yongs su smin pa'i mtshan /
analyzed: shin tu yid gzhungs yongs su smin pa'i mtshan /
translated: The mental faculty is fully matured when it is pure, when one is not forgetful of what one has heard,🔽when one understands well what is said well and badly, and when one is fit for the arising of great understanding.

original: de la yid gzhungs pa dang mthun pa'i rnam par smin pa dag ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la yid gzhungs pa dang mthun pa'i rnam par smin pa dag ni rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of mental facility is the purity of the mental faculty and the maturation of the faculty.

original: dran pas thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa byas nas ring mo zhig lon pa dang smras nas ring mo zhig lon pa mi brjed pa dang / legs par bshad pa dang / nyes par smras pa don rab tu shes pa ni yid gzhungs pa yongs su smin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dran pas thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa byas nas ring mo zhig lon pa dang smras nas ring mo zhig lon pa mi brjed pa dang / legs par bshad pa dang / nyes par smras pa don rab tu shes pa ni yid gzhungs pa yongs su smin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of maturity of a sharp mind is that, having heard, reflected, and meditated for a long time, one does not forget; and that one understands well what is well spoken and what is badly spoken.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab skye bar rung ba nyid ni las so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab skye bar rung ba nyid ni las so //
translated: Its action is that it is fit to generate supramundane wisdom.

original: mthu thob pa yongs su smin pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: mthu thob pa yongs su smin pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the analysis of the maturity of the achievement of power🔽The two virtues nourish the two elements,🔽the support is the best for the arising of the fruit,

original: dge ba gnyis kyis khams gnyis brtas pa dang // rten ni 'bras bu skye bar rung ba'i mchog / yid la bsam grub 'gro ba'i mchog gyur pa //
analyzed: dge ba gnyis kyis khams gnyis brtas pa dang // rten ni 'bras bu skye bar rung ba'i mchog / yid la bsam grub 'gro ba'i mchog gyur pa //
translated: the achievement of one's aims is the best for beings,

original: mthu thob yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mthu thob yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: this is the nature of the maturity of the achievement of power.

original: de la bsod nams dang ye shes gnyis kyi bsod nams dang ye shes de gnyis kyi sa bon brtas pa ni de yongs su smin pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la bsod nams dang ye shes gnyis kyi bsod nams dang ye shes de gnyis kyi sa bon brtas pa ni de yongs su smin pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of that maturity is the nourishment of the seeds of both merit and wisdom.

original: rten rtogs par bya bar rung ba ni //🔽de yongs su smin @150a * //
analyzed: rten rtogs par bya bar rung ba ni // de yongs su smin @150a * //
translated: The suitability for the realization of the support

original: pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: is the nature of its full perfection.

original: yid la bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa grub pa dang 'gro ba'i mchog tu gyur pa ni las so //
analyzed: yid la bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa grub pa dang 'gro ba'i mchog tu gyur pa ni las so //
translated: The accomplishment of the highest aim of thought and the attainment of the highest state of beings is its activity.🔽The full perfection of inexhaustibility is to be understood in terms of the Dharma body.

original: mi 'phrogs pa yongs su smin pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa yongs su smin pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the full perfection of inexhaustibility

original: chos bzangs rigs pas rnam dpyad bsam pa can //
analyzed: chos bzangs rigs pas rnam dpyad bsam pa can //
translated: The one who is endowed with the thought of the good Dharma,

original: rtag tu bdud kyis bar chad byed pa med //
analyzed: rtag tu bdud kyis bar chad byed pa med //
translated: who is always unassailable by Mara,

original: khyad par rnyed dang gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin //
analyzed: khyad par rnyed dang gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin //
translated: who attains distinction and refutes the positions of others

original: mi 'phrogs yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'phrogs yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: has the mark of the full perfection of inexhaustibility.

original: dam pa'i chos la rigs pas rnam par dpyad pa byas pa'i bsam pa ni de yongs su smin pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la rigs pas rnam par dpyad pa byas pa'i bsam pa ni de yongs su smin pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of that full perfection is the thought of the good Dharma, which is investigated with reason.

original: lam la bdud kyi bar chad bya bar mi nus shing bdud kyi bar chad med pa ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: lam la bdud kyi bar chad bya bar mi nus shing bdud kyi bar chad med pa ni rang bzhin no //
translated: Its nature is that it cannot be assailed by Mara on the path, and that it is free of the assaults of Mara.

original: khyad par rtogs pa dang / gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa ni las so //
analyzed: khyad par rtogs pa dang / gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa ni las so //
translated: Its activity is the attainment of distinction and the refutation of the positions of others.

original: spong pa'i yan lag dang ldan pa yongs su smin pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: spong pa'i yan lag dang ldan pa yongs su smin pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: The verse beginning with the words, “The one who has accumulated virtue, whose support is fit for striving, who delights in solitude and in the highest virtue,” treats the perfection of the branches of abandonment.

original: dge ba bsags dang rten kyang brtson par rung //
analyzed: dge ba bsags dang rten kyang brtson par rung //
translated: The one who has accumulated virtue, whose support is fit for striving,

original: dben dang dge ba mchog la mngon par dga' ;
analyzed: dben dang dge ba mchog la mngon par dga' ;
translated: who delights in solitude and in the highest virtue,

original: / rgyal ba'i sras kyi yan lag ldan pa yi //
analyzed: / rgyal ba'i sras kyi yan lag ldan pa yi //
translated: is the victor-child who has the branches,

original: yang dag yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the true perfection of maturity.

original: de yongs su smin pa'i rgyu ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'o //
analyzed: de yongs su smin pa'i rgyu ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'o //
translated: The cause of that perfection is the accumulation of roots of virtue.

original: rten brtson 'grus rtsom par bzod pa ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rten brtson 'grus rtsom par bzod pa ni rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the support is the endurance of striving.

original: dben pa dang dge ba'i mchog la mngon par dga' ba ni las so //
analyzed: dben pa dang dge ba'i mchog la mngon par dga' ba ni las so //
translated: The activity is delighting in solitude and in the highest virtue.

original: bdag yongs su smin pa rnam pa dgu'i cha ba'i bdag nyid las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa //
analyzed: bdag yongs su smin pa rnam pa dgu'i cha ba'i bdag nyid las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa //
translated: The verse beginning with the words, “Thus, the one who is mature in nine ways,” treats the perfection of the self-maturity of the bodhisattva.🔽Thus, the one who is mature in nine ways,

original: de ltar dngos po rnam dgu smin pa'i bdag / pha rol yongs su smin byed rung dang ldan //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po rnam dgu smin pa'i bdag / pha rol yongs su smin byed rung dang ldan //
translated: is fit to bring others to maturity.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin rgyun 'phel bdag nyid can //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin rgyun 'phel bdag nyid can //
translated: The nature of his being is the continuity of the Dharma.

original: rtag tu 'gro ba'i gnyen mchog la mngon par dga' ba ni las so //
analyzed: rtag tu 'gro ba'i gnyen mchog la mngon par dga' ba ni las so //
translated: Its action is to delight in always being the best of friends to beings.

original: bdag yongs su smin pa rnam pa te ;
analyzed: bdag yongs su smin pa rnam pa te ;
translated: There are four kinds of maturity of the bodhisattvas themselves:🔽maturity as teacher of the evolutionary development of others,

original: gzhan yongs su smin par bya ba'i ston par gyur pa dang / rtag tu chos kyi skus 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yongs su smin par bya ba'i ston par gyur pa dang / rtag tu chos kyi skus 'phel ba'o //
translated: and constant growth in the body of truth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'gro ba'i gnyen gyi mtshog tu gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'gro ba'i gnyen gyi mtshog tu gyur pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, they become the best of friends to beings.

original: sems can yongs su smin pa rnam par dbye ba las brtsams te tshig su bcad pa bcu gcig go //🔽ji ltar rma dang zas la de dag gi //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin pa rnam par dbye ba las brtsams te tshig su bcad pa bcu gcig go // ji ltar rma dang zas la de dag gi //
translated: Eleven verses on the analysis of the evolutionary development of beings.🔽As a wound and food are considered ripe

original: gzag dang dpyad du rung ba smin 'dod ltar //
analyzed: gzag dang dpyad du rung ba smin 'dod ltar //
translated: when they are ready to be drained or eaten,🔽so in this life, the two sides are considered ripe

original: de bzhin rten 'dir phyogs gnyis zhi ba dang // de bzhin dpyad pa nyid du smin pa bstan //
analyzed: de bzhin rten 'dir phyogs gnyis zhi ba dang // de bzhin dpyad pa nyid du smin pa bstan //
translated: when they are ready to be drained or eaten.

original: 'dis ni yongs su smin pa'i rang bzhin ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni yongs su smin pa'i rang bzhin ston te /
translated: This shows the nature of evolutionary maturity.🔽Just as a wound is considered ripe when it is ready to be drained, and food is considered ripe when it is ready to be eaten,

original: ji ltar ma'i yongs su smin pa brtol ran pa yin pa dang / kha zas kyis yongs @150b su smin pa dpyad du rung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar ma'i yongs su smin pa brtol ran pa yin pa dang / kha zas kyis yongs @150b su smin pa dpyad du rung ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the ripeness of a fruit is the right time to split it open, and the ripeness of food is the right time to eat it,🔽

original: sems can rnams kyi rten rma dang kha zas lta bu la gzags pa lta bu mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhi ba dang dpyad pa lta bu gnyen po'i phyogs dpyad pa dag tu rung ba ni rten yongs su smin pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rten rma dang kha zas lta bu la gzags pa lta bu mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhi ba dang dpyad pa lta bu gnyen po'i phyogs dpyad pa dag tu rung ba ni rten yongs su smin pa ste /
translated: The basis of sentient beings is like a wound or like food, and the bodhisattva is like a caustic or like a probe. The pacification of the side that is adverse to the bodhisattvas aim is like the healing of the wound, and the cultivation of the side that is favorable to the bodhisattvas aim is like the digestion of food.

original: phyogs gnyis ni 'dir mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i phyogs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis ni 'dir mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i phyogs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The two sides are to be understood as the adverse side and the favorable side.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa /
translated: The second verse

original: lus can bral bar smin byed de bzhin du //
analyzed: lus can bral bar smin byed de bzhin du //
translated: is stated to show the analysis of complete maturity.

original: yongs smin rab smin mthun par smin byed gzhan //
analyzed: yongs smin rab smin mthun par smin byed gzhan //
translated: Complete maturity, full maturity, and the rest,🔽are held to be the maturity of separation,🔽the maturity of endowment, the maturity of excellence,

original: legs par smin byed rtogs pa smin byed dang // rtag smin gong du smin bye bshad par 'dod //
analyzed: legs par smin byed rtogs pa smin byed dang // rtag smin gong du smin bye bshad par 'dod //
translated: the maturity of realization, the maturity of constancy, and the maturity of advancement.

original: 'dis ni yongs su smin pa'i rab tu dbye ba ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni yongs su smin pa'i rab tu dbye ba ston te /
translated: This shows the analysis of complete maturity.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral bar smin par byed pa ni bral bar smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral bar smin par byed pa ni bral bar smin par byed pa'o //
translated: The maturity of separation is the maturity of separation from the addictions.

original: thams cad du theg pa gsum gyis smin par byed pa ni yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du theg pa gsum gyis smin par byed pa ni yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
translated: The maturity of endowment is the maturity of endowment with the three vehicles.

original: phyi rol pa'i yongs su smin pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir mchog tu smin par byed pa ni //
analyzed: phyi rol pa'i yongs su smin pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir mchog tu smin par byed pa ni //
translated: It is the development of the faculties, because it develops the faculties.🔽It is the development of the disciples, because it teaches the Dharma to disciples in accordance with their mentalities.🔽It is the development of the path, because it develops the path.

original: rab tu smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu smin par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the development of the faculties, because it develops the faculties.

original: gdul bya ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gdul bya ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston pa'i phyir /
translated: It is the development of the disciples, because it teaches the Dharma to disciples in accordance with their mentalities.🔽It is the development of the path, because it develops the path.

original: 'tsham par smin par byed pa ni mthun par smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsham par smin par byed pa ni mthun par smin par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the development of the faculties, because it develops the faculties.🔽It is the development of the disciples, because it teaches the Dharma to disciples in accordance with their mentalities.🔽It is the development of the path, because it develops the path.

original: gus par smin par byed pa ni legs par smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gus par smin par byed pa ni legs par smin par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the development of the faculties, because it develops the faculties.🔽It is the development of the disciples, because it teaches the Dharma to disciples in accordance with their mentalities.🔽It is the development of the path, because it develops the path.

original: rtogs pas smin par byed pa ni rtogs pa smin par byed pa'o //🔽phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis rtag tu smin par byed pa ni rtag tu smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pas smin par byed pa ni rtogs pa smin par byed pa'o // phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis rtag tu smin par byed pa ni rtag tu smin par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the development of the faculties, because it develops the faculties.🔽It is the development of the disciples, because it teaches the Dharma to disciples in accordance with their mentalities.🔽It is the development of the path, because it develops the path.

original: yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i don gyis gong nas gong du rim gyis smin par byed pa ni gong nas gong du smin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i don gyis gong nas gong du rim gyis smin par byed pa ni gong nas gong du smin par byed pa ste /
translated: It is the development of the faculties, because it develops the faculties.🔽It is the development of the disciples, because it teaches the Dharma to disciples in accordance with their mentalities.🔽It is the development of the path, because it develops the path.🔽It is the development of the faculties, because it develops the faculties.🔽It is the development of the disciples, because it teaches the Dharma to disciples in accordance with their mentalities.🔽It is the development of the path, because it develops the path.

original: de ltar na rnam pa brgyad po'i ni gzhan yongs su smin pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa brgyad po'i ni gzhan yongs su smin pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: It is the development of the faculties, because it develops the faculties.🔽It is the development of the disciples, because it teaches the Dharma to disciples in accordance with their mentalities.🔽It is the development of the path, because it develops the path.🔽It is the development of the faculties, because it develops the faculties.🔽It is the development of the disciples, because it teaches the Dharma to disciples in accordance with their mentalities.🔽It is the development of the path, because it develops the path.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa dang bzhi pa /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa dang bzhi pa /
translated: It is the development of the faculties, because it develops the faculties.

original: ji ltar rgyal sras pha pa'i bsam pas 'dir //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal sras pha pa'i bsam pas 'dir //
translated: As the offspring of the Victorious Conqueror, with the attitude of a parent,

original: 'gro kun rnam par smin byed gnas pas ltar //
analyzed: 'gro kun rnam par smin byed gnas pas ltar //
translated: they remain here, bringing all beings to full maturity.

original: de bzhin pha dang ma dang gnyen ba shes rnams //
analyzed: de bzhin pha dang ma dang gnyen ba shes rnams //
translated: But parents, relatives, and friends

original: bu dang gnyen po rnams la legs mi gnas //🔽ji ltar brtse bdag bde dang phan sbyor phyir //
analyzed: bu dang gnyen po rnams la legs mi gnas // ji ltar brtse bdag bde dang phan sbyor phyir //
translated: do not remain in this way with their children and relatives.🔽Just as the loving one wishes to bring about

original: sems can gzhan la byams 'dod de ltar ni //
analyzed: sems can gzhan la byams 'dod de ltar ni //
translated: the happiness and benefit of other sentient beings,

original: skye bo bdag la byams par mi 'dod na //
analyzed: skye bo bdag la byams par mi 'dod na //
translated: so the one who does not wish to love himself

original: rab sdug skye bo gzhan bstan smos ci dgos //
analyzed: rab sdug skye bo gzhan bstan smos ci dgos //
translated: need not mention teaching other dear beings.

original: 'di gnyis cis ci ston zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gnyis cis ci ston zhe na /
translated: What do these two verses show?

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa ji lta bus sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'i @151a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa ji lta bus sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'i @151a * //
translated: They show the attitude with which the bodhisattvas bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: bsam pa de ston par byed de /
analyzed: bsam pa de ston par byed de /
translated: They show the attitude that is superior to the attitude of parents and relatives,

original: phan pa dang bde ba la yang dag par sbyor pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba la yang dag par sbyor pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is correctly applied to benefit and happiness,

original: pha ma dang gnyen bshes kyi bsam pa las khyad par du 'phags pa dang / 'jig rten bdag la byams pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: pha ma dang gnyen bshes kyi bsam pa las khyad par du 'phags pa dang / 'jig rten bdag la byams pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: and the attitude that is superior to the worldly love of self.

original: 'jig rten bdag la byams pa ni bdag nyid phan pa ma yin pa dang / bde ba ma yin pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten bdag la byams pa ni bdag nyid phan pa ma yin pa dang / bde ba ma yin pa la sbyor ro //
translated: Love for the world is not a benefit or a happiness for oneself.

original: tshigs su bcad pa lhag ma rnams kyis ni sbyor ba gang gis sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa de pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pas yang dag par ston te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa lhag ma rnams kyis ni sbyor ba gang gis sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa de pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pas yang dag par ston te /
translated: The remaining verses show how he brings beings to maturity by practicing the transcendences,

original: sbyin pa ji lta bus sems can rnams ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa ji lta bus sems can rnams ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: beginning with the kind of generosity by which he brings beings to maturity.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang longs spyod dag / gzhan la mi sbyin pa ni yong med de //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang longs spyod dag / gzhan la mi sbyin pa ni yong med de //
translated: The bodhisattva never fails to give away his body and possessions to others.

original: phan 'dogs rnam pa gnyis kyis gzhan smin byed //
analyzed: phan 'dogs rnam pa gnyis kyis gzhan smin byed //
translated: He brings others to maturity by two kinds of assistance.

original: mnyam par sbyin pa'i yon tan ngoms mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mnyam par sbyin pa'i yon tan ngoms mi 'gyur //
translated: He is never satisfied with the excellence of his generosity.

original: sbyin pa rnam pa gsum gyis sems can yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam pa gsum gyis sems can yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: He brings beings to maturity by means of the three kinds of generosity.

original: rang gi lus dang longs spyod thams cad sbyin pa dang / mi mnyam pa med par sbyin pa dang / ngoms pa med par sbyin pas so //
analyzed: rang gi lus dang longs spyod thams cad sbyin pa dang / mi mnyam pa med par sbyin pa dang / ngoms pa med par sbyin pas so //
translated: by giving away all one's bodies and possessions, by giving impartially, and by giving without ever being satisfied.

original: ji ltar yongs su smin par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su smin par byed ce na /
translated: How does he bring them to maturity?

original: tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la phan 'dogs pas te /
analyzed: tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la phan 'dogs pas te /
translated: By benefiting them in this life and the next,

original: phongs pa med par 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir dang / des bsdus nas dge ba la 'god pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phongs pa med par 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir dang / des bsdus nas dge ba la 'god pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for he fulfills their desires without their having to ask, and having attracted them by that, he establishes them in virtue.

original: tshul khrims ji lta bus sems can rnams ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams nas tshigs su bcad pa /🔽bstan pa rang bzhin lhag par 'tshe ba med //🔽bdag dga' bag yod 'di la gzhan 'god cing //
analyzed: tshul khrims ji lta bus sems can rnams ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams nas tshigs su bcad pa / bstan pa rang bzhin lhag par 'tshe ba med // bdag dga' bag yod 'di la gzhan 'god cing //
translated: The fifth chapter, dealing with morality, has three parts:

original: phan rnam gnyis 'dogs rnam par smin pa dang // rgyu mthun yon tan brgyud pas gzhan smin byed //
analyzed: phan rnam gnyis 'dogs rnam par smin pa dang // rgyu mthun yon tan brgyud pas gzhan smin byed //
translated: the analysis of morality, the analysis of its virtues, and the analysis of its rewards.

original: tshul khrims rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The analysis of morality is itself fivefold:🔽natural morality,🔽moral discipline of vows,🔽moral discipline of good conduct,🔽moral discipline of overcoming conflict,🔽and moral discipline of working for the benefit of others.

original: bstan pa'i tshul khrims dang / rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims dang / lhag par 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir 'tshe ba med pa ni lhag par 'tshe ba med pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa'i tshul khrims dang / rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims dang / lhag par 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir 'tshe ba med pa ni lhag par 'tshe ba med pa ste /
translated: The morality of the teaching, the natural morality, and the morality of restraint are complete in the second stage, because of the absence of violence and the perfection of the path of the ten virtues.

original: sa gnyis pa las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: This is as stated in the Stage of Generation.

original: bdag nyid de la dga' ba'i phyir rtogs pa'i tshul khrims dang / bag yod @151b pa'i phyir rtag tu 'khrul pa med pa'i tshul khrims kyis so //
analyzed: bdag nyid de la dga' ba'i phyir rtogs pa'i tshul khrims dang / bag yod @151b pa'i phyir rtag tu 'khrul pa med pa'i tshul khrims kyis so //
translated: The morality of realization is due to delight in that morality, and the morality of non-error is due to constant heedfulness.

original: ji ltar yongs su smin par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su smin par byed ce na /
translated: How does he bring them to maturity?

original: tshul khrims la 'god pas tshe 'di dang phyi ma la phan pa rnam pa gnyis byed pas so //
analyzed: tshul khrims la 'god pas tshe 'di dang phyi ma la phan pa rnam pa gnyis byed pas so //
translated: By the two kinds of benefit in this life and the next, through establishing them in morality.

original: gzhan la tshe phyi ma la phan 'dogs pa ni rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan dag brgyud pas byed de /
analyzed: gzhan la tshe phyi ma la phan 'dogs pa ni rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan dag brgyud pas byed de /
translated: The benefit in the next life for others is through the qualities of evolutionary development and natural outcome.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun ba dag phan tshun mthun pas rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun ba dag phan tshun mthun pas rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their maturation and natural outcome are mutually consistent and uninterrupted.

original: bzod pa ji lta bus sems can rnams ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams nas tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: bzod pa ji lta bus sems can rnams ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams nas tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the bodhisattva's patience in voluntarily accepting suffering

original: gzhan gnod byed la phan byed blo ldan pa //
analyzed: gzhan gnod byed la phan byed blo ldan pa //
translated: The geniuses, in order to help those who harm others,

original: gnod byed drag po dag kyang rab tu bzod //
analyzed: gnod byed drag po dag kyang rab tu bzod //
translated: patiently endure even the most violent harm.

original: thabs rig gnod byed bzod pa de dag gis //
analyzed: thabs rig gnod byed bzod pa de dag gis //
translated: By their patience, which is skillful, they cause even the violent🔽to take up virtue.

original: gnod byed dge ba yang dag len du 'jug / gzhan gnod pa byed pa la phan pa byed pa'i blo dang ldan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gnod byed dge ba yang dag len du 'jug / gzhan gnod pa byed pa la phan pa byed pa'i blo dang ldan pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they have the attitude of helping those who harm others,

original: gnod pa byed pa drag po la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pas yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa drag po la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pas yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: they bring them to maturity by their patience in voluntarily accepting suffering.

original: phan pa byed pa'i blo nyid ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang mthun par 'jug pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phan pa byed pa'i blo nyid ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang mthun par 'jug pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: The attitude of helping should be understood as the practice of the transcendence of patience, because it is consistent with the completion of the transcendence of patience.

original: ji ltar yongs su smin par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su smin par byed ce na /
translated: How does it bring them to maturity?

original: gnod pa byed pa la mi mjed pa'i phyir tshe 'di la phan 'dogs pa dang / thabs shes pa gnod pa byed pa la mi mjed pa de dag gis gnod pa byed pa rnams dang par byas nas dge ba yang dag par len du 'jug pa'i phyir tshe phyi ma la phan 'dogs pas so //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa la mi mjed pa'i phyir tshe 'di la phan 'dogs pa dang / thabs shes pa gnod pa byed pa la mi mjed pa de dag gis gnod pa byed pa rnams dang par byas nas dge ba yang dag par len du 'jug pa'i phyir tshe phyi ma la phan 'dogs pas so //
translated: Because they are not disturbed by those who do harm, they benefit them in this life, and because they are not disturbed by those who do harm, they benefit them in future lives, by means of their knowledge of means, inducing them to take up virtue.

original: brtson 'grus ji lta bus sems can ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ji lta bus sems can ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the kinds of effort and the manner of bringing beings to evolutionary maturity

original: rgyal sras brtson 'grus mchog la brten pa ste //
analyzed: rgyal sras brtson 'grus mchog la brten pa ste //
translated: 1. The victors' spiritual heir, relying on the best effort,

original: sems can tshogs rab smin par byed pa na //🔽pha rol sems dge gcig gis phyir yang ni //
analyzed: sems can tshogs rab smin par byed pa na // pha rol sems dge gcig gis phyir yang ni //
translated: to bring the hosts of beings to full evolutionary maturity,🔽never tires even in a thousand million eons

original: bskal pa bye ba stong du'ang skyo mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba stong du'ang skyo mi 'gyur //
translated: for the sake of a single virtuous thought in another.

original: brtson 'grus chen po yun ring por mi skyo bas te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po yun ring por mi skyo bas te /
translated: With great effort, for a long time, he does not tire.

original: yun ring por mi skyo ba nyid ni gzhan gyi sems dge ba gcig gi phyir yang bskal pa bye ba stong phrag tu mi skyo bas sems can mtha' yas pa yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring por mi skyo ba nyid ni gzhan gyi sems dge ba gcig gi phyir yang bskal pa bye ba stong phrag tu mi skyo bas sems can mtha' yas pa yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is not discouraged for a long time, because he is not discouraged even for a thousand eons in order to make the mind of another wholesome.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar yongs su smin par byed ce na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar yongs su smin par byed ce na /
translated: For what reason does he bring beings to full maturity?

original: sems dge ba la yang dag par sbyor bas tshe 'di dang / tshe phyi ma la phan 'dogs pas so zhes bshad par 'gyur @152a * //
analyzed: sems dge ba la yang dag par sbyor bas tshe 'di dang / tshe phyi ma la phan 'dogs pas so zhes bshad par 'gyur @152a * //
translated: He connects them with wholesome dharmas, and he benefits them in this life and the next.

original: ro ; / bsam gtan ji lta bus sems can rnams ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: ro ; / bsam gtan ji lta bus sems can rnams ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: The verse beginning “Having attained the unexcelled mastery of mind” treats the question of how he brings beings to full maturity through his meditative absorption.

original: yid kyi dbang ni bla na med thob nas //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang ni bla na med thob nas //
translated: Having attained the unexcelled mastery of mind,

original: gzhan gyis mchod 'dod thams cad nges bcom ste //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mchod 'dod thams cad nges bcom ste //
translated: he destroys all desire for the worship of others,

original: mchog gi bstan la gzhan dag 'dun byed cing //
analyzed: mchog gi bstan la gzhan dag 'dun byed cing //
translated: he causes others to aspire to the supreme teaching,

original: de dag dge bas yang dag 'phel bar byed //
analyzed: de dag dge bas yang dag 'phel bar byed //
translated: and he causes them to grow in virtue.

original: bsam gtan gyi dbang bla na med pa thob pa dang / zang zing med pa gzhan gyis mchod par 'dod pa thams cad nges par bcom pas yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dbang bla na med pa thob pa dang / zang zing med pa gzhan gyis mchod par 'dod pa thams cad nges par bcom pas yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: They bring them to full maturity by means of the unexcelled controlling power of meditative concentration and by destroying all desire for the worship of others, which is without substance.

original: gzhan sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la 'dun par byed pa dang / 'dun par byas pa la dge ba'i chos spel ba'i sgo nas yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la 'dun par byed pa dang / 'dun par byas pa la dge ba'i chos spel ba'i sgo nas yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: They bring them to full maturity by means of the teaching of the Buddha, by arousing interest in others, and by increasing their virtuous qualities.

original: shes rab ji lta bus ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: shes rab ji lta bus ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the topic of how they bring beings to maturity by means of their own wisdom

original: de nyid dgongs don tshul las rab nges te //
analyzed: de nyid dgongs don tshul las rab nges te //
translated: They are fully resolved on the meaning of reality as it is taught in the scriptures

original: sems can tha tshom shin tu sel bar byed //
analyzed: sems can tha tshom shin tu sel bar byed //
translated: And they clear away the doubts of all living beings.

original: de phyir rgyal ba'i bstan la de gus pas //
analyzed: de phyir rgyal ba'i bstan la de gus pas //
translated: Therefore, out of respect for the teaching of the Victor,

original: rang gzhan dge ba'i yon tan rnam 'phel byed //
analyzed: rang gzhan dge ba'i yon tan rnam 'phel byed //
translated: They and others increase their virtuous qualities.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de de kho na'i don gyi tshul dang / dgongs pa'i don gyi tshul la shin tu rnam par nges pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de de kho na'i don gyi tshul dang / dgongs pa'i don gyi tshul la shin tu rnam par nges pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva brings them to maturity by means of the wisdom that is very certain about the way things really are and the way things are intended.

original: ji ltar yongs su smin par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su smin par byed ce na /
translated: How does he bring them to maturity?

original: sems can rnams kyi the tshom rnam par sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi the tshom rnam par sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By removing the doubts of sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir de dag bstan pa la gus pas bdag dang gzhan gyis yon tan yang dag par 'phel bar byed pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag bstan pa la gus pas bdag dang gzhan gyis yon tan yang dag par 'phel bar byed pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Therefore, they are devoted to the teaching, and he causes the increase of good qualities in himself and others.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /🔽de ltar byang chub sems dpa' snying rje yis //
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' snying rje yis //
translated: A concluding verse

original: 'gro kun bde 'gror 'gro ba'am dge gsum la //
analyzed: 'gro kun bde 'gror 'gro ba'am dge gsum la //
translated: Thus, by compassion, the bodhisattva causes all beings to go to good rebirths and to the three virtues,

original: rnam pa chung dang mchog dang 'bring dag gis //
analyzed: rnam pa chung dang mchog dang 'bring dag gis //
translated: By means of the lesser, middling, and superior forms of the three virtues,

original: 'jig rten yod dang mnyam par 'jug pas 'dul //
analyzed: 'jig rten yod dang mnyam par 'jug pas 'dul //
translated: He disciplines the world, remaining in the world as long as the world exists.

original: 'dis ni sus 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni sus 'dul ba ste /
translated: This shows who disciplines.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / gang gis 'dul ba ste snying rje dang / gang 'dul ba ste 'gro ba mtha' dag dang / gang du 'dul ba ste bde 'gror 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / gang gis 'dul ba ste snying rje dang / gang 'dul ba ste 'gro ba mtha' dag dang / gang du 'dul ba ste bde 'gror 'gro ba'am /
translated: the bodhisattva, the means of training, which is compassion, those who are trained, which is all transmigrators, the place where they are trained, which is going to a happy realm,

original: theg pa gsum dang / yongs su smin par byed pa'i rnam pa ji lta bu dag dang / dus ji srid pa de dag yongs su bstan pas yongs su smin pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid mdor bstan to //
analyzed: theg pa gsum dang / yongs su smin par byed pa'i rnam pa ji lta bu dag dang / dus ji srid pa de dag yongs su bstan pas yongs su smin pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid mdor bstan to //
translated: the three vehicles, the kinds of complete ripening, and the length of time.

original: de la rnam pa @152b chung du ni mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i'o //
analyzed: de la rnam pa @152b chung du ni mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i'o //
translated: The lesser aspect is that of the bodhisattva who is situated on the stage of action out of faith.

original: mchog ni brgyad pa la sogs pa la gnas pa'i'o //
analyzed: mchog ni brgyad pa la sogs pa la gnas pa'i'o //
translated: The superior aspect is that of the bodhisattva who is situated on the eighth stage and above.

original: 'bring ni bdun pa la gnas pa'i yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bring ni bdun pa la gnas pa'i yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The middling aspect is that of the bodhisattva who is situated on the seventh stage.

original: 'jig rten yod pa ji srid pa de dang mnyam par 'jug pas te /
analyzed: 'jig rten yod pa ji srid pa de dang mnyam par 'jug pas te /
translated: It is said to be for as long as the world exists, because it functions for that length of time.

original: gtan du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: gtan du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: This means forever.

original: / yongs su smin pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: / yongs su smin pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on complete ripening is completed.

original: // / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: // / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on omniscience.

original: gsum pa ni de dag nyid kyi bshad par gyur pa'o //🔽dka' spyod dpag med brgya phrag dang / dpag med dge ba bsags pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i dus dang ni //
analyzed: gsum pa ni de dag nyid kyi bshad par gyur pa'o // dka' spyod dpag med brgya phrag dang / dpag med dge ba bsags pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i dus dang ni //
translated: The third is the explanation of these.

original: dpag med sgrib pa zad pa'i phyir //🔽sgrib pa kun gyi dri med pa //
analyzed: dpag med sgrib pa zad pa'i phyir // sgrib pa kun gyi dri med pa //
translated: Because of the immeasurable hardships, the immeasurable collections of virtue, the immeasurable time, and the immeasurable obscurations that are eliminated,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid 'thob //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid 'thob //
translated: one attains the immaculate knowledge of all things.

original: rin chen snod ni phye ba ltar //
analyzed: rin chen snod ni phye ba ltar //
translated: Like the opening of a jewel casket,

original: sangs rgyas nyid ni yang dag bstan //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ni yang dag bstan //
translated: buddhahood is revealed.

original: ngal ba rgyas rmad byung dka' spyad dge kun bsags //
analyzed: ngal ba rgyas rmad byung dka' spyad dge kun bsags //
translated: Having undergone immeasurable hardships, having gathered all virtues,

original: bskal mchog dus ring 'gro ba'i sgrib kun zad //
analyzed: bskal mchog dus ring 'gro ba'i sgrib kun zad //
translated: having passed through immeasurable time, having eliminated all the obscurations of beings,

original: sar gtogs sgrib pa phra bcom sangs rgyas te //
analyzed: sar gtogs sgrib pa phra bcom sangs rgyas te //
translated: having destroyed the subtle obscurations belonging to the stages, one becomes a buddha,

original: de ni mthu che rin chen snod phye bzhin //
analyzed: de ni mthu che rin chen snod phye bzhin //
translated: like the opening of a casket of jewels.

original: yang dag par 'grub pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / dpe'i sgo nas sangs rgyas nyid bstan to //
analyzed: yang dag par 'grub pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / dpe'i sgo nas sangs rgyas nyid bstan to //
translated: Buddhahood is revealed by way of its attainment, its nature, and a simile.

original: dka' ba spyod pa brgya phrag ji snyed dang / dge ba'i tshogs ji snyed dang / dus ji srid dang / nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa ji tsam spangs pas yang dag par 'grub pa 'di ni yang dag par 'grub pa'o //🔽sgrib pa thams cad kyi dri ma med pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'thob pa ni ngo bo nyid do //🔽rin po che'i snod phye ba ni de'i dpe'o //🔽sangs rgyas nyid de'i gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid mthu dang bcas pa la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dka' ba spyod pa brgya phrag ji snyed dang / dge ba'i tshogs ji snyed dang / dus ji srid dang / nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa ji tsam spangs pas yang dag par 'grub pa 'di ni yang dag par 'grub pa'o // sgrib pa thams cad kyi dri ma med pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'thob pa ni ngo bo nyid do // rin po che'i snod phye ba ni de'i dpe'o // sangs rgyas nyid de'i gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid mthu dang bcas pa la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: The perfect accomplishment is the accomplishment of the knowledge of all things, by means of however many hundreds of difficult practices, however many collections of virtue, for however long a time, and by however much abandonment of addictive and objective obscurations.🔽The attainment of the stainless knowledge of all things, free from all obscurations, is the nature.🔽The analogy is the opening of a precious casket.🔽Two verses on the analysis of the reality of the powers of a buddha.🔽

original: gsum pa ni de dag nyid kyi bshad par gyur pa'o //🔽chos rnams thams cad sangs rgyas nyid //🔽chos ni gang yang yod ma yin //🔽de ni chos dkar rang bzhin yang //🔽de yis de ni brjod ma yin //🔽rin chen chos kyi rgyu mtshan phyir //

analyzed: de ni sprin dang 'dra bar 'dod //
translated: because it is the cause of the flowering of virtue.

original: de bzhin nyid tha dad pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas nyid kyang de rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyang sangs rgyas nyid @153a * //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid tha dad pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas nyid kyang de rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyang sangs rgyas nyid @153a * //
translated: Because suchness is not of a different nature, and because buddhahood is distinguished by the purification of that suchness, all things are buddhahood.

original: yin la chos gang yang kun brtags pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin no //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba rnams de'i ngo bor yongs su gyur pa'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid de ni chos dkar po'i rang bzhin yang yin la /
analyzed: yin la chos gang yang kun brtags pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin no // pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba rnams de'i ngo bor yongs su gyur pa'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid de ni chos dkar po'i rang bzhin yang yin la /
translated: And no thing exists as the reality of an imagined thing.🔽Buddhahood is the nature of virtue, because the virtues such as the transcendences are transformed into its nature.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bor yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bor yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: But the virtues such as the transcendences are not established in the nature of the transcendences.

original: de dag gis de bstan par bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis de bstan par bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are not even taught to be that.

original: 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: This is the characteristic of nonduality.

original: rin po che'i 'byung gnas dang / sprin lta bu nyid ni mthu yin te /
analyzed: rin po che'i 'byung gnas dang / sprin lta bu nyid ni mthu yin te /
translated: The source of jewels and cloud-like are the powers.

original: bstan pa'i chos rin po che rnams de las rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir dang ; gdul bya'i rgyud kyi zhing la dge ba'i lo tog rnams rab tu bskrun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa'i chos rin po che rnams de las rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir dang ; gdul bya'i rgyud kyi zhing la dge ba'i lo tog rnams rab tu bskrun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The source of jewels is the source of the jewels of the Dharma, because the teachings of the Dharma come forth from it.

original: sangs rgyas nyid ni chos kun ldan pa'am yang na chos kun bral ba ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ni chos kun ldan pa'am yang na chos kun bral ba ste //
translated: Buddhahood is endowed with all dharmas or else is free from all dharmas.

original: rin chen chos rab che yangs 'byung phyir rin chen chos kyi 'byung gnas bzhin //🔽skye dgu rnams la legs bshad mi zad chos kyi char chen 'bebs pas na //
analyzed: rin chen chos rab che yangs 'byung phyir rin chen chos kyi 'byung gnas bzhin // skye dgu rnams la legs bshad mi zad chos kyi char chen 'bebs pas na //
translated: It is like a source of jewels, because it is the source of the jewels of the Dharma, which are very great and vast.

original: 'byung po'i lo tog dkar po shin tu che 'phel rgyu phyir sprin dang 'dra //
analyzed: 'byung po'i lo tog dkar po shin tu che 'phel rgyu phyir sprin dang 'dra //
translated: It is like a cloud, because it rains down the great rain of the inexhaustible, well-spoken Dharma upon the world, and because it is the cause for the great increase of the white, worldly crops.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa 'dis ni don de nyid ston te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa 'dis ni don de nyid ston te /
translated: This third verse shows just that meaning.

original: chos rin po che rab tu che zhing yangs pa 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir rin po che'i 'byung gnas bzhin no //
analyzed: chos rin po che rab tu che zhing yangs pa 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir rin po che'i 'byung gnas bzhin no //
translated: It is like a source of jewels, because it is the reason for the appearance of the jewels of the Dharma, which are very great and vast.

original: skye dgu rnams la legs par bshad pa mi zad pa'i chos kyi char chen po 'bebs pas na zhes bya bar 'dir tshig rnam par sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skye dgu rnams la legs par bshad pa mi zad pa'i chos kyi char chen po 'bebs pas na zhes bya bar 'dir tshig rnam par sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Because he sends down the great rain of the inexhaustible well-explained Dharma upon all living beings, this is how the expression should be analyzed here.

original: 'byung po rnams kyi dkar po'i lo tog shin tu chen po 'phel pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir sprin dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'byung po rnams kyi dkar po'i lo tog shin tu chen po 'phel pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir sprin dang 'dra'o //
translated: He is like a cloud because he is the cause for the great increase of the white law of living beings.

original: sangs rgyas de nyid skyabs bla na med pa yin pa la tshigs su bcad pa lnga'o //🔽rtag tu nyon mongs tshogs kun dang // nyes par spyod pa thams cad dang // rga dang 'chi ba dag las kyang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas de nyid skyabs bla na med pa yin pa la tshigs su bcad pa lnga'o // rtag tu nyon mongs tshogs kun dang // nyes par spyod pa thams cad dang // rga dang 'chi ba dag las kyang //
translated: Five verses on the supremacy of the Buddha as a refuge.

original: sangs rgyas nyid ni yongs su skyob //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ni yongs su skyob //
translated: The Buddha is a refuge because he is always the protector from all the hosts of afflictions, from all misdeeds, and from birth, old age, and death.

original: 'dis ni mdor na nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las yongs su skyob pa'i don gyis skyabs nyid yin par ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mdor na nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las yongs su skyob pa'i don gyis skyabs nyid yin par ston to //
translated: In brief, this shows that he is a refuge because he protects from the addictions, from karma, and from birth, which are the addictions of action.

original: 'tshe ba dag ni thams cad dang // ngan song dang ni thabs min dang // 'jig tshogs theg pa dman dag las //
analyzed: 'tshe ba dag ni thams cad dang // ngan song dang ni thabs min dang // 'jig tshogs theg pa dman dag las //
translated: the inferior vehicles, and the mass of ill

original: de phyir skyabs kyi dam pa'o //
analyzed: de phyir skyabs kyi dam pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the highest refuge.

original: gnyis pa 'dis ni 'tshe ba la sogs pa las yongs su skyob pa'i phyir rgya cher bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis pa 'dis ni 'tshe ba la sogs pa las yongs su skyob pa'i phyir rgya cher bstan to //
translated: The second half shows in detail how it is a refuge from all harms and so on.

original: de @153b la 'tshe ba thams cad las yongs su skyob pa nyid ni /🔽sangs rgyas kyi mthus long ba rnams kyis ni mig thob po //🔽'on pa rnams kyis ni rna ba thob po //🔽sems 'khrugs pa rnams kyis ni rang gi sems thob po //
analyzed: de @153b la 'tshe ba thams cad las yongs su skyob pa nyid ni / sangs rgyas kyi mthus long ba rnams kyis ni mig thob po // 'on pa rnams kyis ni rna ba thob po // sems 'khrugs pa rnams kyis ni rang gi sems thob po //
translated: It is a refuge from all harms,

original: nad 'go ba rnams ni zhi bar gyur to //🔽zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nad 'go ba rnams ni zhi bar gyur to // zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: because the blind regain their sight through the power of the Buddha, the deaf their hearing, the insane their reason, the sick are healed, and so on.

original: ngan song las yongs su skyob pa nyid ni sangs rgyas kyi 'od kyis der song ba rnams thar par byas pa'i phyir dang / der mi 'gro ba la 'god pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan song las yongs su skyob pa nyid ni sangs rgyas kyi 'od kyis der song ba rnams thar par byas pa'i phyir dang / der mi 'gro ba la 'god pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a refuge from the miserable realms, because the light of the Buddha liberates those who have gone there and because it causes those who have not gone there not to go there.

original: thabs ma yin pa las yongs su skyob pa nyid ni mu stegs can gyi lta ba las slong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa las yongs su skyob pa nyid ni mu stegs can gyi lta ba las slong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a refuge from what is not the means because it turns one away from the views of the heterodox.

original: 'jig tshogs las yongs su skyob pa nyid ni theg pa gnyis kyis yongs su mya ngan las zlo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs las yongs su skyob pa nyid ni theg pa gnyis kyis yongs su mya ngan las zlo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a refuge from the perishing of the perishable because it delivers one from the two vehicles.

original: theg pa dman pa las yongs su skyob pa nyid ni ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams theg pa chen po la bgrod pa gcig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa dman pa las yongs su skyob pa nyid ni ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams theg pa chen po la bgrod pa gcig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a refuge from the lower vehicle because it makes those of undetermined lineage enter the one vehicle of the Mahayana.

original: sangs rgyas nyid de skyabs ni dpe med mchog tu 'dod//
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid de skyabs ni dpe med mchog tu 'dod//
translated: That very buddhahood is considered the incomparable, supreme refuge.

original: sna tshogs 'jigs 'gyur 'jig tshogs kun dang theg pa dang // ngan song rnam mang sdug bsngal thabs min song ba rnams //
analyzed: sna tshogs 'jigs 'gyur 'jig tshogs kun dang theg pa dang // ngan song rnam mang sdug bsngal thabs min song ba rnams //
translated: It protects from the fear of the manifold perishable, from all vehicles, from the many sufferings of the unfortunate realms, and from the wrong paths.

original: skye dang 'chi dang nyon mongs ngan song kun las srung //
analyzed: skye dang 'chi dang nyon mongs ngan song kun las srung //
translated: It protects from birth, death, and all the defilements and unfortunate realms.

original: gsum pa 'dis ni gang gis na skyabs de nyid dpe med cing mchog nyid kyis bla na med pa yin pa de don de nyid kyis ston to //
analyzed: gsum pa 'dis ni gang gis na skyabs de nyid dpe med cing mchog nyid kyis bla na med pa yin pa de don de nyid kyis ston to //
translated: This third verse shows that this very refuge is incomparable and supreme, and thus unsurpassed, by means of its very purpose.

original: sangs rgyas chos kyis shin tu rdzogs pa'i sku gang yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos kyis shin tu rdzogs pa'i sku gang yin //
translated: The body that is completely fulfilled by the qualities of a Buddha,

original: dam pa'i chos la sems can rab 'dul mkhyen pa gang //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la sems can rab 'dul mkhyen pa gang //
translated: The knowledge of how to train sentient beings in the holy Dharma,

original: 'gro ba kun la thugs rje pha rol phyin pa gang //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun la thugs rje pha rol phyin pa gang //
translated: And the compassion for all beings that has reached perfection,

original: sangs rgyas nyid de 'dir ni skyabs kyi mchog tu 'dod //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid de 'dir ni skyabs kyi mchog tu 'dod //
translated: Buddhahood is considered here as the highest refuge.

original: bzhi pa 'dis ni rgyu gang dag gis skyabs de de ltar bla na med pa yin pa de ston te /
analyzed: bzhi pa 'dis ni rgyu gang dag gis skyabs de de ltar bla na med pa yin pa de ston te /
translated: This fourth verse shows by what causes that refuge is unexcelled.

original: rang gi don gyi mthar thug pa'i dbang du byas nas sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa shin tu rdzogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽gzhan gyi don mthar thug pa'i dbang du byas nas dam pa'i chos la sems can 'dul ba'i thabs mkhyen pa'i phyir dang / thugs rjes pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi don gyi mthar thug pa'i dbang du byas nas sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa shin tu rdzogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro // gzhan gyi don mthar thug pa'i dbang du byas nas dam pa'i chos la sems can 'dul ba'i thabs mkhyen pa'i phyir dang / thugs rjes pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From the point of view of the ultimate goal of one's own aim, it is the essence of the complete fulfillment of the qualities of a Buddha, such as the strengths and fearlessnesses.

original: 'jig rten ji srid sems can gyi //🔽gnod dang phun sum tshogs pa kun //
analyzed: 'jig rten ji srid sems can gyi //🔽gnod dang phun sum tshogs pa kun //
translated: From the point of view of the ultimate goal of others' aims, it is the knowledge of how to train sentient beings in the holy Dharma and the perfection of compassion for all beings.

original: bzlog cing 'byor par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: bzlog cing 'byor par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: bringing about all that is necessary,

original: sangs rgyas skyabs chen nyid du 'dod //🔽tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa 'dis ni dus ji srid @154a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas skyabs chen nyid du 'dod // tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa 'dis ni dus ji srid @154a * //
translated: the Buddha is considered the great refuge.

original: cig tu sems can ji rnyed cig gi gang gi don du skyabs yin pa de mdor bstan to //
analyzed: cig tu sems can ji rnyed cig gi gang gi don du skyabs yin pa de mdor bstan to //
translated: This fifth verse shows how long and for what purpose he is a refuge for what beings.

original: gang gi don du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gi don du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For what purpose?

original: gnod pa thams cad bzlog pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'byor par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa thams cad bzlog pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'byor par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of averting all harm and bringing about all that is necessary.

original: gnas yongs su gyur pa la tshigs su bcad pa drug pa ste /
analyzed: gnas yongs su gyur pa la tshigs su bcad pa drug pa ste /
translated: The sixth verse shows the basis of the refuge,

original: gang la nyon mongs shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon dus ring rtag ldan pa //
analyzed: gang la nyon mongs shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon dus ring rtag ldan pa //
translated: where the seeds of the afflictions and the knowable are always present for a long time,

original: spong ba shin tu rgya che rnam pa kun gyis rab tu bcom gyur zhing //
analyzed: spong ba shin tu rgya che rnam pa kun gyis rab tu bcom gyur zhing //
translated: which are completely destroyed by the vast and manifold means of elimination,

original: gnas gyur chos dkar yon tan mchog rab ldan pa thob pa sangs rgyas nyid //
analyzed: gnas gyur chos dkar yon tan mchog rab ldan pa thob pa sangs rgyas nyid //
translated: and which is the attainment of the transformation of the basis, endowed with the supreme qualities of the pure dharmas, that is, buddhahood.

original: de ni mi rtog rab dag shin tu yul chen ye shes lam gyis 'thob //
analyzed: de ni mi rtog rab dag shin tu yul chen ye shes lam gyis 'thob //
translated: That is attained by the path of wisdom, which is nonconceptual, pure, and has a vast domain.

original: 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sa bon dang bral ba dang / gnyen po phun sum chogs pa dang ldan pas gnas yongs su gyur pa dang / lam rnam pa gnyis thob pas de ji ltar 'thob pa yang bstan te /🔽'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lam thob pa dang / de'i rdzas la /
analyzed: 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sa bon dang bral ba dang / gnyen po phun sum chogs pa dang ldan pas gnas yongs su gyur pa dang / lam rnam pa gnyis thob pas de ji ltar 'thob pa yang bstan te / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lam thob pa dang / de'i rdzas la /
translated: This shows the transformation of the support, which is free from the seeds of the resistant tendencies and endowed with the abundance of the remedies, and it shows how it is attained, through the attainment of the two kinds of path.

original: thob pa shes bya mtha' yas pa'i yul can gyi ye shes kyi lam 'thob pas so //
analyzed: thob pa shes bya mtha' yas pa'i yul can gyi ye shes kyi lam 'thob pas so //
translated: The attainment of the path of extremely pure supramundane gnosis and the attainment of the path of gnosis that has as its object the infinite knowable.

original: dus ring zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas so //
analyzed: dus ring zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas so //
translated: For a long time means from beginningless time.

original: spong ba shin tu rgya che rnam pa kun gyis zhes bya ba ni sa'i rnam pa dag gis so //
analyzed: spong ba shin tu rgya che rnam pa kun gyis zhes bya ba ni sa'i rnam pa dag gis so //
translated: It is the relinquishment that is extremely vast and of every kind means that it is of the kinds of the levels.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de ni der bzhugs nas //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de ni der bzhugs nas //
translated: The Tathāgata, dwelling there,

original: ri dbang mtho steng bzhugs bzhin 'gro la gzigs //
analyzed: ri dbang mtho steng bzhugs bzhin 'gro la gzigs //
translated: looks down on the world, as if he were seated on the peak of the king of mountains.

original: zhi bar mngon dga'i 'gro la'ang thugs rdze na //
analyzed: zhi bar mngon dga'i 'gro la'ang thugs rdze na //
translated: He is saddened by the world, which delights in peace,

original: srid la mngon dga'i skye bo gzhan ci smos //
analyzed: srid la mngon dga'i skye bo gzhan ci smos //
translated: to say nothing of the beings who delight in existence.

original: gnyis pa 'dis ni gnas yongs su gyur pa de gzhan las khyad par du ston te /
analyzed: gnyis pa 'dis ni gnas yongs su gyur pa de gzhan las khyad par du ston te /
translated: The second verse shows the transformation of the basis to be superior to the others.

original: de la gnas pa ni ri'i dbang po mthon po la bzhugs pa bzhin du 'jig rten ches shin tu dman pa la gzigs so //
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni ri'i dbang po mthon po la bzhugs pa bzhin du 'jig rten ches shin tu dman pa la gzigs so //
translated: The bodhisattva, dwelling in it, looks down on the world which is very much lower, as if he were dwelling on a high mountain peak.

original: gzigs nas kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la'ang thugs rje na /
analyzed: gzigs nas kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la'ang thugs rje na /
translated: And having looked down, he has compassion even for the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: de dag las gzhan pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos /🔽gnas la 'jug dang rab 'jug mi 'jug dang // ldog dang kun 'jug gnyis dang gnyis min dang // mnyam dang khyad 'phags kun 'gro bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos / gnas la 'jug dang rab 'jug mi 'jug dang // ldog dang kun 'jug gnyis dang gnyis min dang // mnyam dang khyad 'phags kun 'gro bdag nyid ni //
translated: how much more so for others.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yongs gyur 'dod //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yongs gyur 'dod //
translated: The transformation of the tathāgatas is considered to be the basis, entry, full entry, nonentry, reversal, universal entry, both kinds of entry and nonentry, equality, superiority, and universality.

original: gsum pa 'dis ni de'i phan yon gyi dbye ba ston te /
analyzed: gsum pa 'dis ni de'i phan yon gyi dbye ba ston te /
translated: The third verse shows the varieties of its benefits.

original: gnas la zhes bya ba ni gnas yongs su gyur pa gang yin pa de yang dag par ston to //
analyzed: gnas la zhes bya ba ni gnas yongs su gyur pa gang yin pa de yang dag par ston to //
translated: The phrase “the basis” shows the basis of the transformation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yongs su gyur pa de ni gzhan gyi don du @154b 'jug pas na 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yongs su gyur pa de ni gzhan gyi don du @154b 'jug pas na 'jug pa'o //
translated: That transformation of the Tathagatas is the entrance, because it is engaged for the benefit of others.

original: chos thams cad las khyad zhugs pa'i phyir mchog tu 'jug pa ni rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad las khyad zhugs pa'i phyir mchog tu 'jug pa ni rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the supreme entrance, because it is distinguished from all other Dharmas.

original: kun nas nyan mongs pa'i rgyu la mi 'jug pas mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyan mongs pa'i rgyu la mi 'jug pas mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the non-entrance, because it is not engaged in the cause of affliction.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa las ldog pas zlog pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa las ldog pas zlog pa'o //
translated: It is the reversal, because it is turned away from affliction.

original: gtan du pa yin pa'i phyir kun tu 'jug pa ni kun tu 'jug pa'o ;
analyzed: gtan du pa yin pa'i phyir kun tu 'jug pa ni kun tu 'jug pa'o ;
translated: It is the complete entrance, because it is engaged for all time.

original: / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ston par 'jug pas gnyis su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ston par 'jug pas gnyis su 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the entrance into duality, because it is engaged in the demonstration of full enlightenment and final nirva.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas nyid gnyis su mi 'jug pa ni gnyis ma yin par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas nyid gnyis su mi 'jug pa ni gnyis ma yin par 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the entrance into non-duality, because it is not engaged in the duality of the compounded and the uncompounded, because it does not dwell in samsara or nirvana.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag dang rnam par grol ba 'dra ba nyid kyis mnyam du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag dang rnam par grol ba 'dra ba nyid kyis mnyam du 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is an engagement in equality, because of the equality of liberation with the disciples and the individually enlightened ones.

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyis mi mnyam pa'i phyir khyad par du 'phags par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyis mi mnyam pa'i phyir khyad par du 'phags par 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is an engagement in superiority, because of the superiority of the qualities of the Buddha, such as the powers and the fearlessnesses.

original: theg pa thams cad ston bar 'gro ba'i phyir kun tu 'gro ba'i 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa thams cad ston bar 'gro ba'i phyir kun tu 'gro ba'i 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is an engagement in universality, because it teaches all vehicles.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' rtag tu kun song 'dod //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' rtag tu kun song 'dod //
translated: Just as space is considered omnipresent,

original: de bzhin de yang rtag tu kun song 'dod //
analyzed: de bzhin de yang rtag tu kun song 'dod //
translated: so is that considered omnipresent.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' gzugs gyur kun tu song //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' gzugs gyur kun tu song //
translated: Just as space is considered to pervade all forms,

original: de bzhin de yang sems can tshogs kun song //
analyzed: de bzhin de yang sems can tshogs kun song //
translated: so is that considered to pervade all hosts of beings.
