translated: is obscured by the faults of living beings.

original: ji ltar 'od zer rnams rab tu snang bar bya ba la sprin la sogs pas bsgribs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar 'od zer rnams rab tu snang bar bya ba la sprin la sogs pas bsgribs pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the light of the sun is obscured by clouds, etc.,

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyang sems can rnams snyigs ma lnga shes che ba'i nyes pas snod du ma gyur pa nyid kyis bsgribs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyang sems can rnams snyigs ma lnga shes che ba'i nyes pas snod du ma gyur pa nyid kyis bsgribs so //
translated: so the intuition of the Buddha is obscured by the faults of living beings, who are not receptive because of the predominance of the five degenerations.

original: ji ltar mdud pa'i dbang gis na //
analyzed: ji ltar mdud pa'i dbang gis na //
translated: Just as a cloth is soiled by grease🔽and is not soiled by other things,🔽so the intuition of the Buddha is obscured🔽by the faults of living beings, not by other things.🔽Just as a cloth is soiled by grease and not by other things, so the intuition of the Buddha is obscured by the faults of living beings, not by other things.🔽Just as the color of a cloth

original: @156b gos la tshon bkra mi bkra ba //🔽de bzhin 'phen pa'i dbang gis na //
analyzed: @156b gos la tshon bkra mi bkra ba // de bzhin 'phen pa'i dbang gis na //
translated: is affected by the color of the dye,🔽so the intuition of the Buddha

original: grol ba'i ye shes bkra mi bkra //
analyzed: grol ba'i ye shes bkra mi bkra //
translated: is affected by the color of living beings.

original: ji ltar mdud pa'i khyad par gyis gos la kha cig tu ni tshon khra bo nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar mdud pa'i khyad par gyis gos la kha cig tu ni tshon khra bo nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: Just as the difference in knots in a piece of cloth makes the color different in different places,

original: kha cig tu ni khra bo'i de bzhin du ston gyi smon lam gyi spyod pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i khyad par las sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ni bkra ba nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni khra bo'i de bzhin du ston gyi smon lam gyi spyod pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i khyad par las sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ni bkra ba nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: so the difference in the power of the bodhisattvas’ prayers and conduct makes the gnosis of liberation of the buddhas colorful,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ni khra bo nyid du mi 'gyur ro //🔽dri med dbyings la sangs rgyas kyi //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ni khra bo nyid du mi 'gyur ro // dri med dbyings la sangs rgyas kyi //
translated: but the gnosis of liberation of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas is not colorful.🔽The profound character,🔽abode, and activity of the buddhas🔽in the uncontaminated expanse

original: mtshan nyid dang ni gnas pa dang // phrin las zab pa 'di bshad pa //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni gnas pa dang // phrin las zab pa 'di bshad pa //
translated: are explained.

original: mkha' la tshon gyis ri mo 'dri //
analyzed: mkha' la tshon gyis ri mo 'dri //
translated: It is like painting a picture in the sky.

original: dri med pa'i dbyings la sangs rgyas rnams kyi zab pa rnam pa 'di gsum bshad do //
analyzed: dri med pa'i dbyings la sangs rgyas rnams kyi zab pa rnam pa 'di gsum bshad do //
translated: The three kinds of profundity of the buddhas in the uncontaminated expanse are explained.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bzhis ni mtshan nyid zab pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bzhis ni mtshan nyid zab pa'o //
translated: The four verses explain the profundity of their character.

original: lnga pas ni gnas pa zab ste /
analyzed: lnga pas ni gnas pa zab ste /
translated: The fifth explains the profundity of their abode.

original: gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid du mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid du mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not abide in either sameness or difference.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni phrin las zab pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni phrin las zab pa'o //
translated: The remaining verses explain the profundity of activity.

original: mtshan nyid zab pa de yang rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bdag mchog gi mtshan nyid dang / lung ma bstan pa'i dngos pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid las brtsams te bshad do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid zab pa de yang rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bdag mchog gi mtshan nyid dang / lung ma bstan pa'i dngos pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid las brtsams te bshad do //
translated: The profundity of characteristic is explained in terms of the characteristic of purification, the characteristic of the supremacy of self, the characteristic of the indeterminate thing, and the characteristic of liberation.

original: phrin las zab pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa rin po che'i gnas nyid kyi phyin las dang / sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i phrin las dang / mthar thug par gshegs pa'i phrin las dang / chos ston pa'i phrin las dang /
analyzed: phrin las zab pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa rin po che'i gnas nyid kyi phyin las dang / sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i phrin las dang / mthar thug par gshegs pa'i phrin las dang / chos ston pa'i phrin las dang /
translated: The profundity of activity is the activity of being the source of jewels such as the factors of enlightenment, the activity of bringing sentient beings to full maturity, the activity of proceeding to the ultimate, the activity of teaching the Dharma, and the activity of the great enlightenment.

original: sbrul pa la sogs pa mdzad pa'i phyir las dang / ye shes 'jug pa'i phrin las dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i phrin las dang / ye shes rnam par sna tshogs pa'i phrin las dang / ye shes mi 'jug pa'i phrin las dang / rnam par grol bar 'dra ba las ye shes khyad par du 'phags pa'i phrin las las brtsams te bshad do //
analyzed: sbrul pa la sogs pa mdzad pa'i phyir las dang / ye shes 'jug pa'i phrin las dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i phrin las dang / ye shes rnam par sna tshogs pa'i phrin las dang / ye shes mi 'jug pa'i phrin las dang / rnam par grol bar 'dra ba las ye shes khyad par du 'phags pa'i phrin las las brtsams te bshad do //
translated: The activity of the buddhas is explained in terms of the activity of the body, the activity of the speech, the activity of the mind, the activity of transformation, and so on, the activity of the engagement of intuition, the activity of nonconceptuality, the activity of the various intuitions, the activity of the nonengagement of intuition, and the activity of the superiority of intuition over the similarity of liberation.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings de spros pa med pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la zab mo'i rab tu dbye ba ston pa de ni dper na nam mkha' la tshon gyis 'dri ba dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings de spros pa med pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la zab mo'i rab tu dbye ba ston pa de ni dper na nam mkha' la tshon gyis 'dri ba dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: That teaching of the divisions of the profound in the uncontaminated realm, which is like space, is to be understood as being like the painting of colors in space.

original: de bzhin nyid ni thams cad la //🔽khyad par med kyang dag gyur pa //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni thams cad la // khyad par med kyang dag gyur pa //
translated: Suchness is not differentiated in all things,

original: de bzhin gshegs nyid de yi phyir //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs nyid de yi phyir //
translated: but when purified, it is the tathiigatagarbha.

original: 'gro kun de yi snying po can //
analyzed: 'gro kun de yi snying po can //
translated: Therefore, all beings have its essence.

original: de bzhin nyid ni thams cad la khyad par med la /🔽de bzhin @157a * //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni thams cad la khyad par med la /🔽de bzhin @157a * //
translated: Suchness is not differentiated in all things.

original: gshegs pa yang de rnams par dag pa'i nyid yin te /
analyzed: gshegs pa yang de rnams par dag pa'i nyid yin te /
translated: and the Tathāgata is the purity of those.🔽Therefore, all sentient beings are said to have the essence of the Tathāgata.

original: de'i phyir sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can zhes bya ba 'byor pa rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can zhes bya ba 'byor pa rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig go //
translated: There are eleven verses on the analysis of mastery.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi 'byor bas ni //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi 'byor bas ni //
translated: 1. The mastery of the Disciples

original: 'jig rten pa yi zil gyis gnon //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi zil gyis gnon //
translated: surpasses that of the worldly.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis pa yis //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis pa yis //
translated: 2. The mastery of the Solitary Buddhas

original: nyan thos kyi yang zil gyis gnon //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi yang zil gyis gnon //
translated: surpasses that of the Disciples.🔽3. That does not equal a hundredth

original: de yis byang chub sems dpa' yi //
analyzed: de yis byang chub sems dpa' yi //
translated: part of the mastery of the Bodhisattvas.

original: 'byor ba'i char yang mi phod do //
analyzed: 'byor ba'i char yang mi phod do //
translated: 4. That does not equal a hundredth part

original: de yis de bzhin gshegs pa yi //🔽'byor pa'i char yang mi phod do //
analyzed: de yis de bzhin gshegs pa yi // 'byor pa'i char yang mi phod do //
translated: of the mastery of the Tathāgatas.

original: 'di gnyis kyis ni mthu phul du byung ba'i khyad par gyis sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'byor pa nyid ston to //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyis ni mthu phul du byung ba'i khyad par gyis sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'byor pa nyid ston to //
translated: These two verses show the mastery of the Buddhas by the special excellence of their power.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'byor pa ni //🔽gang gi gang du ji ltar dang // ji tsam dus gang 'jug pa ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'byor pa ni // gang gi gang du ji ltar dang // ji tsam dus gang 'jug pa ni //
translated: 5. The mastery of the Buddhas🔽is considered inconceivable and immeasurable🔽in terms of what, where, how, and to what extent,

original: bsam yas dpag tu med par 'dod //
analyzed: bsam yas dpag tu med par 'dod //
translated: and for how long it will last.

original: gsum pa 'dis rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / zab pa'i khyad par dag gis ston to //
analyzed: gsum pa 'dis rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / zab pa'i khyad par dag gis ston to //
translated: The third shows the variety of aspects and the excellence of profundity.

original: ji ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin //
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin //
translated: How is it inconceivable?

original: ji ltar tshad med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar tshad med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it immeasurable?

original: smras pa / de gang zag gang gi don dang / 'jig rten gyi rnams gang du dang / ji ltar te ci 'dra ba dag gis dang / mang nyung ci tsam pa dang / dus gang gis 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / de gang zag gang gi don dang / 'jig rten gyi rnams gang du dang / ji ltar te ci 'dra ba dag gis dang / mang nyung ci tsam pa dang / dus gang gis 'jug pa yin no //
translated: It is engaged for the sake of a certain person, in a certain world, by a certain kind of engagement, in a certain quantity, and in a certain time.

original: tshigs su bcad pa lhag ma rnams kyis ni gzhan du gyur pa'i khyad par gyis 'byor ba'i dbye ba ston to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa lhag ma rnams kyis ni gzhan du gyur pa'i khyad par gyis 'byor ba'i dbye ba ston to //
translated: The remaining verses show the varieties of mastery by the excellence of transformation.

original: dbang po lnga rnams gzhan gyur na /
analyzed: dbang po lnga rnams gzhan gyur na /
translated: When the five faculties are transformed,

original: don kun 'jug dang thams cad kyi //
analyzed: don kun 'jug dang thams cad kyi //
translated: there is engagement with all objects,🔽and the attainment of the highest mastery

original: yon tan brgya phra bcu gnyis 'byung //🔽'byor ba dam pa'i 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: yon tan brgya phra bcu gnyis 'byung // 'byor ba dam pa'i 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: in the twelve hundred qualities.

original: dbang po lnga gzhan du gyur na //
analyzed: dbang po lnga gzhan du gyur na //
translated: When the five faculties are transformed,

original: dbang po lnga po thams cad don lnga po thams la 'jug pa'i 'byor ba dam pa dang / de la yang so sor yon tan brgya phrag bcu gnyis 'byung ba la 'byor pa dam pa rnams la gnyis 'thob bo //
analyzed: dbang po lnga po thams cad don lnga po thams la 'jug pa'i 'byor ba dam pa dang / de la yang so sor yon tan brgya phrag bcu gnyis 'byung ba la 'byor pa dam pa rnams la gnyis 'thob bo //
translated: The supreme mastery of the five faculties is the mastery of all five faculties in all five objects, and the supreme mastery of the twelve hundred qualities that arise in each of those objects.

original: yid ni gzhan du gyur pa na //🔽'byor dang mthun spyod mi rtog pa'i //
analyzed: yid ni gzhan du gyur pa na // 'byor dang mthun spyod mi rtog pa'i //
translated: When the mental faculty is transformed,🔽mastery of the nondiscriminatory

original: ye shes shin tu dri med la //
analyzed: ye shes shin tu dri med la //
translated: pristine wisdom that acts in accord with mastery

original: 'byor ba dam pa 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'byor ba dam pa 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: is attained, and it is utterly stainless.

original: yid gzhan du gyur na 'byor pa dang mthun par spyod pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa la 'byor pa'i mchog rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid gzhan du gyur na 'byor pa dang mthun par spyod pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa la 'byor pa'i mchog rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: When the mental faculty is transformed, one attains the supreme mastery of the nondiscriminatory pristine wisdom that acts in accord with mastery and is utterly pure.

original: de dang lhan cig 'byor pa'i ye shes thams cad 'jug go //🔽don bcas 'dzin pa gzhan gyur na //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'byor pa'i ye shes thams cad 'jug go // don bcas 'dzin pa gzhan gyur na //
translated: All the masteries of pristine wisdom operate together with that.🔽When the apprehension of objects and their possessor is transformed,

original: ji ltar 'dod bzhin longs spyod dag / bstan phyir zhing /🔽@157b ni dag pa la //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod bzhin longs spyod dag / bstan phyir zhing / @157b ni dag pa la //
translated: the supreme mastery of displaying🔽pure buddhafields as one wishes

original: 'byor pa dam pa 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'byor pa dam pa 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: is attained.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa dang / 'dzin pa gzhan du gyur pa na zhing rnam par dag pa la 'byor ba'i mchog 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa dang / 'dzin pa gzhan du gyur pa na zhing rnam par dag pa la 'byor ba'i mchog 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: When the object has been transformed and the apprehending subject has been transformed, one attains the highest mastery over the pure fields.

original: des ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du longs spyod kun du ston par byed do //
analyzed: des ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du longs spyod kun du ston par byed do //
translated: By that, one displays enjoyments as one wishes.

original: rnam rtog gzhan du gyur na ni //🔽dus rnams rtag tu ye shes dang // las rnams kun la thogs med la //
analyzed: rnam rtog gzhan du gyur na ni // dus rnams rtag tu ye shes dang // las rnams kun la thogs med la //
translated: When discursive thought has been transformed,

original: 'byor pa dam pa 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'byor pa dam pa 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: one attains the highest mastery🔽over all times and all actions.

original: rnam par rtog pa gzhan du gyur na ye shes dang phrin las thams cad la dus thams cad du thogs pa med pa la 'byor ba'i mchog 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gzhan du gyur na ye shes dang phrin las thams cad la dus thams cad du thogs pa med pa la 'byor ba'i mchog 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When discursive thought has been transformed, one attains the highest mastery over all times and all actions.

original: rten ni gzhan du gyur pa na //
analyzed: rten ni gzhan du gyur pa na //
translated: When the basis has been transformed,🔽one attains the highest mastery

original: sangs rgyas dri med gnas la ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dri med gnas la ni //
translated: over the Buddha’s immaculate states,

original: mi gnas myu ngan 'das pa yi //🔽'byor ba'i dam pa 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: mi gnas myu ngan 'das pa yi //🔽'byor ba'i dam pa 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: over nonabiding nirvana.

original: rten gzhan du gyur na sangs rgyas rnams kyi gzag pa med pa'i dbyings su mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i la 'byor pa dam pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten gzhan du gyur na sangs rgyas rnams kyi gzag pa med pa'i dbyings su mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i la 'byor pa dam pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the basis is transformed, one attains the highest mastery in the uncontaminated realm of the Buddhas, in the nirvana that is not a resting place.

original: 'khrig pa gzhan du gyur na ni //
analyzed: 'khrig pa gzhan du gyur na ni //
translated: When sexual intercourse is transformed,🔽one attains the highest mastery🔽in the bliss of the Buddhas

original: sangs rgyas bde bar gnas pa dang // mo mthong nyon mongs med pa la //🔽'byor ba dam pa 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bde bar gnas pa dang // mo mthong nyon mongs med pa la // 'byor ba dam pa 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: and in not being defiled by seeing a woman.

original: 'khrig pa gzhan du gyur na sangs rgyas kyi bde bar gnas pa dang // bud med mthong nyon mongs pa med pa dang gnyis la 'byor pa dam pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrig pa gzhan du gyur na sangs rgyas kyi bde bar gnas pa dang // bud med mthong nyon mongs pa med pa dang gnyis la 'byor pa dam pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When sexual intercourse is transformed, one attains the highest mastery in the bliss of the Buddhas and in not being defiled by seeing a woman.

original: rnam mkha'i 'du shes gzhan gyur na //🔽bsams pa'i don ni 'byor pa dang // 'gro gzugs rnam par 'byed pa la //
analyzed: rnam mkha'i 'du shes gzhan gyur na // bsams pa'i don ni 'byor pa dang // 'gro gzugs rnam par 'byed pa la //
translated: When the notion of space is transformed,

original: 'byor ba dam pa 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'byor ba dam pa 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: one attains the highest mastery🔽in the fulfillment of wishes

original: nam mkha'i 'du shes rnam par gyur na gnyis kho na la ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i 'du shes rnam par gyur na gnyis kho na la ste /
translated: and in the analysis of movement and form.🔽When the notion of space is transformed, one attains the highest mastery in the fulfillment of wishes and in the analysis of movement and form.

original: gang gis na nam mkha'i mdzod du 'gyur ba bsams pa'i don 'byor ba dang / ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro ba'i phyir dang / nam mkha' byed pa'i phyir 'gro ba dang / gzugs rnam par byed pa la 'byor pa'i mchog 'thob par 'gyur ro //🔽de ltar sangs rgyas dri me dpa'i //
analyzed: gang gis na nam mkha'i mdzod du 'gyur ba bsams pa'i don 'byor ba dang / ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro ba'i phyir dang / nam mkha' byed pa'i phyir 'gro ba dang / gzugs rnam par byed pa la 'byor pa'i mchog 'thob par 'gyur ro // de ltar sangs rgyas dri me dpa'i //
translated: One becomes a sky treasure because one's intended goal is fulfilled, because one goes as one wishes, and because one acts in the sky.

original: gnas na gzhan du gyur dpag med pas //
analyzed: gnas na gzhan du gyur dpag med pas //
translated: Thus, in the abode of the Buddha, the immaculate🔽womb of the buddhas, the immeasurable transformation

original: bsams yas bya ba sgrub pa yi //
analyzed: bsams yas bya ba sgrub pa yi //
translated: of the inconceivable action of the buddhas

original: 'byor pa dpag tu med par 'dod ;
analyzed: 'byor pa dpag tu med par 'dod ;
translated: is considered to be the immeasurable power of mastery.

original: / de ltar sgo 'dis na sangs rgyas rnams kyi zag pa med pa'i dbyings ni gzhan du gyur pa yang dag dpag tu med la /
analyzed: / de ltar sgo 'dis na sangs rgyas rnams kyi zag pa med pa'i dbyings ni gzhan du gyur pa yang dag dpag tu med la /
translated: Thus, in this way, the immaculate realm of the buddhas is the transformation of the immeasurable womb of the buddhas.

original: de la yang phrin las bsam gyis mi khyab pa sgrub pa'i 'byor ba dpag tu med par rig par bya'o //🔽sangs rgyas kyi nyid kyis sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i rgyu @158a * //
analyzed: de la yang phrin las bsam gyis mi khyab pa sgrub pa'i 'byor ba dpag tu med par rig par bya'o // sangs rgyas kyi nyid kyis sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i rgyu @158a * //
translated: And in that realm, the power of mastery of the inconceivable action is considered to be immeasurable.

original: la tshigs su bcad pa bdun no //
analyzed: la tshigs su bcad pa bdun no //
translated: Seven verses on the cause of the buddhas' evolutionary development of living beings.

original: 'di na 'jig rten phyogs phyogs rgyal ba'i legs bshad pas //🔽dge ba 'phel pa'i 'jig rten rnam dag mchog tu 'gro //
analyzed: 'di na 'jig rten phyogs phyogs rgyal ba'i legs bshad pas // dge ba 'phel pa'i 'jig rten rnam dag mchog tu 'gro //
translated: In this world, in every direction, through the good explanations of the victors,🔽the world that increases virtue goes to the highest purity.

original: dge ba ma bsags dge ba 'phel bar mchog tu 'gro //
analyzed: dge ba ma bsags dge ba 'phel bar mchog tu 'gro //
translated: The world that does not accumulate virtue goes to the highest increase of virtue.

original: de ltar ma smin pa rtag 'gro ma lus min //
analyzed: de ltar ma smin pa rtag 'gro ma lus min //
translated: Thus, the world that is not ripened always goes to the highest, but it is not exhausted.

original: 'dis ni yongs su smin par mdzad pa ci 'dra ba'i rgyu gyur pa de ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni yongs su smin par mdzad pa ci 'dra ba'i rgyu gyur pa de ston te /
translated: This shows what kind of cause the buddhas are for bringing beings to full maturity.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnams ni rnam par grol ba mchog tu'o //🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa rnam ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags par ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnams ni rnam par grol ba mchog tu'o // dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa rnam ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags par ro //
translated: Those who have accumulated roots of virtue go to the highest liberation.🔽Those who have not accumulated roots of virtue go to the highest accumulation of roots of virtue.

original: ma smin pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba'i mchog tu 'gro bas smin par 'gro'o //
analyzed: ma smin pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba'i mchog tu 'gro bas smin par 'gro'o //
translated: Those who are not ripened go to the highest ripening by increasing their roots of virtue.

original: smin pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mchog tu 'gro'o //
analyzed: smin pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mchog tu 'gro'o //
translated: Those who are ripened go to the highest complete purification.

original: de ltar dus rtag tu 'gro yang 'jig rten mtha' yas pa'i phyir ma lus par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dus rtag tu 'gro yang 'jig rten mtha' yas pa'i phyir ma lus par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even though they always go in this way, they are not exhausted because the world is infinite.

original: de ltar 'jig rten phyogs phyogs brtan rnams rtag par dus kun du //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten phyogs phyogs brtan rnams rtag par dus kun du //
translated: Thus, the steadfast ones in all the world always and forever

original: byang chub chen po thob dka' yon tan mchog ldan rmad byung can //
analyzed: byang chub chen po thob dka' yon tan mchog ldan rmad byung can //
translated: attain the great enlightenment, which is difficult to attain, endowed with the highest qualities, and marvelous.

original: rtag brtan skyabs med rnams kyi skyabs gang yin pa thob pa de //
analyzed: rtag brtan skyabs med rnams kyi skyabs gang yin pa thob pa de //
translated: They attain the state of being a permanent, stable, and firm refuge for those who have no refuge.

original: ya mtshan che la tshul bzang spyad phyir ya mtshan che ba'ang med //
analyzed: ya mtshan che la tshul bzang spyad phyir ya mtshan che ba'ang med //
translated: This is marvelous, but it is not marvelous because they have practiced well.

original: 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su smin pa rnams kyi yongs su smin pa la ya mtshan che ba dang / ya mtshan che ba med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su smin pa rnams kyi yongs su smin pa la ya mtshan che ba dang / ya mtshan che ba med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: This shows the characteristics of the marvel and the nonmarvel for the fully matured bodhisattvas.

original: rtag par dus kun tu zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: rtag par dus kun tu zhes bya ba ni //
translated: Always and forever means

original: rtag tu dang rgyun mi 'chad par ro //
analyzed: rtag tu dang rgyun mi 'chad par ro //
translated: always and uninterruptedly.

original: tshul bzang spyad pa ni de dang mthun pa'i las spyad pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzang spyad pa ni de dang mthun pa'i las spyad pa'o //
translated: Practicing well means practicing the actions that are in accord with that.

original: de ni car la lar sgo mang brgya nas chos kyi 'khor lo dang // la lar skye ba mi snang la lar skye bo'i spyod pa sna tshogs dang // la lar byang chub thams cad la lar de ni mya ngan 'das ston kyang //
analyzed: de ni car la lar sgo mang brgya nas chos kyi 'khor lo dang // la lar skye ba mi snang la lar skye bo'i spyod pa sna tshogs dang // la lar byang chub thams cad la lar de ni mya ngan 'das ston kyang //
translated: In some places he turns the wheel of the Dharma through many hundreds of doors, in some places he does not appear to be born, in some places he displays various human activities, in some places he displays all the perfections, and in some places he displays nirvana.

original: de ni gnas de las kyang rnam par g-yo mi mnga' la thams cad mdzad //
analyzed: de ni gnas de las kyang rnam par g-yo mi mnga' la thams cad mdzad //
translated: But he does not move from that place and he does everything.

original: gsum pa 'dis ni cig car sgo mang po nas yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i thabs la sbyor ba'i rgyu ston te /
analyzed: gsum pa 'dis ni cig car sgo mang po nas yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i thabs la sbyor ba'i rgyu ston te /
translated: This third verse shows the cause of application to the means of bringing about complete maturation through many doors simultaneously.

original: ji ltar gang la gnas te sems can rnams 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gang la gnas te sems can rnams 'dul ba'o //
translated: How? By abiding in that place, he disciplines sentient beings.

original: skyer bo'i spyod pa sna tshogs ni skyes pa'i rabs kyi khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: skyer bo'i spyod pa sna tshogs ni skyes pa'i rabs kyi khyad par gyis so //
translated: Various human activities are shown by the particular Jataka tales.

original: gnas de las kyang mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings las so //
analyzed: gnas de las kyang mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings las so //
translated: He does not move from that place means he does not move from the uncontaminated realm.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'di snyam las can 'di ni bdag gis smin byas she'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'di snyam las can 'di ni bdag gis smin byas she'am /
translated: The buddhas do not think, I have matured this being with such and such potential.

original: 'di ni rab tu smin @158b bya gzhan yang da ltar smin par byed snyam du //
analyzed: 'di ni rab tu smin @158b bya gzhan yang da ltar smin par byed snyam du //
translated: He is bringing others to full maturity now and will do so in the future.

original: 'du mdzad mi mnga' bar yang phyogs phyogs kun tu rtag par sgo gsum nas //
analyzed: 'du mdzad mi mnga' bar yang phyogs phyogs kun tu rtag par sgo gsum nas //
translated: Without any deliberate effort, he is constantly and always bringing beings to full maturity in all realms in the ten directions, by means of the three vehicles.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis ni skye bo rab tu smin par 'gyur ba nyid //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis ni skye bo rab tu smin par 'gyur ba nyid //
translated: This is how beings are brought to full maturity by means of the virtuous practices.

original: bzhi pa 'dis ni da yongs su smin par sbyar ba'i rgyu mngon par 'du mdzad ma mi mnga' bar ston te /
analyzed: bzhi pa 'dis ni da yongs su smin par sbyar ba'i rgyu mngon par 'du mdzad ma mi mnga' bar ston te /
translated: The fourth shows that, without any deliberate effort, he is the cause for their present full maturity.

original: sgo gsum nas zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum gyis so //
analyzed: sgo gsum nas zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum gyis so //
translated: By means of the three vehicles refers to the three vehicles.

original: ji ltar nyi ma 'bad med phyogs phyogs kun tu 'od zer dag / rab 'byam gsal ba mang por lo tog rnam smin byed pa ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma 'bad med phyogs phyogs kun tu 'od zer dag / rab 'byam gsal ba mang por lo tog rnam smin byed pa ltar //
translated: Just as the sun, without any deliberate effort, brings to maturity the many different kinds of crops in all directions with its many bright rays spreading everywhere,

original: de bzhin chos lang nyi ma 'ang rab zhi byed pa chos kyi 'od //
analyzed: de bzhin chos lang nyi ma 'ang rab zhi byed pa chos kyi 'od //
translated: in the same way, the sun of Dharma, with its rays of Dharma,

original: rab 'byam dag gis phyogs phyogs kun tu sems can rnam smin mdzad //
analyzed: rab 'byam dag gis phyogs phyogs kun tu sems can rnam smin mdzad //
translated: brings to maturity beings everywhere with its many bright rays spreading everywhere.

original: lnga pa 'dis ni mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' bar yongs su min par mdzad pa'i dpe ston to //
analyzed: lnga pa 'dis ni mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' bar yongs su min par mdzad pa'i dpe ston to //
translated: This fifth shows the example of the non-performance of action in the performance of the action of complete purification.

original: ji ltar mar me gcig las mar me'i tshogs rab mang //
analyzed: ji ltar mar me gcig las mar me'i tshogs rab mang //
translated: Just as from one lamp,

original: dpag med grangs med 'byung yang de la zad pa med //🔽de bzhin smin pa gcig las smin pa'i tshogs rab mang ;
analyzed: dpag med grangs med 'byung yang de la zad pa med // de bzhin smin pa gcig las smin pa'i tshogs rab mang ;
translated: an immeasurable, incalculable mass of flame is produced, yet it does not go out,

original: / grangs med dpag med 'byung yang de la zad pa med //
analyzed: / grangs med dpag med 'byung yang de la zad pa med //
translated: so from one ripened fruit, an immeasurable, incalculable mass of ripened fruit is produced, yet it is not exhausted.

original: drug pa 'dis ni gcig nas gcig tu yongs su smin par mdzad bstan to //
analyzed: drug pa 'dis ni gcig nas gcig tu yongs su smin par mdzad bstan to //
translated: This sixth shows the ripening of one after another.

original: ji ltar rgya mtsho chen po 'di na chu yis ngoms par mi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: ji ltar rgya mtsho chen po 'di na chu yis ngoms par mi 'gyur zhing //
translated: Just as this great ocean is not satisfied with the waters that flow into it,

original: chu chen mang po rab tu 'babs pas 'phel par yang ni mi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: chu chen mang po rab tu 'babs pas 'phel par yang ni mi 'gyur ba //
translated: and just as it is not increased by the inflow of those many great waters,

original: de bzhin sangs rgyas khams kyang dag pa 'jug pa rtag rgyun mi 'chad pas //
analyzed: de bzhin sangs rgyas khams kyang dag pa 'jug pa rtag rgyun mi 'chad pas //
translated: so the Buddha-element is not diminished by the purification of the Buddha-fields,🔽and it is not increased by the inflow of those many purified beings.

original: ngoms pa mi mnga' 'phel par mi 'gyur de 'dir rmad du 'byung ba'i mchog / bdun pa'i 'dis ni yongs su min pa rnams kyi rnam par grol ba 'jug pa la rgya mtsho dper brjod pas chos kyi dbyings la go skabs yod pa'i phyir ngoms pa yang ma
analyzed: ngoms pa mi mnga' 'phel par mi 'gyur de 'dir rmad du 'byung ba'i mchog / bdun pa'i 'dis ni yongs su min pa rnams kyi rnam par grol ba 'jug pa la rgya mtsho dper brjod pas chos kyi dbyings la go skabs yod pa'i phyir ngoms pa yang ma
translated: The inexhaustible and the nonincreasing are the supreme wonder here.

original: mnga' la / lhag pa med pa'i phyir 'phel pa yang mi mnga' bar ston to //
analyzed: mnga' la / lhag pa med pa'i phyir 'phel pa yang mi mnga' bar ston to //
translated: This seventh verse shows that the realm of Dharma is not exhausted, because there is room in the ultimate realm for the entry of the liberation of all beings, and it shows that it does not increase, because there is no remainder.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la tshigs su bcad pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la tshigs su bcad pa bzhi'o //
translated: Four verses on the purification of the ultimate realm

original: chos rnams kun gyi de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: chos rnams kun gyi de bzhin nyid //
translated: The reality of all things

original: sgrib gnyis dag pa'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: sgrib gnyis dag pa'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: is the characteristic of the purification of the two obscurations.

original: dngos po shes pa de la dmigs //
analyzed: dngos po shes pa de la dmigs //
translated: The thing is the intuition of that, and its aim is

original: dang nga zad mi shes mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dang nga zad mi shes mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of inexhaustibility.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni ngo bo nyid kyi don las brtsams pa yin te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni ngo bo nyid kyi don las brtsams pa yin te /
translated: This verse is concerned with the reality of the ultimate realm.

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid nyon mongs pa dang // shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / dngos po dang de la dmigs pa shes pa dag la dbang zad mi shes pa'i @159a * //🔽mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid nyon mongs pa dang // shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / dngos po dang de la dmigs pa shes pa dag la dbang zad mi shes pa'i @159a * // mtshan nyid do //
translated: The reality of all things is characterized by the purification of the two obstructions, the afflictive and the objective.

original: de bzhin nyid shes thams cad nas //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid shes thams cad nas //
translated: And it is characterized by the inexhaustible mastery over things and the cognition of them.🔽The knowledge of reality arises from

original: bsgoms pa las ni yang dag 'byung //🔽sems can kun la rnam kun du //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las ni yang dag 'byung // sems can kun la rnam kun du //
translated: cultivation,🔽and it produces the two in all sentient beings,

original: gnyis bskyed mi zad 'bras bu can //
analyzed: gnyis bskyed mi zad 'bras bu can //
translated: inexhaustibly, in every way.

original: gnyis pa 'di ni rgyu'i don dang 'bras bu'i don las brtsams pa yin te /🔽thams cad nas de bzhin nyid shes pa bsgoms pa ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa 'di ni rgyu'i don dang 'bras bu'i don las brtsams pa yin te / thams cad nas de bzhin nyid shes pa bsgoms pa ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: This second verse is concerned with the meaning of cause and the meaning of result.🔽The cultivation of the knowledge of reality in all ways is the cause of the purification of the realm of the Dharma.

original: thams cad nas zhes pa bya ba ni chos kyi rnam grags kyi sgo thams cad nas so //
analyzed: thams cad nas zhes pa bya ba ni chos kyi rnam grags kyi sgo thams cad nas so //
translated: In all ways means in all the doors of the teaching.

original: sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du phan pa dang bde ba gnyis bskyed pa mi zad pa nyid ni 'bras bu'o //🔽sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul ba'i //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du phan pa dang bde ba gnyis bskyed pa mi zad pa nyid ni 'bras bu'o // sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul ba'i //
translated: The result is the inexhaustibility of the generation of both benefit and happiness for all sentient beings in every way.

original: sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can te //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can te //
translated: The function of the powers is the manifestation of the emanations of body, speech, and mind.🔽The function of the powers is the manifestation of the emanations of body, speech, and mind.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs sgo dang // dpag tu med pa gnyis dang ldan //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs sgo dang // dpag tu med pa gnyis dang ldan //
translated: The powers are endowed with two kinds of immeasurable collections, the collection of concentration and the collection of retention.

original: gsum pa 'di ni phrin las kyi don dang ldan pa'i don las brtsams pa yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa 'di ni phrin las kyi don dang ldan pa'i don las brtsams pa yin te /
translated: The third verse is concerned with the meaning of function and the meaning of endowment.

original: sku la sogs pa rnam pa gsum sprul pa ni phrin las so //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa rnam pa gsum sprul pa ni phrin las so //
translated: The function of the powers is the manifestation of the three kinds of emanations, body, speech, and mind.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dag dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa gnyis dang ldan pa ni ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dag dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa gnyis dang ldan pa ni ldan pa'o //
translated: The endowment of the powers is the possession of two kinds of immeasurable collections, the collection of concentration and the collection of retention.

original: rang bzhin chos rdzogs longs spyod dang // sbrul pa dag gis tha dad 'jug /'di ni sangs rgyas rnam dag gi / chos dbyings rnam par dag par bshad //
analyzed: rang bzhin chos rdzogs longs spyod dang // sbrul pa dag gis tha dad 'jug /'di ni sangs rgyas rnam dag gi / chos dbyings rnam par dag par bshad //
translated: The powers are engaged in the purification of the realm of the buddhas through the Dharma body, the beatific body, and the emanation body.

original: bzhi pa 'di ni 'jug pa'i don las brtsams pa yin te /
analyzed: bzhi pa 'di ni 'jug pa'i don las brtsams pa yin te /
translated: The fourth verse is concerned with the topic of engagement.

original: rang bzhin dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku 'jug pas tha dad du 'jug pa can yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku 'jug pas tha dad du 'jug pa can yin no //
translated: The Buddha's body is differentiated as the three bodies, because of the engagement of the three bodies, the nature body, the beatific body, and the emanation body.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku rab tu dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa bdun no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku rab tu dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa bdun no //
translated: Seven verses on the analysis of the Buddha bodies.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku dbye ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku dbye ba //
translated: The bodies of the buddhas are analyzed as three:

original: rang bzhin longs spyod rdzogs pa dang // gzhan ni sprul pa'i sku yin te //
analyzed: rang bzhin longs spyod rdzogs pa dang // gzhan ni sprul pa'i sku yin te //
translated: the nature body, the beatific body, and the emanation body.

original: dang po gnyis pa'i rten yin no //
analyzed: dang po gnyis pa'i rten yin no //
translated: The first is the basis of the other two.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis sku ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis sku ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The bodies of the buddhas are of three kinds.

original: rang bzhin pa ni chos kyi sku gnas yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin pa ni chos kyi sku gnas yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The nature body is the reality body, characterized by the transformation of the basis.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa ni gang gis 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dag tu chos la longs spyod rdzogs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa ni gang gis 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dag tu chos la longs spyod rdzogs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The beatific body is that by which the buddhas carry out their own aims in the circle of assemblies.

original: sprul pa ni gang gis sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa ni gang gis sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o //
translated: The emanation body is that by which they carry out the aims of others.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa khams kun du //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa khams kun du //
translated: The beatific body is in all the buddha lands.

original: 'khor yongs sdud dang zhing dang mtshan //🔽sku dang chos rdzogs longs spyod dang ; / mdzad pa dag gis tha dad do //
analyzed: 'khor yongs sdud dang zhing dang mtshan // sku dang chos rdzogs longs spyod dang ; / mdzad pa dag gis tha dad do //
translated: The Enjoyment Body is differentiated by the circle of its retinue, by its buddhaverse, by its name, by its body, by its enjoyment of the Teaching, and by its activity.🔽The Enjoyment Body is differentiated by the circle of its retinue, by its buddhaverse, by its name, by its body, by its enjoyment of the Teaching, and by its activity.🔽The Essence Body is considered the cause of the enjoyment of the Dharma by the Enjoyment Body, because it is the support of the powers, etc.
