original: longs spyod rdzogs 'byor rgyur 'dod do //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs 'byor rgyur 'dod do //
translated: The Essence Body is considered the cause of the enjoyment of the Dharma by the Enjoyment Body, because it is the support of the powers, etc

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi sku ni khyad par med pa nyid kyis mnyam pa dang / shes par dka' ba nyid kyis phra ba dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku de dang 'brel pa dang / ji ltar dgyes par longs spyod bstan par bya ba la longs spyod rdzogs pa pa 'byor pa'i rgyu yin no //🔽sangs rgyas sprul pa dpag med pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi sku ni khyad par med pa nyid kyis mnyam pa dang / shes par dka' ba nyid kyis phra ba dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku de dang 'brel pa dang / ji ltar dgyes par longs spyod bstan par bya ba la longs spyod rdzogs pa pa 'byor pa'i rgyu yin no // sangs rgyas sprul pa dpag med pa //
translated: The nature body of all Buddhas is equal, because it is undifferentiated; it is subtle, because it is difficult to know; it is connected with the beatific body; and it is the cause of the mastery of the beatific body, in order to demonstrate the enjoyment of the Dharma as one wishes.

original: sprul pa'i skur ni 'dod pa ste //
analyzed: sprul pa'i skur ni 'dod pa ste //
translated: The emanation body of the Buddhas is considered to be their immeasurable emanations.🔽The beatific body is considered to be the body of the Buddha endowed with the major and minor marks of the perfected being, which is born in the lineage of the Śākyas, etc.,

original: don gnyis phun sum tshogs pa ni //🔽rnam pa thams cad gnyis la gnas //
analyzed: don gnyis phun sum tshogs pa ni // rnam pa thams cad gnyis la gnas //
translated: and which manifests the great enlightenment and final passing away.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku ni sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i bye brag dpag tu med pa'o //🔽longs spyod rdzogs pa ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku ni sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i bye brag dpag tu med pa'o // longs spyod rdzogs pa ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The emanation body is considered to be the body of the Buddha that is born in the lineage of the Cāturmahārājakāyikas, etc.,🔽and which manifests the great enlightenment and final passing away.

original: sprul pa ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sprul pa ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The beatific body is characterized by the fulfillment of one’s own aim, and the emanation body is characterized by the fulfillment of the aims of others.

original: don gnyis phun sum tshogs pa de yang rang bzhin gyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / gnyis la go rims pa bzhin du gnas so //🔽bzo dang skye dang byang chub che //
analyzed: don gnyis phun sum tshogs pa de yang rang bzhin gyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / gnyis la go rims pa bzhin du gnas so // bzo dang skye dang byang chub che //
translated: The emanation body of the buddhas🔽always displays arts, births,

original: mya ngan 'das pa rtag ston pas //🔽sangs rgyas sbrul pa'i sku 'di ni //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa rtag ston pas // sangs rgyas sbrul pa'i sku 'di ni //
translated: great enlightenment, and Nirvana,

original: rnam par grol pa'i thabs chen no //
analyzed: rnam par grol pa'i thabs chen no //
translated: and is the great means of liberation.

original: sbrul pa'i sku de ni rtag tu gdul ba'i don du po wang len pa la sogs pa bzo dang / skya ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa dag gis rnam par grol ba'i thabs chen po yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sbrul pa'i sku de ni rtag tu gdul ba'i don du po wang len pa la sogs pa bzo dang / skya ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa dag gis rnam par grol ba'i thabs chen po yin pa'i phyir //
translated: That emanation body is the great means of liberation, because it always displays arts such as playing the lute for the sake of disciples, birth in a royal family, great enlightenment, and Nirvana.

original: gzhan gyi don du phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //🔽sku gsum dag gis sangs rgyas kyi //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o // sku gsum dag gis sangs rgyas kyi //
translated: It should be understood that it is characterized by the perfection of the aims of others.🔽The bodies of the buddhas

original: sku bsdus par ni shes bya ste //
analyzed: sku bsdus par ni shes bya ste //
translated: should be understood as included in the three bodies.

original: sku gsum dag gis rang bzhin gyi //
analyzed: sku gsum dag gis rang bzhin gyi //
translated: The three bodies of the buddhas🔽should be understood as the three bodies of the Dharma body, the beatific body, and the emanation body.

original: don 'di rten dang bcas par bstan //
analyzed: don 'di rten dang bcas par bstan //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: sku gsum dang gis sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku thams cad bsdus par rig par bya ba la /
analyzed: sku gsum dang gis sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku thams cad bsdus par rig par bya ba la /
translated: It should be understood that the three bodies of the buddhas include all the bodies of the buddhas.

original: sku gsum pa de dag gis kyang rang dang gzhan gyi rton rten dang bcas par bsten te /
analyzed: sku gsum pa de dag gis kyang rang dang gzhan gyi rton rten dang bcas par bsten te /
translated: And those three bodies are shown to have a basis and to be equal in their support and their intention, and in their action.

original: gnyis po ni rang dang gzhan gyi don gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir dang / de gnyis kyang de la brten pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnyis po ni rang dang gzhan gyi don gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir dang / de gnyis kyang de la brten pa'i phyir te /
translated: The first two are distinguished by their function in regard to self and other, and those two are based on the third.

original: ji skad sngar bshad pa bzhin no //🔽da dag @160a * //
analyzed: ji skad sngar bshad pa bzhin no // da dag @160a * //
translated: This is as explained above.🔽They are equal in their support,

original: rten dang dgongs pa dang // phrin las kyis ni mnyam pa nyid //
analyzed: rten dang dgongs pa dang // phrin las kyis ni mnyam pa nyid //
translated: in their intention, and in their action.

original: rang bzhin dang ni rgyun mi 'chad //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ni rgyun mi 'chad //
translated: They are eternal by nature and by continuity.

original: rgyun gyis de dag rtag pa nyid //
analyzed: rgyun gyis de dag rtag pa nyid //
translated: By continuity, they are eternal.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku gsum po de dag gi go rims pa bzhin du rnam pa gsum gyis khyad par med de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku gsum po de dag gi go rims pa bzhin du rnam pa gsum gyis khyad par med de /
translated: The three bodies of all buddhas are without distinction in three ways, respectively:

original: rten gyis ni chos kyi dbyings tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten gyis ni chos kyi dbyings tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in their support, because they are not different in the ultimate realm;

original: dgongs pas ni sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pas ni sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By intention, because the intention of the buddhas is undifferentiated.

original: phrin las kyis ni phrin las thun mongs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phrin las kyis ni phrin las thun mongs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By activity, because their activities are common.

original: sku gsum po de dag la go rims bzhin du gang gis na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sku rtag pa'o zhes brjod pa rtag pa nyid rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste ;
analyzed: sku gsum po de dag la go rims bzhin du gang gis na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sku rtag pa'o zhes brjod pa rtag pa nyid rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste ;
translated: In those three bodies, respectively, the three kinds of eternity of the tathagatas should be understood, because of which it is said that the tathagatas have eternal bodies.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi sku ni rang bzhin gyis rtag pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi rag pa nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi sku ni rang bzhin gyis rtag pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi rag pa nyid do //
translated: The essence body is eternal by nature, because it is eternal by nature.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni rgyun mi 'chad pas te /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni rgyun mi 'chad pas te /
translated: The beatific body is eternal by continuity,

original: chos la longs spyod rdzogs pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos la longs spyod rdzogs pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the enjoyment of the Dharma is uninterrupted.

original: sprul pa'i sku ni rgyun gyis te //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku ni rgyun gyis te //
translated: The emanation body is eternal by a series,

original: mi snang bar byas nas yang dang yang du sprul pa kun tu ston pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: mi snang bar byas nas yang dang yang du sprul pa kun tu ston pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because, having disappeared, it manifests again and again.

original: / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa bcu ste /
analyzed: / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa bcu ste /
translated: Ten verses on the analysis of the gnosis of the Buddha.

original: me long ye shes mi g-yo ste //
analyzed: me long ye shes mi g-yo ste //
translated: Mirror-gnosis is unmoving.

original: ye shes gsum ni de la brten //
analyzed: ye shes gsum ni de la brten //
translated: The three intuitions are based on it.

original: mnyam pa nyid dang so sor rtog / bya ba sgrub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid dang so sor rtog / bya ba sgrub pa kho na'o //
translated: The three intuitions are the intuition of sameness, the intuition of accomplishment of what is to be done, and the intuition of thorough analysis.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The intuition of the buddhas is of four kinds.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The intuition of the buddhas is of four kinds: the mirror-like intuition, the equalizing intuition, the distinguishing intuition, and the allaccomplishing intuition.🔽The mirror-like intuition is unmoving.🔽The three intuitions are based on it and are moving.🔽The mirror-like intuition is without conceptualization,

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: without discrimination,🔽and is the cause of the others.🔽The mirror-like intuition is unmoving.

original: ye shes gsum ni de la brten pa dang g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes gsum ni de la brten pa dang g-yo ba'o //
translated: The three intuitions are based on it and are moving.

original: me long ye shes nga yi med //
analyzed: me long ye shes nga yi med //
translated: The mirror-like intuition is without “mine,”

original: yongs su ma chad rtag tu ldan //
analyzed: yongs su ma chad rtag tu ldan //
translated: without incompleteness, and always present.

original: shes bya kun la ma rmongs la //
analyzed: shes bya kun la ma rmongs la //
translated: It is not confused about all objects of knowledge,

original: rtag tu de la mngon phyogs min //
analyzed: rtag tu de la mngon phyogs min //
translated: but never directly observes them.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni rtag tu nga yi ba med pa dang / yul gyi sgo nas yongs su mchad pa dang / dus kyi sgo nas rtag tu ldan pa dang / rtag tu sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni rtag tu nga yi ba med pa dang / yul gyi sgo nas yongs su mchad pa dang / dus kyi sgo nas rtag tu ldan pa dang / rtag tu sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: The mirror-like intuition is always without “mine,” without the sense of possession, because it is the antidote to the addiction of desire for pleasure. It is without incompleteness, because it is always present in all fields. It is always present, because it is always free from obscurations.

original: shes bya thams cad la ma rmongs pa yang yin la /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la ma rmongs pa yang yin la /
translated: And they are not ignorant of all objects of knowledge.

original: rnam pa med pa'i phyir de dag la mngon du phyogs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i phyir de dag la mngon du phyogs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But they are not directed toward them, because they are devoid of aspects.

original: ye shes kun gyi rgyu mtshan phyir //
analyzed: ye shes kun gyi rgyu mtshan phyir //
translated: Because it is the causal basis of all kinds of knowledge,

original: ye shes 'byung gnas chen po 'dra //
analyzed: ye shes 'byung gnas chen po 'dra //
translated: it is like a great mine of knowledge.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid //
translated: The enjoyment body of a buddha

original: ye shes gzugs brnyan 'byung phyir te //
analyzed: ye shes gzugs brnyan 'byung phyir te //
translated: is the source of the reflection of knowledge.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa de dag gi rnam pa thams cad kyi rgyu @160b yin pa'i phyir ye shes thams cad kyi 'byung gnas lta bu'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa de dag gi rnam pa thams cad kyi rgyu @160b yin pa'i phyir ye shes thams cad kyi 'byung gnas lta bu'o //
translated: Because it is the cause of all the aspects of the knowledge of sameness, etc., it is like a mine of all knowledge.

original: de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang yin la /
analyzed: de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang yin la /
translated: It is also the enjoyment body of a buddha,

original: ye shes kyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ye shes kyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: and because it is the source of the reflection of knowledge,

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes zhes kyang bya'o //🔽sgom pa dag pas sems can la //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes zhes kyang bya'o // sgom pa dag pas sems can la //
translated: it is called mirror knowledge.🔽The knowledge of sameness is held

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes 'dod //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes 'dod //
translated: to be the purity of the meditation on sentient beings.

original: mi gnas zhi bar zhugs pa ni //
analyzed: mi gnas zhi bar zhugs pa ni //
translated: The entry into the peace that does not abide

original: mnyam nyid ye shes yin par 'dod //
analyzed: mnyam nyid ye shes yin par 'dod //
translated: is held to be the knowledge of sameness.

original: byang chub sems dpas mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na sems can rnams la mnyam pa nyid kyi shes pa thob pa gang yin pa de sgom pa dag pa'i sgo nas byang chub thob pa'i dus na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par zhugs pa ni mnyam pa
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na sems can rnams la mnyam pa nyid kyi shes pa thob pa gang yin pa de sgom pa dag pa'i sgo nas byang chub thob pa'i dus na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par zhugs pa ni mnyam pa
translated: The equality of the bodhisattva at the time of realization with regard to sentient beings is asserted to be the gnosis of equality at the time of attaining enlightenment through the purity of meditation.

original: nyid kyi ye shes su 'dod do //
analyzed: nyid kyi ye shes su 'dod do //
translated: It is the entry into nonabiding nirvana.

original: dus rnams kun tu byams pa dang // thugs rje chen po dag dang ldan //🔽sems can rnams la mos pa bzhin //
analyzed: dus rnams kun tu byams pa dang // thugs rje chen po dag dang ldan // sems can rnams la mos pa bzhin //
translated: It is endowed with great love and compassion at all times.

original: sangs rgyas sku ni nges par ston //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sku ni nges par ston //
translated: The body of the Buddha definitely teaches sentient beings🔽in accordance with their aspirations.

original: dus thams cad du byams pa chen po dang / thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa dang / sems can rnams la mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sku nges par ston par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: dus thams cad du byams pa chen po dang / thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa dang / sems can rnams la mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sku nges par ston par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: It is endowed with great love and great compassion at all times and it definitely teaches sentient beings the body of the Buddha in accordance with their aspirations.🔽Thus some sentient beings see the Tathagata as blue,

original: 'di ltar sems can kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa kha dog sngon por /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa kha dog sngon por /
translated: some as yellow,

original: kha cig gis ni kha dog ser por mthong ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //🔽so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni kha dog ser por mthong ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o // so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni //
translated: Some see it as yellow, and so on.🔽Discerning wisdom

original: shes bya kun la rtag mi thogs //
analyzed: shes bya kun la rtag mi thogs //
translated: is never obstructed with regard to all that is to be known.🔽It is like a treasure

original: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs rnams kyi //🔽gter dang 'dra ba kho na yin //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs rnams kyi // gter dang 'dra ba kho na yin //
translated: of meditative absorptions and powers of retention.

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su ni //
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su ni //
translated: In the midst of the circle of the assembly

original: 'byor ba thams cad ston mdzad pa //
analyzed: 'byor ba thams cad ston mdzad pa //
translated: it reveals all powers.

original: the tshom thams cad gcod pa yi //
analyzed: the tshom thams cad gcod pa yi //
translated: It cuts through all doubts

original: chos chen char ni rab tu 'bebs //
analyzed: chos chen char ni rab tu 'bebs //
translated: and causes the rain of the great teaching to fall.

original: so sor tog pa'i ye shes ni tshigs su bcad pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: so sor tog pa'i ye shes ni tshigs su bcad pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: Discerning wisdom is as described in the verse.

original: bya ba bsgrub pa'i ye shes ni //🔽khams rnams kun tu sna tshogs shing //
analyzed: bya ba bsgrub pa'i ye shes ni // khams rnams kun tu sna tshogs shing //
translated: Accomplishing activities🔽through various,🔽incalculable, inconceivable emanations

original: dpag med bsam yas sbrul pa yis //
analyzed: dpag med bsam yas sbrul pa yis //
translated: in all the realms,

original: sems can don ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sems can don ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: it accomplishes the aims of beings.

original: bya ba bsgrub pa'i ye shes ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sbrul pa rnams pa sna tshogs dpag tu med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag gis sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa //
analyzed: bya ba bsgrub pa'i ye shes ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sbrul pa rnams pa sna tshogs dpag tu med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag gis sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa //
translated: The gnosis of accomplishing activities is the performance of the aims of all sentient beings by means of the various, infinite, inconceivable emanations in all worldly realms.

original: sangs rgyas sprul pa de rtag tu //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sprul pa de rtag tu //
translated: That buddha emanation is always🔽inconceivable in every way🔽in terms of the particulars of its activities,

original: mdzad pa grub pa'i bye brag dang // grangs dang zhing gis rnam kun tu //🔽bsam mi khyab par shes par bya //🔽sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa de ni rtag tu bya ba mdzad pa'i bye brag dang grangs dang zhing gi sgo nas rnam pa thams cad du bsam @161a * //
analyzed: mdzad pa grub pa'i bye brag dang // grangs dang zhing gis rnam kun tu // bsam mi khyab par shes par bya // sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa de ni rtag tu bya ba mdzad pa'i bye brag dang grangs dang zhing gi sgo nas rnam pa thams cad du bsam @161a * //
translated: its number, and its realms.

original: gyis mi khyab par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gyis mi khyab par rig par bya'o //
translated: That buddha emanation is always to be understood as inconceivable in every way in terms of the particulars of its activities, its number, and its realms.🔽The four gnoses arise

original: 'dzin pa'i phyir dang sems mnyam phyir //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i phyir dang sems mnyam phyir //
translated: from retention, from the equality of mind,🔽from the perfect teaching of the Dharma,

original: yang dag chos rab ston phyir dang // bya ba sgrub pa nyid kyi phyir //🔽ye shes bzhi po yang dag 'byung //
analyzed: yang dag chos rab ston phyir dang // bya ba sgrub pa nyid kyi phyir // ye shes bzhi po yang dag 'byung //
translated: and from the accomplishment of activities.

original: de la 'dzin pa'i phyir ni thos pa'i chos rnams la'o //
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa'i phyir ni thos pa'i chos rnams la'o //
translated: From retention, that is, of what one has heard, concerning the Dharma.

original: sems mnyam pa'i phyir ni sems can thams cad la bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sems mnyam pa'i phyir ni sems can thams cad la bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Because of the equality of mind, because of the equality of self and others.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: sangs rgyas gcig pa nyid dang / du ma nyid ma yin pa'i tshigs su bcad pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gcig pa nyid dang / du ma nyid ma yin pa'i tshigs su bcad pa //
translated: One verse on the nononeness and nonmultiplicity of the buddhas

original: tha dad rigs don yod phyir dang // rdzogs dang thog ma med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: tha dad rigs don yod phyir dang // rdzogs dang thog ma med pa'i phyir //
translated: 1. They are not one, because of the difference in lineages, because of the meaningfulness of the plural, and because of the perfection and beginninglessness.

original: sangs rgyas gcig min dri med gnas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gcig min dri med gnas //
translated: The buddhas are not one, because of the difference in lineages, because of the meaningfulness of the plural, and because of the perfection and beginninglessness of the buddhas.

original: tha dad min phyir mang po'ang min //
analyzed: tha dad min phyir mang po'ang min //
translated: They are not many, because of the nondifference.

original: sangs rgyas ni gcig kho na'o zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni gcig kho na'o zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dod do //
translated: It is accepted that the buddhas are not one.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi gsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs don med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi gsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs don med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the accumulations of merit and knowledge of other bodhisattvas would be meaningless.

original: don med par ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don med par ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that they be meaningless.🔽Therefore, because they are not meaningless, they do not fully awaken.

original: de lta bas na don med pa ma yin pa'i phyir yang rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o zhes bya ba 'di ci'i phyir mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na don med pa ma yin pa'i phyir yang rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o zhes bya ba 'di ci'i phyir mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
translated: Why is it that they do not fully awaken?

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs don med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs don med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And the merit and knowledge accumulations of other bodhisattvas would be meaningless.

original: don med par ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don med par ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that they would be meaningless.

original: de lta bas na don med pa ma yin pa'i phyir yang sangs rgyas gcig kho na ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na don med pa ma yin pa'i phyir yang sangs rgyas gcig kho na ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because they are not meaningless, there is not just one buddha.

original: su yang rgyas nyid la mi 'god pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sems can gyi don mdzad pa yang rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: su yang rgyas nyid la mi 'god pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sems can gyi don mdzad pa yang rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And because no one would be established in buddhahood, the buddhas’ work for the sake of sentient beings would not be complete.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not logical.

original: tshogs med par yang sangs rgyas nyid du mi rung la //
analyzed: tshogs med par yang sangs rgyas nyid du mi rung la //
translated: And without a collection, buddhahood is not possible.

original: sangs rgyas gzhan me dpar yang tshogs mi rung ba'i phyir thog ma'i sangs rgyas 'ga' yang med pas thog ma med pa'i phyir yang sangs rgyas gcig tu rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzhan me dpar yang tshogs mi rung ba'i phyir thog ma'i sangs rgyas 'ga' yang med pas thog ma med pa'i phyir yang sangs rgyas gcig tu rig pa ma yin no //
translated: And because without another buddha, a collection is not possible, there is no first buddha at all. Therefore, because there is no beginning, it is not known that there is one buddha.

original: zag pa me dpa'i dbyings na chos kyi sku la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: zag pa me dpa'i dbyings na chos kyi sku la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: And because in the uncontaminated realm, there is no difference in the Dharma body of the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku mang po nyid du yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku mang po nyid du yang mi 'dod do //
translated: we do not assert that the buddhas have many bodies.

original: sangs rgyas nyid la 'jug pa'i thabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa bzhi'o //🔽med pa gang yin de nyid ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la 'jug pa'i thabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa bzhi'o // med pa gang yin de nyid ni //
translated: Four verses on the method of entering into buddhahood.

original: yod pa yi ni dam pa yin //🔽rnam pa kun tu mi dmigs pa //
analyzed: yod pa yi ni dam pa yin // rnam pa kun tu mi dmigs pa //
translated: That which does not exist is the highest existence;

original: dmigs pa yi ni mchog tu 'dod //🔽kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du med pa gang yin pa de nyid yong su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i dam pa yin la /
analyzed: dmigs pa yi ni mchog tu 'dod // kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du med pa gang yin pa de nyid yong su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i dam pa yin la /
translated: that which is not apprehended at all is the highest apprehension.🔽That which does not exist as the imagined reality is the highest existence as the perfected reality.

original: @161b kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i mchog yin no //🔽sgom pa rnam par mi lta ba'i //
analyzed: @161b kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i mchog yin no // sgom pa rnam par mi lta ba'i //
translated: And that which is not apprehended at all as the imagined reality is the highest nonapprehension as the perfected reality.

original: sgom pa dam par 'dod pa ste //🔽thob par lta ba med rnams kyi //
analyzed: sgom pa dam par 'dod pa ste // thob par lta ba med rnams kyi //
translated: The meditation of the nonapprehension of meditation is the highest meditation;

original: thob pa yang ni dam par 'dod //
analyzed: thob pa yang ni dam par 'dod //
translated: the attainment of the nonapprehension of attainment is the highest attainment.

original: sgom pa mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid sgom pa dam pa yin la /
analyzed: sgom pa mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid sgom pa dam pa yin la /
translated: The meditation of the nonapprehension of meditation is the highest meditation.

original: thob pa'i mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid thob pa dam pa yin no //
analyzed: thob pa'i mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid thob pa dam pa yin no //
translated: And the attainment of the nonapprehension of attainment is the highest attainment.

original: bla ma ring dang mtshan ma dang // bdag gis brtson 'grus lta ba yi //
analyzed: bla ma ring dang mtshan ma dang // bdag gis brtson 'grus lta ba yi //
translated: The teacher, the time, the signs,🔽and one’s own diligence are the four views.🔽

original: byang chub sems dpa' nga rgyal can //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nga rgyal can //
translated: The bodhisattvas who are proud

original: byang chub las ni ring zhes bya //
analyzed: byang chub las ni ring zhes bya //
translated: are said to be far from enlightenment.🔽Those who regard buddhahood as something superior, endowed with wondrous qualities,🔽who regard the time required for its perfect attainment as long,

original: gang dag sangs rgyas nyid la bla ma ya mtshan gyi chos dang ldan par lta ba dang / de yang dag par 'grub par bya ba dus ring bar lta ba dang / mtshan ma ste sems kyi dmigs par lta ba dang / bdag gis brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag sangs rgyas nyid la bla ma ya mtshan gyi chos dang ldan par lta ba dang / de yang dag par 'grub par bya ba dus ring bar lta ba dang / mtshan ma ste sems kyi dmigs par lta ba dang / bdag gis brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin te /
translated: who regard the signs, that is, the mental objects,🔽and who regard their own efforts as sufficient, thinking,🔽“I will attain buddhahood through my own efforts,”

original: sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya'o zhes bdag nyid kyi brtson 'grus su lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' nga rgyal can de lta bu de dag ni dmigs pa can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya'o zhes bdag nyid kyi brtson 'grus su lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' nga rgyal can de lta bu de dag ni dmigs pa can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: are proud bodhisattvas.🔽Because they have concepts,

original: byang chub las ring ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub las ring ba zhes bya'o //
translated: they are said to be far from enlightenment.

original: ji skad bshad pa 'di dag kun //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa 'di dag kun //
translated: All these things that have been explained

original: rtog ba tsam du lta ba yi //
analyzed: rtog ba tsam du lta ba yi //
translated: are seen to be mere conceptual thoughts.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rtogs med rnams //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rtogs med rnams //
translated: The bodhisattvas who are free of concepts

original: byang chub thob ces nges par brjod //
analyzed: byang chub thob ces nges par brjod //
translated: It is said that they attain enlightenment.🔽All of these are mere conceptualization.

original: 'di dag thams cad ni rtog pa tsam zhes bya bar lta ba rnams ni rtog pa tsam de la yang mi rtog pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rtog pa med pa rnams ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i gnas skabs na don du byang chub
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni rtog pa tsam zhes bya bar lta ba rnams ni rtog pa tsam de la yang mi rtog pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rtog pa med pa rnams ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i gnas skabs na don du byang chub
translated: The bodhisattvas who see that do not conceptualize even mere conceptualization, and so it is said that they attain the acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: 'thob pa dang 'dra ba nges par brjod do /
analyzed: 'thob pa dang 'dra ba nges par brjod do /
translated: At that time, they are like those who have attained enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas rnams phan tshun mdzad pa gcig pa nyid la tshig su bcad pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams phan tshun mdzad pa gcig pa nyid la tshig su bcad pa bzhi'o //
translated: Four verses on the mutual sameness of the deeds of the buddhas

original: klung dag sa yi 'og tu ma song ba //
analyzed: klung dag sa yi 'og tu ma song ba //
translated: Rivers, not going underground,

original: gnas rnams tha dad chu yang tha dad ba //
analyzed: gnas rnams tha dad chu yang tha dad ba //
translated: would have different locations and different waters,

original: chu yang zhing bya ba tha dad byed //
analyzed: chu yang zhing bya ba tha dad byed //
translated: would have little water and do different works,

original: chur gnas srog chags phra mo'i nyer spyad 'gyur //
analyzed: chur gnas srog chags phra mo'i nyer spyad 'gyur //
translated: and would be used by small water creatures.

original: rgya mtshor song bar gyur na thams cad kyang //
analyzed: rgya mtshor song bar gyur na thams cad kyang //
translated: But when they reach the ocean, all🔽have the same location, the same great water, do the same work,

original: gnas rnams gcig cing chu yang che la gcig / bya ba gcig cing chu la gnas pa yi //
analyzed: gnas rnams gcig cing chu yang che la gcig / bya ba gcig cing chu la gnas pa yi //
translated: and are used by great water creatures.

original: srog chags mang po'i rtag tu nye spyad che //
analyzed: srog chags mang po'i rtag tu nye spyad che //
translated: The great support of many beings.

original: sangs rgyas nyid du ma zhugs brtan pa rnams //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du ma zhugs brtan pa rnams //
translated: The steadfast who have not yet entered buddhahood

original: rten kyang thad blo gros tha dang cing //
analyzed: rten kyang thad blo gros tha dang cing //
translated: have different supports, different understandings,

original: rtogs chung rang gi bya ba tha dad la //
analyzed: rtogs chung rang gi bya ba tha dad la //
translated: and different activities, with little realization,

original: sems can nying don rtog tu nyer spyad 'gyur //
analyzed: sems can nying don rtog tu nyer spyad 'gyur //
translated: and are the support of beings’ mere individual aims.

original: sangs rgyas nyid du zhugs na de dag kun //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du zhugs na de dag kun //
translated: But when they have entered buddhahood, all of them

original: rten kyang gcig @162a * //
analyzed: rten kyang gcig @162a * //
translated: have the same support,

original: cing rtogs pa che la gcig / mdzad pa gcig tu 'dres shing rtag par yang /
analyzed: cing rtogs pa che la gcig / mdzad pa gcig tu 'dres shing rtag par yang /
translated: the same great understanding, the same activity,

original: sems can tshogs che'i nye bar spyad pa che //
analyzed: sems can tshogs che'i nye bar spyad pa che //
translated: and are the great support of the multitude of beings.

original: de la klung gi gnas tha dad pa ni rang gi snod tha dad phyir ro //
analyzed: de la klung gi gnas tha dad pa ni rang gi snod tha dad phyir ro //
translated: The different locations of the rivers are due to their different vessels.

original: bya ba byed pa tha dad pa nyid du byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽phra mo'i nye bar spyad pa zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa tha dad pa nyid du byed pa'i phyir ro // phra mo'i nye bar spyad pa zhes bya ba ni //
translated: They are different in their activities, because they perform different functions.🔽The individual aims of beings are their individual aims.

original: chung ngu rnams kyi nye bar spyad pa'o //
analyzed: chung ngu rnams kyi nye bar spyad pa'o //
translated: The great support of the multitude of beings is the great support.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: sangs rgyas nyid la spro bar bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la spro bar bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa //
translated: One verse on enthusiasm for buddhahood itself.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas nyid ni dkar po chos //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas nyid ni dkar po chos //
translated: Thus, buddhahood is the perfection of good qualities,

original: dpe med ldan phyir phan bde'i rgyu yi phyir //
analyzed: dpe med ldan phyir phan bde'i rgyu yi phyir //
translated: because it possesses incomparable virtues, because it is the cause of benefit and happiness,

original: bde dge dam pa mi zad 'byung gnas phyir //
analyzed: bde dge dam pa mi zad 'byung gnas phyir //
translated: because it is the inexhaustible source of the highest bliss and virtue,

original: blo ldan byang chub sems dge blang ba'i rigs //
analyzed: blo ldan byang chub sems dge blang ba'i rigs //
translated: the wise should take up the thought of awakening.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas nyid ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pas dkar po'i chos dpe med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pas phan pa dang bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / bde bar gnas pa'i khyad par gyis bde ba kha na ma thob med pa mchog zad mi shes pa'i 'byung gnas yin pa'i phyir blo dang ldan pas der smon pa yongs su gzung ba'i sgo nas byang chub kyi sems blang ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas nyid ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pas dkar po'i chos dpe med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pas phan pa dang bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / bde bar gnas pa'i khyad par gyis bde ba kha na ma thob med pa mchog zad mi shes pa'i 'byung gnas yin pa'i phyir blo dang ldan pas der smon pa yongs su gzung ba'i sgo nas byang chub kyi sems blang ba'i rigs so //
translated: Thus, buddhahood is the perfection of one's own goal because it possesses incomparable virtues, and it is the perfection of the goal of others because it is the cause of benefit and happiness. And it is the inexhaustible source of the highest bliss and virtue, because it is the special abode of bliss. Therefore, the wise should take up the thought of awakening by means of taking up the aspiration for that.

original: byang chub kyi skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: byang chub kyi skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on awakening is complete.

original: // / sdom ni dang po sgrub skyabs rig //
analyzed: // / sdom ni dang po sgrub skyabs rig //
translated: The summary: the first, practice, refuge, knowledge,

original: de bzhin du ni sems bskyed dang // rang gzhan don dang de nyid don //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni sems bskyed dang // rang gzhan don dang de nyid don //
translated: Likewise, the generation of the will, the aims of self and other, reality,

original: mthu dang yongs smin byang chub bo //🔽byang chub kyi skabs 'di dang po nas bzung ste /
analyzed: mthu dang yongs smin byang chub bo // byang chub kyi skabs 'di dang po nas bzung ste /
translated: power, and maturity are the topics of enlightenment.

original: ril gyis byang chub kyi le'u rjes su 'brangs te sbyar bar khong du chung par bya'o //
analyzed: ril gyis byang chub kyi le'u rjes su 'brangs te sbyar bar khong du chung par bya'o //
translated: From this point on in the chapter on enlightenment, the whole discussion should be understood as following the chapter on the bodhisattvas' stages.

original: mos pa rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
analyzed: mos pa rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
translated: Two verses on the analysis of devoted interest🔽. Interest is considered in terms of its origin, non origin,🔽grasp, possession, acquisition,

original: skye dang ma skyes 'dzin dang gzung gyur dang // grogs blangs bdag nyid dang ni nor pa dang // ma nor gzhan dang mngon sum ma yin gzhan //
analyzed: skye dang ma skyes 'dzin dang gzung gyur dang // grogs blangs bdag nyid dang ni nor pa dang // ma nor gzhan dang mngon sum ma yin gzhan //
translated: non possession, error, non error,

original: sgras byung tshol ba dang ni lta ba ba'o //
analyzed: sgras byung tshol ba dang ni lta ba ba'o //
translated: verbal, investigative, and viewing.

original: skyes pa ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'o //
analyzed: skyes pa ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'o //
translated: Origin is past and present.

original: ma skyes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: Non origin is future.

original: 'dzin pa ni nang gi ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni nang gi ste /
translated: Grasp is internal,

original: gang gis dmigs pa la mos par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis dmigs pa la mos par byed pa'o //
translated: that by which one grasps an object of devoted interest.

original: gzung par gyur pa ni //
analyzed: gzung par gyur pa ni //
translated: Possession is external,🔽that which is the object of devoted interest.

original: phyi rol gyi sde gang la dmigs pa nyid du mos pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sde gang la dmigs pa nyid du mos pa'o //
translated: Acquisition is from another,🔽that which is aroused by the teaching of another.🔽Non acquisition is from oneself,🔽that which is not aroused by the teaching of another.🔽Error is non manifest,🔽that which is not in conformity with the scriptures.🔽Non error is manifest,🔽that which is in conformity with the scriptures.🔽Verbal is that which is based on words.🔽Investigative is that which is based on investigation.🔽Viewing is that which is based on views.

original: grogs po las blangs pa ni rags pa'o //
analyzed: grogs po las blangs pa ni rags pa'o //
translated: That which is taken from a friend is gross.

original: bdag nyid las byung ba ni phra ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid las byung ba ni phra ba'o //
translated: That which arises from oneself is subtle.

original: nor pa ni dman pa ste log pa rmos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor pa ni dman pa ste log pa rmos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is mistaken is inferior, because it is cultivated wrongly.

original: ma nor ni gya nom ba'o //
analyzed: ma nor ni gya nom ba'o //
translated: That which is not mistaken is excellent.

original: mngon sum ba ni nye ba ste /
analyzed: mngon sum ba ni nye ba ste /
translated: That which is direct is near,

original: rkyen nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because its conditions are near.

original: mngon @162b sum ma yin pa ni ring ste bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: mngon @162b sum ma yin pa ni ring ste bzlog pa'o //
translated: That which is not direct is distant, because it is the opposite of that.

original: sgra las byang ba ni thos pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sgra las byang ba ni thos pa las byung ba'o //
translated: That which is purified by sound is derived from hearing.

original: tshol ba pa ni bsags pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: tshol ba pa ni bsags pa las byung ba'o //
translated: That which is sought is derived from contemplation.

original: lta ba pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba ste so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba ste so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is viewed is derived from meditation, because it is discernment.

original: 'phrog sdang 'dres dang mi mthun phyogs ma 'dres //
analyzed: 'phrog sdang 'dres dang mi mthun phyogs ma 'dres //
translated: 10. Seized, hostile, mixed, unopposed,🔽inferior, vast, obscured, unobscured,

original: dman dang rgya che bsgribs dang ma bsgrib dang// brtson dang ma brtson bsags dang ma bsags pa //
analyzed: dman dang rgya che bsgribs dang ma bsgrib dang// brtson dang ma brtson bsags dang ma bsags pa //
translated: diligent, non-diligent, accumulated, unaccumulated,

original: brtan zhugs ring du song ba'i mos pa'o //
analyzed: brtan zhugs ring du song ba'i mos pa'o //
translated: firmly engaged, and far-reaching are the convictions.

original: 'phrogs pa ni chung ngu'o //
analyzed: 'phrogs pa ni chung ngu'o //
translated: That which is seized is small.

original: 'dres pa ni 'bring po'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa ni 'bring po'o //
translated: That which is mixed is middling.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams dang ma 'dres ba ni chen po'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams dang ma 'dres ba ni chen po'o //
translated: Unmixed with adverse elements is the great.

original: dman pa ni theg pa gzhan la'o //
analyzed: dman pa ni theg pa gzhan la'o //
translated: Inferior is that of the other vehicles.

original: rgya chen po ni theg pa chen po la'o //
analyzed: rgya chen po ni theg pa chen po la'o //
translated: Vast is that of the Great Vehicle.

original: bsgribs pa ni khyad par du 'gro bar bya ba la sgrib pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bsgribs pa ni khyad par du 'gro bar bya ba la sgrib pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Obstructed is that which is accompanied by obstacles to advancement.

original: ma bsgribs pa ni sgrib pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa ni sgrib pa med pa'o //
translated: Unobstructed is that which is free of obstacles.

original: brtson pa ni rtag tu dang gus par byas te sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson pa ni rtag tu dang gus par byas te sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Diligent is that of one who is always and respectfully engaged.

original: mi brtson pa ni de dag dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mi brtson pa ni de dag dang bral ba'o //
translated: Non-diligent is the opposite.

original: bsags pa ni rtog par rung ba'o //
analyzed: bsags pa ni rtog par rung ba'o //
translated: Accumulated is that which is ready for realization.

original: ma bsags pa ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: ma bsags pa ni bzlog pa'o //
translated: Unaccumulated is the opposite.

original: brtan par zhugs pa ni sa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: brtan par zhugs pa ni sa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: Engaged is that of one who has entered the stages.

original: ring du song ba ni sa lhag ma rnams la'o //
analyzed: ring du song ba ni sa lhag ma rnams la'o //
translated: Far-reaching is that of one on the remaining stages.

original: mos ba'i bar du gcod pa la tshigs su bcad pa gsum mo //
analyzed: mos ba'i bar du gcod pa la tshigs su bcad pa gsum mo //
translated: Three verses on the hindrances to aspiration.🔽Abundant forgetfulness, laziness, confusion of yoga,🔽bad companionship, weakness of virtue,

original: yid la mi byed mang pa dang / le lo rnal 'byor 'khrugs pa dang // grogs ngan dge ba zhan pa dang // tshul bzhin ma yin yid la byed //
analyzed: yid la mi byed mang pa dang / le lo rnal 'byor 'khrugs pa dang // grogs ngan dge ba zhan pa dang // tshul bzhin ma yin yid la byed //
translated: and improper mental orientation.

original: skyes pa la ni yid la me byed pa mang ba bar du gcod do //
analyzed: skyes pa la ni yid la me byed pa mang ba bar du gcod do //
translated: For the born, the obstacle is the abundance of mental activity.

original: ma skyes pa la ni le lo'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa la ni le lo'o //
translated: For the unborn, it is laziness.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par gyur pa la ni rnal 'byor 'khrus pa ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par gyur pa la ni rnal 'byor 'khrus pa ste /
translated: For the one who has taken up the practice, the obstacle is the defilement of yoga,

original: de kho na bzhin du mngon par zhe na pa'i phyir ro //🔽grogs po las blangs pa ni //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du mngon par zhe na pa'i phyir ro // grogs po las blangs pa ni //
translated: because of the attachment to the object and subject.🔽For the one who has taken up the practice through a friend, the obstacle is a bad friend,

original: grogs po ngan pa ste log par 'dzin du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grogs po ngan pa ste log par 'dzin du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the false guidance.

original: bdag nyid mos pa la ni dge ba'i rtsa ba nyam chung ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid mos pa la ni dge ba'i rtsa ba nyam chung ba'o //
translated: For the one who has taken up the practice through faith, the obstacle is the weakness of the roots of good.

original: ma nor ba la ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa bar du gtsang de /
analyzed: ma nor ba la ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa bar du gtsang de /
translated: For the one who has taken up the practice without error, the obstacle is incorrect mental attention,

original: de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is opposed to that.

original: bag med pa dang thos pa nyung //
analyzed: bag med pa dang thos pa nyung //
translated: Negligence and little learning,

original: thos dang bsam pa nyung ngus chog //🔽zhi ba tsam gyis nga rgyal dang // de bzhin ma 'dris yin par 'dod /
analyzed: thos dang bsam pa nyung ngus chog // zhi ba tsam gyis nga rgyal dang // de bzhin ma 'dris yin par 'dod /
translated: satisfaction with little learning and reflection,🔽pride in mere calm, and likewise, non-cultivation,

original: mngon sum pa la ni bag med pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum pa la ni bag med pa ste /
translated: are considered obstacles for the one who has taken up the practice through direct realization.🔽For the one who has taken up the practice through direct realization, the obstacle is negligence,

original: de ni bag yod pas byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bag yod pas byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accomplished through heedlessness.

original: sgra las byung ba ni thos pa nyung ba ste /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba ni thos pa nyung ba ste /
translated: For the one who has taken up the practice through the scriptures, the obstacle is little learning,🔽because it is accomplished through little learning.

original: nges pa'i don gyi mdo ma thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyi mdo ma thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have not heard the sutras of the ultimate meaning.

original: tshol ba ba la ni thos tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa dang bsam nyung dus chog par 'dzin pa'o //🔽lta ba pa la ni bsam pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa @163a * //
analyzed: tshol ba ba la ni thos tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa dang bsam nyung dus chog par 'dzin pa'o // lta ba pa la ni bsam pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa @163a * //
translated: Those who seek the Dharma are satisfied with just hearing it and with just a little reflection.🔽Those who have views are satisfied with just reflection and with just serenity.

analyzed: dang ; zhi gnas tsam gyis mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'o //
